original: @1b # // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las nyan thos kyi sa /
analyzed: @1b # // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las nyan thos kyi sa /
translated: Śrāvakabhūmi

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: First chapter

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: nyan thos kyis thams cad kyi bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis thams cad kyi bsdus pa'i sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The summary verse on the entire śrāvaka stage:

original: rigs dang gang zag rnams dang ni //
analyzed: rigs dang gang zag rnams dang ni //
translated: Lineage, persons,

original: nges par sbyor dang 'jig rten pa //🔽'jig rten 'das pa 'di la ni //
analyzed: nges par sbyor dang 'jig rten pa // 'jig rten 'das pa 'di la ni //
translated: definite entry, mundane,🔽supramundane—

original: mdor na sa ni 'di dag go //🔽sdom ni / rigs dang 'jug dang nges 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: mdor na sa ni 'di dag go // sdom ni / rigs dang 'jug dang nges 'byung ba'i //
translated: in brief, these are the stages.🔽The summary:

original: ming du byas pa'i sa gsum mo //🔽de dag rnams ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: ming du byas pa'i sa gsum mo // de dag rnams ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: The stages are named after lineage, entry, and definite emergence.🔽In brief,

original: nyan thos kyi ni sa zhes bya //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ni sa zhes bya //
translated: they are called the śrāvaka stages.

original: rigs kyis sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyis sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage of lineage?

original: smras pa / rigs gang yin pa dang / rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa dang / rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rtags gang yin pa dang / rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rigs kyi sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rigs gang yin pa dang / rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa dang / rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rtags gang yin pa dang / rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rigs kyi sa zhes bya'o //
translated: He replied: “The stage of the spiritual lineage is the totality of all those who are endowed with the spiritual lineage, the spiritual lineage itself, the classification of the spiritual lineage and the signs of the person who is endowed with the spiritual lineage.

original: de la rigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the spiritual lineage?

original: smras pa / rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gi sa bon gyi chos gang yin pa ste /🔽gang @2a * //
analyzed: smras pa / rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gi sa bon gyi chos gang yin pa ste / gang @2a * //
translated: He replied: “The spiritual lineage is the seed of the person who is endowed with the spiritual lineage.🔽It is that which exists and is not non-existent.

original: yod cing med pa ma yin la rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rkyen yang rnyed na /
analyzed: yod cing med pa ma yin la rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rkyen yang rnyed na /
translated: When the conditions are obtained by the person who is endowed with the spiritual lineage,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / reg par nus shing mthu yod par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / reg par nus shing mthu yod par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: it is possible and has the capacity to attain nirvāṇa and to make contact with it.

original: rigs de'i ming gi rnam grangs dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs de'i ming gi rnam grangs dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the synonyms for the spiritual lineage?

original: sa bon dang / khams dang / rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs dag yin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang / khams dang / rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs dag yin no //
translated: The synonyms are: seed, element and nature.

original: 'od na rigs de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'od na rigs de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the essential nature of the spiritual lineage?

original: de ni lus las khyad par du gyur pa dang ; skye mched drug gis zin pa dang / chos nyid kyis 'thob pa dang / thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa de lta bu yin te /🔽gang la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni lus las khyad par du gyur pa dang ; skye mched drug gis zin pa dang / chos nyid kyis 'thob pa dang / thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa de lta bu yin te / gang la 'di lta ste /
translated: It is distinguished from the body, it is included in the six sense spheres, it is obtained naturally, and it has come down from beginningless time.

original: rigs dang / sa bon dang / khams dang / rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i ming gi rnams grangs 'di dag yod pa de ni rigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs dang / sa bon dang / khams dang / rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i ming gi rnams grangs 'di dag yod pa de ni rigs zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called gotra, seed, element, and nature.

original: rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni gang /
analyzed: rigs kyi rnam par gzhag pa ni gang /
translated: What is the definition of gotra?

original: rigs de phra ba'am /
analyzed: rigs de phra ba'am /
translated: Is it subtle or gross?

original: rigs pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Should it be called gotra?

original: smras pa / phra ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / phra ba zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be called subtle.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: sa bon des 'bras bu ma bskyed cing 'bras bu ma grub na ni des na de phra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon des 'bras bu ma bskyed cing 'bras bu ma grub na ni des na de phra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because when that seed has not yet produced a fruit, or when the fruit has not yet been accomplished, then it is called subtle.

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu bskyed cing 'bras bu grub par gyur pa de'i tshe na ni sa bo na gang yin pa de @2b dang 'bras bu gang yin pa de gcig tu bsdus nas de'i phyir rigs de rgas pa zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //🔽'o na ci rigs de rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa zhig gam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu bskyed cing 'bras bu grub par gyur pa de'i tshe na ni sa bo na gang yin pa de @2b dang 'bras bu gang yin pa de gcig tu bsdus nas de'i phyir rigs de rgas pa zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro // 'o na ci rigs de rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa zhig gam /
translated: When it produces an effect and the effect is established, then the seed and the effect are included in one, and therefore that type is understood to be old.

original: 'on te rgyud du mar gtogs par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyud du mar gtogs par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Now, should that type be said to belong to a single continuum or to many continua?

original: smras pa / rgyud gcig tu gtogs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyud gcig tu gtogs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: It should be said to belong to a single continuum.

original: ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: smras pa / chos gang dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang dngos po tha dad par 'jug pa de dag ni so sor rang gi rgyud sna tshogs dang 'jug pa sna tshogs su ston par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / chos gang dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang dngos po tha dad par 'jug pa de dag ni so sor rang gi rgyud sna tshogs dang 'jug pa sna tshogs su ston par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is said: Those phenomena that operate with different characteristics and different things show various individual continua and various operations.

original: sa bon de ni skye mched drug po de dag las logs shig na tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med de thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i skye mched drug po de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs de la rigs dang /
analyzed: sa bon de ni skye mched drug po de dag las logs shig na tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid med de thog ma med pa'i dus nas brgyud de 'ongs pa dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'i skye mched drug po de lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs de la rigs dang /
translated: The state of the six sense spheres that are obtained by the nature of reality is called a “potential,”

original: sa bon dang / khams /
analyzed: sa bon dang / khams /
translated: a “seed,”

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i ming dang / tha snyad de dag btags par zad pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i ming dang / tha snyad de dag btags par zad pas /
translated: and “nature,” and those terms are merely imputed.

original: de'i phyir de ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni rgyud gcig tu gtogs pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is called “belonging to the same continuum.”

original: / smras pa /
analyzed: / smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yin la /
analyzed: gal te rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can yin la /
translated: If you think that those persons who possess the potential are those who have the quality of attaining nirvana

original: rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa rnams ni /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa ma yin pa rnams ni /
translated: and that those who do not possess the potential

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin par lta na /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can ma yin par lta na /
translated: are those who do not have the quality of attaining nirvana,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can rnams sngon gyi mtha' nas yun ring por 'khor bar gyur cing /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can rnams sngon gyi mtha' nas yun ring por 'khor bar gyur cing /
translated: then why is it that those who have the quality of attaining nirvana have been in cyclic existence for a long time since beginningless time?

original: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das she na /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das she na /
translated: Why have they not attained final nirvāṇa?

original: smras pa / rgyu bzhis yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das te /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu bzhis yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das te /
translated: It is said: They have not attained final nirvāṇa because of four reasons.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: mi khom par skyes pa dang / bag med pa'i nyes pa dang / logs par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa'i nyes pas so ;
analyzed: mi khom par skyes pa dang / bag med pa'i nyes pa dang / logs par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa'i nyes pas so ;
translated: They are: being born in a place lacking freedom, the fault of heedlessness, going astray, and the fault of obscurations.

original: / de la mi khom par skyes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de la mi khom par skyes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by being born in a place lacking freedom?

original: smras pa / gang du 'khor bzhi bo rnams dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam par rnams mi 'gro ba'i mtha' 'khor gyi mi rkun ma rnams dang / kla klo rnams su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / gang du 'khor bzhi bo rnams dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam par rnams mi 'gro ba'i mtha' 'khor gyi mi rkun ma rnams dang / kla klo rnams su skyes pa yin te /
translated: It is said: Being born in a place where the four groups of followers, the holy ones, those who have gone rightly, and the holy people do not go, in the border regions, among thieves, and among barbarians.

original: de mi khom par skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de mi khom par skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called being born in a place lacking freedom.

original: bag med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bag med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by heedlessness?

original: smras pa / de gang du 'khor bzhi po rnams dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam par rnams 'gro ba'i 'di dus kyi mi rkun ma ma yin pa rnams dang / klu klo ma yin pa rnams @3a * //
analyzed: smras pa / de gang du 'khor bzhi po rnams dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam par rnams 'gro ba'i 'di dus kyi mi rkun ma ma yin pa rnams dang / klu klo ma yin pa rnams @3a * //
translated: He said, “It is when the four assemblies, the holy ones, the true practitioners, and the holy beings go to a place where there are no thieves, no barbarians,

original: su skyes shing /
analyzed: su skyes shing /
translated: and where they are born.

original: rigs mthon po longs spyod spyod phun sum tshogs pa dag tu skyes su zin kyang /
analyzed: rigs mthon po longs spyod spyod phun sum tshogs pa dag tu skyes su zin kyang /
translated: Even if they are born into a high caste with abundant wealth,

original: 'dod pa dag la lhag par chags shing yongs su longs spyod par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la lhag par chags shing yongs su longs spyod par byed de /
translated: they become attached to desires and enjoy them.

original: nyes dmigs su mi lta zhing nges par 'byung bar rab tu mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes dmigs su mi lta zhing nges par 'byung bar rab tu mi shes pa yin te /
translated: They do not see the faults and do not know how to escape.

original: de ni bag med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bag med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘carelessness.’

original: logs par zhugs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: logs par zhugs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is ‘wrong practice’?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar dbus kyi mi rnams su skyes pa'i bar du rgyas par gyur kyang mu stegs can gyi lta ba dang ldan par gyur nas sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba nas 'di las srid gzhan mi shes so //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar dbus kyi mi rnams su skyes pa'i bar du rgyas par gyur kyang mu stegs can gyi lta ba dang ldan par gyur nas sbyin pa med do zhes bya ba nas 'di las srid gzhan mi shes so //
translated: He said, “In the same way, even if they are born in the central region and so on, if they have the views of the tīrthikas, they will say, ‘There is no generosity’ and so on, up to ‘There is no knowledge of existence beyond this.’

original: zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ba yin te /
translated: They will have such views and speak in such a way.

original: mu stegs can gyi lta ba de yang des sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa dang / dam pa chos ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams med pa'i tshe na rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lta ba de yang des sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa dang / dam pa chos ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams med pa'i tshe na rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: And they will acquire the views of the tīrthikas when there are no buddhas and no spiritual teachers who teach the sublime Dharma.

original: de ni log par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni log par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called ‘wrong engagement.’

original: sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is an obscuration?

original: smras pa ; 'di ltar dbus kyi mi rnams su skyes pa'i bar du rgyas par snga ma bzhin du gyur cing sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag rnyed par gyur kyang /
analyzed: smras pa ; 'di ltar dbus kyi mi rnams su skyes pa'i bar du rgyas par snga ma bzhin du gyur cing sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos ston pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag rnyed par gyur kyang /
translated: He replied, “It is like this: even if one is born in the central region, and so on, in detail as before, and even if one meets with a spiritual teacher who teaches the holy Dharma when a Buddha has appeared in the world,

original: de glen pa dang / dig pa dang / lkug pa dang / lag pas brda byed par 'gyur zhing legs par gsungs pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par mi nus pa dang / mtshams med pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur pa dang /
analyzed: de glen pa dang / dig pa dang / lkug pa dang / lag pas brda byed par 'gyur zhing legs par gsungs pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun shes par mi nus pa dang / mtshams med pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur pa dang /
translated: if one is born blind, deaf, and mute, and one is unable to understand the meaning of the Dharma, whether well spoken or badly spoken, and if one commits the actions of immediate retribution,

original: nyon mongs pa yun ring ba yin te de ni sgrib pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yun ring ba yin te de ni sgrib pa zhes bya'o /
translated: and if one’s afflictions are long lasting, this is called an obscuration.

original: rgyu gang dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ni bzhi po de dag yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag gis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu ni bzhi po de dag yin no //
translated: These are the four causes of those who have the Dharma of complete nirvana to attain complete nirvana.”

original: de dag kyang gang gi tshe sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa rnyed cing /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang gi tshe sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa rnyed cing /
translated: Moreover, when a Buddha appears, they hear the true Dharma and obtain the instructions and follow-up teachings that are in conformity with it.

original: rgyu de dag kyang med par gyur pa de'i tshe na dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yongs su smin cing rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de dag kyang med par gyur pa de'i tshe na dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yongs su smin cing rim gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When those causes are absent, their roots of virtue ripen and they gradually attain nirvana.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams ni nges pa'i tshogs la gnas pa yin pas /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams ni nges pa'i tshogs la gnas pa yin pas /
translated: Those who will not attain nirvana are those who abide in the group of those who are certain.

original: de dag ni rkyen rnyed kyang rung ma rnyed kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rkyen rnyed kyang rung ma rnyed kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether they find the conditions or not,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i @3b skal ba med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i @3b skal ba med pa kho na yin no //
translated: they are completely and totally incapable of attaining nirvana.

original: de la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi gang dag ma tshang zhing med la nye bar ma gyur na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi gang dag ma tshang zhing med la nye bar ma gyur na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i rkyen rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the conditions for not attaining complete nirvana for those who have the Dharma of complete nirvana, when they are incomplete, absent, and not present?

original: smras pa / rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / rkyen gnyis te /
translated: It is said: There are two conditions.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: gtso bo dang / dman pa'o//
analyzed: gtso bo dang / dman pa'o//
translated: The primary and the secondary.

original: rkyen gtso bo gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen gtso bo gang zhe na /
translated: What is the primary condition?

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: dam pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas pa'i gzhan gyi sgra dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi dbang du byas pa'i gzhan gyi sgra dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Namely, the sound of another in relation to the true Dharma, and proper mental attention within.

original: rkyen dman pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen dman pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the secondary condition?

original: smras pa / rkyen dman pa ni mang ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rkyen dman pa ni mang ste /
translated: It is said: The secondary conditions are many.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: bdag gi 'byor ba dang / gzhan gyi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / rab tu byung ba dang / tshul khrims kyi sngo pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bdag gi 'byor ba dang / gzhan gyi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / rab tu byung ba dang / tshul khrims kyi sngo pa dang / dbang po sdom pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid dang /
translated: one’s own resources, the resources of others, the aspiration for virtuous qualities, going forth, the purity of morality, the restraint of the sense faculties, moderation in eating, and the effort to practice during the first and last parts of the night,

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid do //
translated: and the practice of being watchful.

original: rab tu dben par gnas pa dang ; sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben par gnas pa dang ; sgrib pa rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: The purity of the obscurations, and the correct practice of meditative concentration.

original: de la bdag gi 'byor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag gi 'byor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is one’s own resources?

original: mir gyur pa dang / yul dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang / gnas la dad par gyur pa dang / las kyi mtha' ma log pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mir gyur pa dang / yul dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang / gnas la dad par gyur pa dang / las kyi mtha' ma log pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Being a human being, being born in a central land, having complete faculties, having faith in the object, and not being perverted in one’s actions.

original: de la mir gyur pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mir gyur pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is being a human being?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes pa /🔽skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes pa / skyes pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa'am /
translated: Here, someone is born with the good fortune of being human.🔽He or she is born with the male or female sex organ.

original: bud med du skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: bud med du skyes pa yin te /
translated: He or she is born as a man or a woman.

original: de ni mir gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mir gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “being born as a human being.”

original: yul dbus su skyes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul dbus su skyes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to be born in a central country?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la snga ma bzhin du gong du skyes bu dam pa'i bar dag 'gro ba'i yul dbus kyi mi rnams su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la snga ma bzhin du gong du skyes bu dam pa'i bar dag 'gro ba'i yul dbus kyi mi rnams su skyes pa yin te /
translated: Here, someone is born in a central country, in a place where there are good people, as described above.

original: de ni yul dbus su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yul dbus su skyes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “being born in a central country.”

original: dbang po ma tshang ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to be born with complete faculties?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la glen pa ma yin zhing dig pa dang lkugs pa ma yin pa'i bar du rgyas par gyur pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag mtshang ba med par gyur cing rna ba tshang ba med pa la sogs pa yan lag dang nyid lag ma tshang ba med pa gang gis dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'i skal pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la glen pa ma yin zhing dig pa dang lkugs pa ma yin pa'i bar du rgyas par gyur pa dang / yan lag dang nying lag mtshang ba med par gyur cing rna ba tshang ba med pa la sogs pa yan lag dang nyid lag ma tshang ba med pa gang gis dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'i skal pa yod pa yin te /
translated: He is not lacking in major or minor limbs, not lacking in ears, and so on, not lacking in major or minor limbs. He has the good fortune to accomplish the side of virtue.

original: de ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dbang po ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “not lacking in faculties.”

original: gnas la dad par gyur pa gang zhe na //🔽'di ltar 'di na la las de bzhin gshegs @4a * //
analyzed: gnas la dad par gyur pa gang zhe na // 'di ltar 'di na la las de bzhin gshegs @4a * //
translated: What is “having faith in the doctrine”?

original: bas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa dang / sems dang ba thob par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa dang / sems dang ba thob par gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, here someone has faith in the doctrine and discipline taught by the Tathāgata, and has attained mental clarity.

original: de ni gnas la dad par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gnas la dad par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “having faith in the doctrine.”

original: de la gnas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la bya ste /
translated: Here, “doctrine” refers to the doctrine and discipline taught by the Tathāgata.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkar po'i chos thams cad skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽des sngon du drangs pa'i dbang gis de la dad pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa dad par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkar po'i chos thams cad skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro // des sngon du drangs pa'i dbang gis de la dad pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa dad par gyur pa yin te /
translated: because it is the basis for the arising of all mundane and supramundane good qualities.🔽Faith in the basis is faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.🔽It is called “faith in the basis” because it is faith that is induced by the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang rnyog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang rnyog pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called “faith in the basis” because it is faith that is induced by the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: las kyi mtha' ma la log pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ma la log pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of wrong action?

original: gang gi tshe 'di nyid la mtshams med pa'i las lnga po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di nyid la mtshams med pa'i las lnga po 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the fact of not committing, or causing others to commit, any of the five actions of immediate retribution in this very life, namely:

original: ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag las mtshams med pa'i las gang yang rung ba ma byas shing byed du ma bcug pa yin te /
analyzed: ma gsod pa dang / pha gsod pa dang / dgra bcom pa gsod pa dang / dge 'dun gyi dbyen byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa dag las mtshams med pa'i las gang yang rung ba ma byas shing byed du ma bcug pa yin te /
translated: the killing of one’s mother, the killing of one’s father, the killing of an arhat, causing a schism in the Saṅgha, and out of malice, wounding a Tathāgata.

original: de ni las kyi mtha' ma log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni las kyi mtha' ma log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the absence of wrong action.

original: tshe 'di nyid la mtshams med pa'i las lnga po de dag byas shing bsags la yongs su ma spangs na yongs su myang ngan las 'da' zhing 'phags pa'i lam skyed pa'i skal ba med pas na de'i phyir de dag ni las kyi mtha' log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la mtshams med pa'i las lnga po de dag byas shing bsags la yongs su ma spangs na yongs su myang ngan las 'da' zhing 'phags pa'i lam skyed pa'i skal ba med pas na de'i phyir de dag ni las kyi mtha' log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If one commits and accumulates the five heinous actions in this very life and does not completely abandon them, one is not fortunate enough to attain nirvāṇa and generate the noble path. Therefore, they are called “the extreme of bad actions.”

original: des bdag nyid kyi lus yin te yan lag lnga po de dag gis 'byor par byed pas na de'i phyir bdag gi 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des bdag nyid kyi lus yin te yan lag lnga po de dag gis 'byor par byed pas na de'i phyir bdag gi 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is one’s own body, and it is enriched by those five limbs. Therefore, it is called “one’s own enrichment.”

original: gzhan gyi 'byor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'byor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is another’s enrichment?

original: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / chos bstan pa rnams gnas pa dang / chos gnas pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang / dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / chos bstan pa rnams gnas pa dang / chos gnas pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the appearance of the Buddhas, the teaching of the true Dharma, the continuation of the teaching of the Dharma, the continuation of the Dharma, and the practice of compassion for others.

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba gang zhes na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba gang zhes na /
translated: What is the appearance of the Buddhas?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la sems can thams cad la dge legs dang phan pa'i bsam pa bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la sems can thams cad la dge legs dang phan pa'i bsam pa bskyed nas /
translated: Thus, here, someone, having generated the thought of virtue and benefit for all sentient beings,

original: dka' ba stong phrag mang po dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis tha ma'i lus phyi ma thob nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug ste /
analyzed: dka' ba stong phrag mang po dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis tha ma'i lus phyi ma thob nas byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug ste /
translated: having attained the final body after three incalculable aeons with many thousands of hardships and with the great accumulations of merit and knowledge, sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: sgrib pa lnga spangs nas /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga spangs nas /
translated: Having abandoned the five hindrances,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sems legs par gnas te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sems legs par gnas te /
translated: he well establishes his mind in the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun @4b bsgoms nas /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun @4b bsgoms nas /
translated: Having cultivated the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yin te /
translated: he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: des ni sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the arising of the Buddhas.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad de kho na bzhin du 'bung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad de kho na bzhin du 'bung ba yin no //
translated: In the past, future, and present, all the Blessed Buddhas arise in just this way.

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the teaching of the excellent Dharma?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid dang / de dag nyid kyis nyan thos rnams 'jig rten du byung nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag nyid dang / de dag nyid kyis nyan thos rnams 'jig rten du byung nas /
translated: The Bhagavan Buddhas and the Shravakas who appear in the world through their power

original: 'jig rten la rjes su thugs brtse ba'i phyir /🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams las brtsams nas 'di lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten la rjes su thugs brtse ba'i phyir / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams las brtsams nas 'di lta bu ste /
translated: teach the Dharma in order to show compassion to the world.

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtog pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu'i byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtog pa brjod pa'i sde dang / de lta bu'i byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: They teach the Dharma of the sutra collection, the collection of sayings, the collection of prophecies, the collection of verses, the collection of expressions, the collection of former events, the collection of stories and the collection of extensive teachings.

original: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde'i chos ston par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa'i sde'i chos ston par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: They teach the Dharma of the collection of extensive teachings, the collection of marvelous events and the collection of established teachings.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “teaching the holy Dharma.”

original: chos 'di ni dam pa yang sangs rgyas rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis brtags shing bstan pa'am bsngags pa yin pas de'i phyir dam pa'i chos te /
analyzed: chos 'di ni dam pa yang sangs rgyas rnams dang sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams kyis brtags shing bstan pa'am bsngags pa yin pas de'i phyir dam pa'i chos te /
translated: The Dharma is holy because it is examined and taught or praised by the Buddhas and the Buddhas’ disciples.

original: de bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dam pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa gang yin pa de ni dam pa'i chos ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of that Dharma is called “teaching the holy Dharma.”

original: chos bstan pa rnams gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos bstan pa rnams gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the duration of the teaching of the Dharma?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'tsho zhing gzhes la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'tsho zhing gzhes la /
translated: The duration of the teaching of the Dharma is the period during which the practice of the holy Dharma does not decline and the holy Dharma does not disappear, from the time when the Blessed Buddhas are living,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te dam pa'i chos bstan pa nas /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te dam pa'i chos bstan pa nas /
translated: have turned the wheel of the Dharma, and are teaching the holy Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dus ji srid par sgrub pa mi nyams pa dang / dam pa'i chos mi nub pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar gyi dus ji srid par sgrub pa mi nyams pa dang / dam pa'i chos mi nub pa yin te /
translated: up to the time when the Blessed Buddhas have entered into final nirvāṇa.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the duration of the holy Dharma.”

original: gnas pa de yang don dam pa'i chos mngan sum du bya ba'i tshul gyis yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de yang don dam pa'i chos mngan sum du bya ba'i tshul gyis yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that duration should be understood as the way of realizing the ultimate Dharma.

original: chos gnas pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gnas pa rnams rjes su 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is following the Dharma?

original: dam pa'i chos rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis skye bo rnams la dam pa'i chos mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba dang mthu yod par rig ga nas /🔽ji ltar rtogs pa kho na dang rjes su mthun @5a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis skye bo rnams la dam pa'i chos mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba dang mthu yod par rig ga nas / ji ltar rtogs pa kho na dang rjes su mthun @5a * //
translated: It is the fact of making others understand the Dharma by means of the very same realization of the Dharma, knowing that beings have the fortune and the power to realize the Dharma.

original: pas gdams shing rjes su bstan pa la rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: pas gdams shing rjes su bstan pa la rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the fact of making them follow the instructions and the teachings in conformity with the realization.

original: de ni chos gnas pa sna tshogs rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos gnas pa sna tshogs rjes su 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called following the Dharma.

original: gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is compassion for others?

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag rnams te /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag rnams te /
translated: Others are donors and benefactors.🔽It is the fact of making them understand the Dharma by means of the very same realization of the Dharma, knowing that beings have the fortune and the power to realize the Dharma.

original: de dag gis 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du babs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dag gis 'tsho ba'i yo byad rkyen du babs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the fact of making them follow the instructions and the teachings in conformity with the realization.

original: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / nad kyi gsos sman dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba de dag gi phyir rje su snying brtse bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / nad kyi gsos sman dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba de dag gi phyir rje su snying brtse bar byed pa yin te /
translated: He is compassionate for the sake of robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for sickness, and other necessities.

original: de ni gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi phyir rjes su snying brtse bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “compassion for others.”

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa gang zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na la la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: “What is aspiration for virtuous qualities?”🔽It is the case of someone who hears the Dharma from the Tathāgata or from the Tathāgata’s disciples and who attains faith.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dag las chos thos shing dad pa thob par gyur la des de thos nas 'di ltar khyim na gnas pa ni gnod pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos dag las chos thos shing dad pa thob par gyur la des de thos nas 'di ltar khyim na gnas pa ni gnod pa dang nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin gyi /
translated: Having heard it, he thinks, “Living in a house is a place of trouble and affliction,

original: rab tu byung ba ni mngon par skabs yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni mngon par skabs yod pa yin pas /
translated: but going forth is a place of freedom.🔽Therefore, I will give up all my women, wealth, grain, and gold,

original: 'di ltar bdag gis bud med kyi tshogs dang nor dang 'bru dang dbyig thams cad spangs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis bud med kyi tshogs dang nor dang 'bru dang dbyig thams cad spangs la /
translated: and

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la khyim med par legs pa kho nar rab tu 'byung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la khyim med par legs pa kho nar rab tu 'byung bar bya zhing /
translated: He should go forth from the home into the homeless life of the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: rab tu byung nas kyang nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar yang dag par slob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang nan tan gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes de ltar yang dag par slob par byed pa yin te /
translated: And having gone forth, he should practice it earnestly.”

original: de ltar dge ba'i chos rnams la 'dun pa skyes pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge ba'i chos rnams la 'dun pa skyes pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “aspiration to wholesome states.”

original: rab tu byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is “going forth”?

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa dang / dge slong gi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa gang yin pa ste de ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byas pa dang / dge slong gi tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa gang yin pa ste de ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the going forth of one who, on the basis of that aspiration to wholesome states, has received the full ordination rite consisting of the four requests and the four exclamations, and who has undertaken the training rules of a bhikshu.

original: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the restraint of the precepts?

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba de tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba de tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: Thus, the ordained person lives with moral discipline, is restrained by the vows of individual liberation, has perfect ritual behavior, has perfect behavior in all things, and sees danger in even the slightest fault.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slab  par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slab  par byed pa yin te /
translated: He takes up the bases of training and practices them.

original: de ni tshul khrims kyi sdom ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims kyi sdom ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the vow of moral discipline.

original: dbang po sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the vow of the sense-faculties?

original: de tshul khrims kyi @5b sdom pa de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: de tshul khrims kyi @5b sdom pa de nyid la brten nas /
translated: Relying on that vow of moral discipline,🔽he guards mindfulness, is ever vigilant with mindfulness, protects his mind with mindfulness, and places it in a state of equanimity.

original: dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing des mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba na mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing des mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba na mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
translated: When he sees forms with his eyes, he does not grasp at signs and does not grasp at secondary characteristics.

original: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par gyur pa de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par gyur pa de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing /
translated: “Whatever basis causes unwholesome and nonvirtuous phenomena to flow into the mind, they will practice restraint and guard the faculty of the eyes.

original: mig gi dbang po yang srung byar byed la /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po yang srung byar byed la /
translated: They will also practice restraint with the faculty of the eyes.

original: mig gi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa dang / de rna bas sgra dag dang / snas dri dag dang / lces ro dag dang / lus kyis reg bya dag dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa dang / de rna bas sgra dag dang / snas dri dag dang / lces ro dag dang / lus kyis reg bya dag dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa na yang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: When they cognize sounds with the ears, smells with the nose, tastes with the tongue, touchable objects with the body, and phenomena with the mind, they will not grasp at their marks

original: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin la /
translated: and will not grasp at their signs.

original: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed cing /
translated: Whatever basis causes unwholesome and nonvirtuous phenomena to flow into the mind, they will practice restraint and guard the faculty of the mind.

original: yid kyi dbang po yang srung bar byed la /🔽yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po yang srung bar byed la /🔽yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: They will also practice restraint with the faculty of the mind.

original: de ni dbang po sdom ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dbang po sdom ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “restraining the senses.”

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽de ltar dbang po bsdams pa de so sor brtags shing /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na / de ltar dbang po bsdams pa de so sor brtags shing /
translated: What is moderation in eating?

original: zas za bar byed la /🔽rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: zas za bar byed la / rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Thus, having restrained the senses, one should eat in moderation,🔽not for fun,

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /🔽sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin / sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for enjoyment,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: not for physical beauty and attractiveness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: But rather,

original: lus 'di ni gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyad pa la phan bar bya ba dang / chor ba rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar pa rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lus 'di ni gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyad pa la phan bar bya ba dang / chor ba rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar pa rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to maintain and nourish this body, to prevent feelings of hunger, to sustain myself, to live comfortably, and to promote the practice of religion,

original: bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin te /
translated: so that I may live without illness and be free from distress.

original: de ni zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “moderation in eating.”

original: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽de ltar zas kyi tshod rig par gyur pa de nyin mo 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su spyod bar byed cing mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang @6a * //
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang zhe na / de ltar zas kyi tshod rig par gyur pa de nyin mo 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su spyod bar byed cing mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang @6a * //
translated: What is the practice of not lying down during the first and last periods of the night?🔽Having become moderate in eating, during the day he practices walking and sitting and he purifies his mind of obscurations.

original: 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyor bar byed la /
translated: In the first period of the night, he also practices walking and sitting and he purifies his mind of obscurations.

original: de yongs su sbyangs nas de'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang nas phyir byung ste /
analyzed: de yongs su sbyangs nas de'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang nas phyir byung ste /
translated: Having purified it, he then leaves the monastery.🔽Outside the monastery, he washes his feet.

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /
translated: Then, he enters the monastery and lies down on his right side.

original: glo g-yas ba phab nas rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag ste /
analyzed: glo g-yas ba phab nas rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag ste /
translated: He puts his foot on the top of his foot.

original: snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang / ldang ba kho na'i 'di shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa dang / de mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la yang myur bas kho nar sad par byas nas /🔽'chag pa dang / 'dug bdag gis sgrib par gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa byin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang / ldang ba kho na'i 'di shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal bar byed pa dang / de mtshan mo'i thun tha ma la yang myur bas kho nar sad par byas nas / 'chag pa dang / 'dug bdag gis sgrib par gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa byin te /
translated: In the last part of the night, he gets up quickly and, while walking and sitting, he purifies his mind of any obscurations.

original: de ni nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha stod dang nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “being dedicated to practice during the first and last parts of the night and avoiding sleep in the middle part of the night.”

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is “acting with awareness”?

original: de ltar nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par 'gyur pa de 'gro ba dang ldog pa la shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa dang / cung zad bltas pa dang / rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang snam sbyar dang /
analyzed: de ltar nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson par 'gyur pa de 'gro ba dang ldog pa la shes bzhin du spyod par byed pa dang / cung zad bltas pa dang / rnam par bltas pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang snam sbyar dang /
translated: The person who is dedicated to practice during the first and last parts of the night and avoids sleep in the middle part of the night acts with awareness when going and returning; when looking ahead and looking aside; when bending and stretching; when wearing his lower and upper robes and carrying his outer robe and bowl;

original: chos gos dang / lhung bzed bcang ba dang / zos dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang / sbra ba dang /
analyzed: chos gos dang / lhung bzed bcang ba dang / zos dang / 'thungs pa dang / 'chos pa dang / myangs pa dang / song ba dang / sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang / sbra ba dang /
translated: It is to carry the Dharma robes and alms bowl, and to eat, drink, consume, taste, go, stay, sit, lie down, not lie down, speak,🔽

original: mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis snyom pa bsang pa bsang ba la yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: mi smra ba dang / gnyid kyis snyom pa bsang pa bsang ba la yang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te /
translated: He is aware of his activities when he wears his robes and carries his alms bowl, when he eats, drinks, chews his food, and savors tastes, when he goes, stops, sits, lies down, wakes up, speaks, and remains silent, and when he is drowsy or awake.

original: de ni shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called being aware of one’s activities.

original: rab tu dben par gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dben par gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is living in solitude?

original: de chos de dag gis yongs su sbyong bar bya ba'i sbyangs nas gnas mal dben pa dgon pa dag gam /
analyzed: de chos de dag gis yongs su sbyong bar bya ba'i sbyangs nas gnas mal dben pa dgon pa dag gam /
translated: Having purified himself through those qualities, he lives in a solitary place, in a forest,

original: shing drung dag gam /
analyzed: shing drung dag gam /
translated: under a tree,

original: khang stong dag gam /🔽ri khrod dam /🔽ri phug gam /
analyzed: khang stong dag gam / ri khrod dam / ri phug gam /
translated: in an empty place,🔽in a mountain glen,🔽in a cave,

original: rtsva khang ngam /🔽bla ga ba med pa'am /
analyzed: rtsva khang ngam / bla ga ba med pa'am /
translated: in a hut of straw,

original: dur khrod dam /🔽nags 'dab bam /
analyzed: dur khrod dam / nags 'dab bam /
translated: in the open air,🔽in a charnel ground,🔽in the forest,

original: bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu gnas par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu gnas par byed pa yin te /
translated: or in the border regions.

original: de ni rab tu dben bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rab tu dben bar gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “dwelling in solitude.”

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is purification of obscurations?

original: de dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung /
analyzed: de dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung /
translated: Whether he dwells in the forest,

original: shing drung na 'dug kyang rung /
analyzed: shing drung na 'dug kyang rung /
translated: at the foot of a tree,

original: khang stong na 'dug kyang rung ste /
analyzed: khang stong na 'dug kyang rung ste /
translated: or in an empty building,

original: sgrib pa lnga po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs @6b pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs @6b pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dag las sems rnam par sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: he purifies his mind of the five obscurations: sensual desire, ill will, sloth and torpor, restlessness and worry, and doubt.

original: de sgrib pa de dag las sems rnam par sbyangs na /
analyzed: de sgrib pa de dag las sems rnam par sbyangs na /
translated: When he has purified his mind of these obscurations,

original: sgrib pa med pas ting nge 'dzin gyi nyams bde ba la nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa med pas ting nge 'dzin gyi nyams bde ba la nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: he dwells in the bliss of concentration free from obscurations.

original: de ni sgrib pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o//
translated: This is called “purification of obscurations.”

original: ting nge 'dzin la yang dag pa ra gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la yang dag pa ra gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is right abiding in concentration?

original: de sgrib pa lnga pos sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed la /
analyzed: de sgrib pa lnga pos sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed la /
translated: His mind is afflicted by the five obscurations.

original: shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'phel bar gyur pa dag spangs nas /
analyzed: shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa rgud pa'i phyogs su gyur la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'phel bar gyur pa dag spangs nas /
translated: They are the factors that weaken wisdom and lead to decline, and they increase the afflictions.

original: 'dod pa dag la dben pa /
analyzed: 'dod pa dag la dben pa /
translated: They are free from desire,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /🔽spyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa / spyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: free from negative, nonvirtuous factors, and are accompanied by ideation and scrutiny.🔽They are accompanied by the joy and pleasure born of seclusion.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rtog pa dang spyod pa dang bral ba zhing nang yongs su dang ste /🔽sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can bsam gtan dang po bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de rtog pa dang spyod pa dang bral ba zhing nang yongs su dang ste / sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dpyod pa med pa ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can /
translated: They accomplish and abide in the first meditative concentration.🔽Free from ideation and scrutiny, their inner delight is pure,🔽and their mental continuum becomes one-pointed. They accomplish and abide in the second meditative concentration, which is free from ideation and scrutiny and is accompanied by the joy and pleasure born of meditative stabilization.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms pa la gnas shing /
translated: Free from the desire for joy, they abide in equanimity,

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: and they are endowed with mindfulness and introspection.

original: bde ba lus kyis myong la /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong la /
translated: They experience pleasure with their bodies.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The noble ones call it “endowed with mindfulness,

original: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: abiding in bliss, and equanimity.”

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba yang spangs te /
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bde ba yang spangs te /
translated: “He cultivates and abides in the third concentration, which is without joy.🔽He abandons even the experience of bliss,

original: snga nas sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas /🔽bde ba yid ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa'o yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal ba yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba yang nub pas / bde ba yid ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa btang snyoms dang dran pa'o yongs su dag pa /
translated: and previously abandoned the experience of suffering.🔽With the subsiding of mental pleasure and displeasure,

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgrubs te gnas pa yin te /
translated: he cultivates and abides in the fourth concentration, which is utterly pure and endowed with both the mindfulness that is free of impurities and the equanimity that is free of impurities.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘abiding in samādhi.’

original: de rim pa 'dis dang po bdag gi 'byor pa nas tha ma ting ne 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi rkyen khyad par can dang / shin tu khyad par can dang / mchog tu khyad par can rnams gong nas ging du yang dag par bsgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de rim pa 'dis dang po bdag gi 'byor pa nas tha ma ting ne 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi rkyen khyad par can dang / shin tu khyad par can dang / mchog tu khyad par can rnams gong nas ging du yang dag par bsgrub par byed do //
translated: In this way, he will accomplish the special, the very special, and the most special conditions, from his own wealth up to the final perfect abiding in samādhi.

original: de de ltar sems yongs su dag par yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: de de ltar sems yongs su dag par yongs su byang ba /
translated: In this way, his mind becomes completely pure, completely purified,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa /
translated: free from afflictions,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba /
translated: free from secondary afflictions,

original: drang por @7a * //
analyzed: drang por @7a * //
translated: straight,🔽pliable,

original: gyur pa ; las su rung ba /🔽mig g-yo bar gyur pa la gnas na /🔽gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las brtsams te /
analyzed: gyur pa ; las su rung ba / mig g-yo bar gyur pa la gnas na / gal te 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las brtsams te /
translated: and ready for action.

original: de dag yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i phyir gzhan las gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i sgra thos par gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba'i phyir gzhan las gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i sgra thos par gyur nas /
translated: If he hears the sound of instruction and teaching from another person in order to fully understand, abandon, and cultivate the four noble truths,

original: de lta na de ni rigs pas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de sngon du btang ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya ba'i skal ba dang mthu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na de ni rigs pas bskyed pa'i yid la byed pa dang / de sngon du btang ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed par bya ba'i skal ba dang mthu yod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, he has the fortune and the power to generate the attention that is generated by reasoning and to generate the correct view that is preceded by that attention.

original: des 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag mngon par rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: des 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag mngon par rtogs par byed cing /
translated: He realizes the four noble truths.

original: rnam par grol ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yang yongs su rdzogs par byed la /
translated: He also perfects complete liberation.

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang byed do //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang byed do //
translated: He also attains complete nirvana in the element of nirvana that has no remainder of the heaps.

original: de la yang dag pa'i lta bal brten nas rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rigs yang dag par grub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i lta bal brten nas rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rigs yang dag par grub pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, you should know that the perfection of complete liberation and the nirvana that has no remainder of the heaps are the accomplishment of the spiritual lineage.

original: de la bdag gi 'byor pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la bdag gi 'byor pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The spiritual powers🔽The spiritual powers are the ten powers of the tathāgatas.

original: ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'grub pa'i rkyen dman pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par gnas pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'grub pa'i rkyen dman pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The inferior condition for correct achievement is the correct abiding in meditative concentration.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa'i gdams ngag gi dbang du byas pa'i gzhan gyi sgra gang yin pa dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'grub pa'i rkyen gtso bo yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa'i gdams ngag gi dbang du byas pa'i gzhan gyi sgra gang yin pa dang / nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag par 'grub pa'i rkyen gtso bo yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The principal condition for correct achievement is the instruction that teaches the four noble truths and the proper mental attention that is directed internally.

original: de ni rigs rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rigs rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the “presentation of the spiritual lineages.”

original: rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of a person who is abiding in the spiritual lineage?

original: smras pa / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi rtags gang yin pa de dag las bzlog pa ni rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi rtags gang yin pa de dag las bzlog pa ni rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the signs of a person who is abiding in the spiritual lineage are the opposite of the signs of a person who is not destined for the ultimate.

original: gang dag dang ldan na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi gang zag la //
analyzed: gang dag dang ldan na yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi gang zag la //
translated: What are the signs of a person who is not destined for the ultimate?

original: 'di ni yongs su mya ngan las mi ba'i chos can yin no zhes shes par 'gyur pa'i yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi rtags rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni yongs su mya ngan las mi ba'i chos can yin no zhes shes par 'gyur pa'i yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi rtags rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of one who will not attain Nirvana?

original: smras pa / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi rtags ni mang du yod mod kyi /
analyzed: smras pa / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can gyi rtags ni mang du yod mod kyi /
translated: It is said: There are many signs of one who will not attain Nirvana.

original: phyogs tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhig brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will mention only a few.

original: 'di la yongs su mya ngan las mi @7b 'da' ba'i chos can gyi gang zag gi lus la gzhi'i sred pa'i dang po nyid nas kun tu zhen pa /
analyzed: 'di la yongs su mya ngan las mi @7b 'da' ba'i chos can gyi gang zag gi lus la gzhi'i sred pa'i dang po nyid nas kun tu zhen pa /
translated: In this regard, in the body of a person who will not attain Nirvana, craving for the basis is first of all completely adhered to.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang /
translated: Even all the Buddhas

original: thams cad kyi thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs bar mi spyod ba'i chos can ma bshig pa /🔽ring du song ba rab tu dam por kun tu zhen pa yod pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du spangs bar mi spyod ba'i chos can ma bshig pa / ring du song ba rab tu dam por kun tu zhen pa yod pa /
translated: cannot cause him to abandon it completely in every way.

original: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gi rtags dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gi rtags dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first sign of a person who is established in the lineage of no-lineage.

original: gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag ni 'khor ba'i skyon sna tshogs dang / rab tu mang po dag rnam grangs du mar thos kyang des 'das pa'i dus la brten te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag ni 'khor ba'i skyon sna tshogs dang / rab tu mang po dag rnam grangs du mar thos kyang des 'das pa'i dus la brten te /
translated: even though he has heard many times the various faults of cyclic existence,

original: 'khor ba'i spros pa las skyon du lta ba dang / nyes dmigs su lta ba dang / skyo ba cung zas tsam yang ma skyed cing /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i spros pa las skyon du lta ba dang / nyes dmigs su lta ba dang / skyo ba cung zas tsam yang ma skyed cing /
translated: has not generated even a little disgust, has not seen the faults of cyclic existence, has not seen the disadvantages of cyclic existence, and has not generated disgust in dependence on the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te skyed par yang mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te skyed par yang mi 'gyur /
translated: He will not generate it in dependence on the future,

original: de ltar gyi dus la brten te skyed par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus la brten te skyed par yang mi byed la /
translated: and he does not generate it in dependence on the present.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang de ltar byung ba'i dus rnams la brten pa /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang de ltar byung ba'i dus rnams la brten pa /
translated: In dependence on the past, future, and present,🔽he has not generated even a little faith, even a little portion, even a little bit of disgust,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa sred pa zad pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa sred pa zad pa /
translated: in nirvana, the exhaustion of craving,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa la yon tan du lta ba dang / phan yon du lta ba dang / dad pa cung zad tsam dang / cha cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngo tsam yang ma bskyed bskyed par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa la yon tan du lta ba dang / phan yon du lta ba dang / dad pa cung zad tsam dang / cha cung zad tsam dang / ngan ngo tsam yang ma bskyed bskyed par mi 'gyur /
translated: the separation from attachment, cessation, the view of good qualities, the view of benefits.

original: skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: skyed par mi byed de /
translated: He does not generate it.

original: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i rtag gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i rtag gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second mark of the person who is situated in the lineage of the non-good.

original: gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag ni dang po nyid nas ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag ni dang po nyid nas ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the person who is situated in the lineage of the non-good is from the very beginning endowed with great shamelessness and lack of abashment.

original: des de snying rje med pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i sems dang / rab tu rangs pa'i sems kyis sdig pa thams cad la lhag par spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: des de snying rje med pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i sems dang / rab tu rangs pa'i sems kyis sdig pa thams cad la lhag par spyod par byed cing /
translated: By that he engages in all sins with a mind that is without compassion, without fear, and with a mind that is very pleased.

original: gzhi des lan 'ga' 'ang 'gyod par mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhi des lan 'ga' 'ang 'gyod par mi byed la /
translated: He does not regret it even once on that basis.

original: gzhi des tshe de'i zang zing dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid nyams pa kho na tsam du mthong bar zad de /
analyzed: gzhi des tshe de'i zang zing dang bcas pa'i bdag nyid nyams pa kho na tsam du mthong bar zad de /
translated: He sees only the loss of his very self in this life together with its material goods on that basis.

original: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i rtags gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i rtags gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third mark of the person who is situated in the lineage of the non-good.

original: gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal lam /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag ni sdug bsngal lam /
translated: Moreover, the person who is situated in the lineage of the non-good, having begun with suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'am /
translated: or with the origin,🔽or with cessation,

original: 'gog pa'am / lam las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'am / lam las brtsams te /
translated: or with the path,

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa gsal ba rigs pa sna tshogs pa go sla ba'i dam pa'i chos ston cing yang dag par ston pa na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa gsal ba rigs pa sna tshogs pa go sla ba'i dam pa'i chos ston cing yang dag par ston pa na /
translated: When the Dharma is taught and explained in a way that is clear, complete in all its aspects, reasonable, varied, and easy to understand,

original: cung zad sems gtod pa tsam dang / mos pa tsam yang ma thob na /🔽@8a * // 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams la brten te spu zing zhes byed pa'am /
analyzed: cung zad sems gtod pa tsam dang / mos pa tsam yang ma thob na / @8a * // 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams la brten te spu zing zhes byed pa'am /
translated: if one does not even attain a little bit of mental focus or interest,🔽what need is there to mention attaining the hairs on the body standing on end or

original: mchi ma dkrug ces byed pa thob par gyur pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: mchi ma dkrug ces byed pa thob par gyur pa lta ci smos te /
translated: tears welling up in the eyes in dependence on the past, future, and present?

original: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i rtags bzhi pa yin no //🔽gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas /
analyzed: de ni rigs med pa la gnas pa'i rtags bzhi pa yin no // gzhan yang rigs med pa la gnas /
translated: This is the fourth sign of abiding in the absence of the lineage.🔽Moreover, if a person who abides in the absence of the lineage somehow, after a hundred eons, goes forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya,

original: pa'i gang zag ni gal te brgya la brgya lam na legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung na der rgyal pos gtses pa'am /
analyzed: pa'i gang zag ni gal te brgya la brgya lam na legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung na der rgyal pos gtses pa'am /
translated: there they will be oppressed by the king,

original: chom rkun pas gtses pa'am /
analyzed: chom rkun pas gtses pa'am /
translated: oppressed by thieves,

original: bu lon gyis nyam thag pa'am /
analyzed: bu lon gyis nyam thag pa'am /
translated: oppressed by debt,

original: 'jigs pas nyam thag pa'am /
analyzed: 'jigs pas nyam thag pa'am /
translated: oppressed by fear,

original: mi 'tsho bas 'jigs shing skrag pa'i phyir yin gyi bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'tsho bas 'jigs shing skrag pa'i phyir yin gyi bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is out of fear and terror of not making a living that they do so, not in order to subdue themselves.

original: bdag nyid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not in order to pacify themselves,

original: bdag nyad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bdag nyad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not in order to attain complete nirvana,

original: dge sbyong gi phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of being ascetics,

original: bram ze'i phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: bram ze'i phyir ma yin te /
translated: not for the sake of being brahmins.

original: de ltar rab tu byung nas kyang khim  na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba dag dang 'dren mar gnas shing /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung nas kyang khim  na gnas pa dang / rab tu byung ba dag dang 'dren mar gnas shing /
translated: Having gone forth in this way, they live in company with householders and renunciates.

original: lha'am lha gang yang rung ba dag tu smon pa'i phyir tshangs par spyad pa spyod par byed pa dang / bslab pa phul nas spangs pa la 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / nang myags pa dang / nyes 'dzag tu gyur pa dang /
analyzed: lha'am lha gang yang rung ba dag tu smon pa'i phyir tshangs par spyad pa spyod par byed pa dang / bslab pa phul nas spangs pa la 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba dang / nang myags pa dang / nyes 'dzag tu gyur pa dang /
