original: de ni gang zag mthar thug par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gang zag mthar thug par gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the person who has gone to the ultimate.

original: de la gang zag skal ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can ni rigs la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: de la gang zag skal ba dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can ni rigs la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: “The person who is by nature endowed with good fortune, having relied on and based himself on the spiritual lineage,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dag thob cing zhugs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dag thob cing zhugs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: obtains and enters into the lesser wholesome roots.

original: de la zhugs par gyur nas /
analyzed: de la zhugs par gyur nas /
translated: Having entered into them,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dag la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du dag la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: Having relied on and remained in the small roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bring dag thob cing de dag gis kyang bdag nyid yongs su smin @13a * //🔽par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bring dag thob cing de dag gis kyang bdag nyid yongs su smin @13a * // par byed do //
translated: he attains the middling roots of virtue and they bring him to maturity.

original: de de ltar yongs su smin par byed pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar yongs su smin par byed pa na /
translated: As he is being brought to maturity,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bring dag la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'bring dag la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: having relied on and remained in the middling roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dag 'thob cing yongs su smin par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dag 'thob cing yongs su smin par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: he attains the great roots of virtue and they bring him to maturity.

original: de dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dag gis rgyu yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i lus thob pa nas /
analyzed: de dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po dag gis rgyu yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i lus thob pa nas /
translated: Having attained a body that is the result of the establishment of the causes of the great roots of virtue,

original: gang gi tshe tshogs yang dag par sgrub par byed cing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshogs yang dag par sgrub par byed cing /
translated: when he is establishing the collections

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid la yang reg par byed la /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid la yang reg par byed la /
translated: and has also attained one-pointedness of mind,

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la 'jug par byed de /🔽rgyun tu zhugs ba'i 'bras bu'am /🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges pa la 'jug par byed de / rgyun tu zhugs ba'i 'bras bu'am / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: he enters into certainty in the true nature.🔽He actualizes the fruit of stream-entry,🔽the fruit of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'od pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'od pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed la /
translated: and the fruit of non-returner.

original: 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa nyid ni mngon sum du mi byed pa de'i tshe ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i mchog dgra bcom pa nyid ni mngon sum du mi byed pa de'i tshe ni //
translated: But when he does not actualize the supreme fruit, the state of an arhat,

original: mthar thug pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then he is said to be abiding in the final preparation.

original: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa de'i tshe na ni mthar thug par gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa de'i tshe na ni mthar thug par gyur ba yin no //
translated: But when he actualizes the state of an arhat, who has abandoned all the defilements, then he has reached the end.

original: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa drug po de dag gis ni nyan thos kyi spyod pa thams cad kyi dang po dang / dbus dang / mtha' dag bstan te /
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa drug po de dag gis ni nyan thos kyi spyod pa thams cad kyi dang po dang / dbus dang / mtha' dag bstan te /
translated: These six types of persons present the beginning, middle, and end of the entire practice of the disciples.

original: de la rigs kyis ni nyan thos kyi spyod pa dang po bstan to //
analyzed: de la rigs kyis ni nyan thos kyi spyod pa dang po bstan to //
translated: Among them, the one who is by lineage is the beginning of the practice of the disciples.

original: mthar thug par gyur pas ni mtha' bstan to //
analyzed: mthar thug par gyur pas ni mtha' bstan to //
translated: The one who has reached the end is the end.

original: de las gzhan pa dag gis ni dbus bstan to //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag gis ni dbus bstan to //
translated: The others present the middle.

original: de la ci zhugs pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dus kyi tshad nges shing mnyam pa yin na /
analyzed: de la ci zhugs pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dus kyi tshad nges shing mnyam pa yin na /
translated: Now, if the time of final nirvāṇa is fixed and the same for all persons who have entered the fixed condition,

original: 'on te thams cad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus kyi tshad ma nges shing mi mnyam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus kyi tshad ma nges shing mi mnyam pa yin zhe na /
translated: Or, is the time of parinirvana of all beings determined and not indeterminate?

original: smras pa / de dag thams cad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus kyi tshad nges pa yang ma yin la mnyam pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag thams cad kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dus kyi tshad nges pa yang ma yin la mnyam pa yang ma yin no //
translated: All of them, without exception, have an undetermined time of parinirvana and not a determined one.

original: 'on kyang de dag ni ji ltar rigs pa dang / rkyen ji ltar rnyed pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni ji ltar rigs pa dang / rkyen ji ltar rnyed pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar rig par bya ste /
translated: However, they should be understood to attain parinirvana in accordance with the circumstances and conditions they encounter.

original: kha cig ni yun ring pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni yun ring pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some attain parinirvana after a long time,

original: kha cig la ni ha chang yun ring po ma yin pas so //
analyzed: kha cig la ni ha chang yun ring po ma yin pas so //
translated: some not so long,

original: kha cig ni myur ba kho nas so //
analyzed: kha cig ni myur ba kho nas so //
translated: and some very quickly.

original: de lta mod kyi rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag thams cad pas /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi rigs la gnas pa'i gang zag thams cad pas /
translated: However, all individuals who abide in the spiritual lineage

original: myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang /
analyzed: myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa gang yin pa de yang /
translated: attain parinirvana quickly.

original: gdon mi za bar skye ba gsum mngon par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar skye ba gsum mngon par sgrub par byed de /
translated: Undoubtedly, they accomplish three births.

original: skye ba gcig la ni 'jug par byed do //🔽gcig @13b la ni yong su smin par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba gcig la ni 'jug par byed do // gcig @13b la ni yong su smin par byed do //
translated: He enters into the first in one birth,🔽he perfects it in one birth,

original: gcig la ni yongs su smin par gur pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig la ni yongs su smin par gur pa yin te /
translated: and he is perfected in one birth.

original: de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed do //
translated: He attains Nirvana in that very birth.

original: gal te yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' na ni /
analyzed: gal te yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' na ni /
translated: If he does not attain Nirvana,

original: de gdon mi za bar slob pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de gdon mi za bar slob pas 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur zhing //
translated: he necessarily dies as a learner.

original: re ltar thogs na yang srid pa bdun /
analyzed: re ltar thogs na yang srid pa bdun /
translated: At the most, he will have seven rebirths.

original: las lhag par mngon par sgrub par mi byed do /
analyzed: las lhag par mngon par sgrub par mi byed do /
translated: He does not accumulate karma in excess of that.

original: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the establishment of entry.

original: zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the signs of a person who has entered?

original: 'di la rig sal pa'i gang zag ni zhugs pa kho na tsam gyis gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di la rig sal pa'i gang zag ni zhugs pa kho na tsam gyis gang gi tshe /
translated: Here, a person who is a knower of reality, by merely entering,

original: tshe gzhan du 'phos shing rang gi ston pa dang / chos 'dul ba dag brjed par gyur kyang /
analyzed: tshe gzhan du 'phos shing rang gi ston pa dang / chos 'dul ba dag brjed par gyur kyang /
translated: when he passes on to another life, even if he forgets his teacher and the Dharma and the Vinaya,

original: nyes par bshad pa dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba dag yod cing med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba dag yod cing med pa ma yin la /
translated: There are teachings and disciplines that are badly explained, and there are teachings and disciplines that are well explained.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba'i bsngags pa dang / bstod pa dang / phan yon dag rnam grangs du mar thos kyang /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba'i bsngags pa dang / bstod pa dang / phan yon dag rnam grangs du mar thos kyang /
translated: Even though one hears many times the praise, the eulogy, and the benefits of the badly explained teachings and disciplines,

original: de la 'jug par mi byed cing rab tu 'byung bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de la 'jug par mi byed cing rab tu 'byung bar mi byed do //
translated: one does not enter into them, one does not go forth into them.

original: zhugs shing rab tu byung na yang /🔽dper na sprang rtsi la skyes pa'i srog chags tshar bcug pa'am /
analyzed: zhugs shing rab tu byung na yang / dper na sprang rtsi la skyes pa'i srog chags tshar bcug pa'am /
translated: Even if one does enter into them and go forth into them,🔽like a creature born in honey who is destroyed,

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod par byed pa ljan ljin gyi rdzab tu bcug pa bzhin tu /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod par byed pa ljan ljin gyi rdzab tu bcug pa bzhin tu /
translated: or like one who enjoys sensual pleasures and is immersed in a swamp,

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: one will be like this:

original: sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs bskyed pa kho nas de la rang bzhin gyis mi dga' bzhin du gnas shing myur ba myur ba kho nar phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs bskyed pa kho nas de la rang bzhin gyis mi dga' bzhin du gnas shing myur ba myur ba kho nar phyir ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: only through the power of a previous cause, one will naturally not like them and will quickly turn away from them.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba'i bsngags pa dang / phan yon cung zad tsam dang ngan don tsam dag ma nyams kyang rung ma mnyan kyang rung //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba'i bsngags pa dang / phan yon cung zad tsam dang ngan don tsam dag ma nyams kyang rung ma mnyan kyang rung //
translated: Even if he has not heard a little or a great deal about the praise and benefits of the well-expounded Dharma and Vinaya,

original: thos kyang rung ma thos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: thos kyang rung ma thos kyang rung ste /
translated: whether he has heard it or not,

original: myur ba myur ba kho nar de la 'jug cing /
analyzed: myur ba myur ba kho nar de la 'jug cing /
translated: he quickly, quickly enters it.

original: rab tu 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la /
translated: He goes forth.

original: de ltar zhugs shing rab tu byung nas kyang /🔽dper na sbrang rtsi las skyes pa'i srog chags sbrang rtsir rab bcug pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs shing rab tu byung nas kyang / dper na sbrang rtsi las skyes pa'i srog chags sbrang rtsir rab bcug pa'am /
translated: Having entered and gone forth,🔽like a being born from honey who enters honey,

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod par byed pa 'dod pa'i spyod pa gya nom pa dag la bkod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod par byed pa 'dod pa'i spyod pa gya nom pa dag la bkod pa bzhin du /
translated: or like one who is established in the enjoyment of desires, in the excellent conduct of desires,

original: de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: that person is like this.

original: sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs bskyed pa kho nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs bskyed pa kho nas /
translated: By the power of his previous causes alone,

original: de la rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i bzhin du gnas shing /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis dga' ba'i bzhin du gnas shing /
translated: he naturally abides with a joyful face,

original: phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: and does not turn back.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags dang po yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags dang po yin no //
translated: This is the first sign of a person who has entered.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni /
translated: Moreover, a person who has entered

original: re zhig ngan song dang / mi khom par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa @14a * //
analyzed: re zhig ngan song dang / mi khom par 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i nyon mongs pa @14a * //
translated: For a while, you will go to the lower realms and to places lacking freedom.🔽

original: rnams dang bral ba ma yin na yang /
analyzed: rnams dang bral ba ma yin na yang /
translated: For a while, he is not free from the afflictions that lead to the lower realms and the unfavorable states.

original: mi khom pa rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi khom pa rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But he does not take birth in the unfavorable states.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhugs pa'i gang zag la dgongs nas //🔽gang la 'jig rten yang dag lta //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhugs pa'i gang zag la dgongs nas // gang la 'jig rten yang dag lta //
translated: The Bhagavån, thinking of the person who has entered the path, said:

original: chen po yod par gyur ba de //🔽tshe rab stong phrag rnams su yang //
analyzed: chen po yod par gyur ba de // tshe rab stong phrag rnams su yang //
translated: Those who have the great right view🔽will not go to the lower realms

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: for thousands of lifetimes.

original: de yang gang gi tshe yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i chos chen po dag la rim gyis zhugs par gyur ba de'i tshe /🔽mi khom pa rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba la bya'i //
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i chos chen po dag la rim gyis zhugs par gyur ba de'i tshe / mi khom pa rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur ba la bya'i //
translated: This is said of the person who has entered the path of the great wholesome qualities that lead to full maturity.

original: gzhan dag la zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not said of those who have entered other paths.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second mark of the person who has entered the path.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni sangs rgyas sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni sangs rgyas sam /
translated: Moreover, the person who has entered the path does not turn away from the Buddha,

original: chos sam / dge 'dun gyi yon tan dag thos sam /
analyzed: chos sam / dge 'dun gyi yon tan dag thos sam /
translated: or the qualities of the Dharma or the Saṅgha,

original: dran nas dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i dad pa rgya chen po'i sems can thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dran nas dge ba nges par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i dad pa rgya chen po'i sems can thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and then, having heard or remembered them, he or she attains a vast faith that is accompanied by a virtuous aspiration for deliverance.

original: dmigs pa des yang dang yang du dad pas brlan pa'i sems kyis ma tshim khrug ces byed pa dang / spu zing zhes byed pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dmigs pa des yang dang yang du dad pas brlan pa'i sems kyis ma tshim khrug ces byed pa dang / spu zing zhes byed pa 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: And, with a mind that is repeatedly moistened by faith toward those objects, he or she experiences a sense of satisfaction and the hairs of the body stand on end.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third mark of a person who is a beginner.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni /
translated: “Moreover, a person who is a beginner

original: 'od lta ste /🔽kha na ma tho ba kun 'byung ba'i gnas thams cad la ;
analyzed: 'od lta ste / kha na ma tho ba kun 'byung ba'i gnas thams cad la ;
translated: is like a lamp.

original: rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa shas chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa shas chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He or she naturally possesses a great sense of shame and abashment with regard to all the bases that give rise to offenses.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtag bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtag bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth mark of a person who is a beginner.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni /
translated: “Moreover, a person who is a beginner

original: lung nod pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / yongs su zhu ba dang / rnal 'byor du bya ba dang / yid la bya ba dag la 'dun cing 'dun pa drag po dang ldan la /
analyzed: lung nod pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / yongs su zhu ba dang / rnal 'byor du bya ba dang / yid la bya ba dag la 'dun cing 'dun pa drag po dang ldan la /
translated: He is intent on and has a strong aspiration for receiving the scriptures, reciting them, asking questions about them, practicing them, and keeping them in mind.

original: dge ba gang yin zhes tshol bar byed de //
analyzed: dge ba gang yin zhes tshol bar byed de //
translated: He seeks out what is virtuous.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags lnga pa yin no //
translated: This is the fifth mark of a person who is a beginner.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni 'di lta ste /🔽yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni 'di lta ste / yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, a person who is a beginner

original: las kyi mtha' kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba yang dag par blangs pa thams cad la /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' kha na ma tho ba med pa thams cad dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba yang dag par blangs pa thams cad la /
translated: undertakes all the bases of training that are free of wrongdoing and all the practices that are virtuous🔽in order to accomplish them.

original: dam du rtsom pa dang / brtan par rtsom pa dang / shin tu nges par rtsom pa yin te /
analyzed: dam du rtsom pa dang / brtan par rtsom pa dang / shin tu nges par rtsom pa yin te /
translated: He undertakes them firmly, he undertakes them steadfastly, and he undertakes them with certainty.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags drug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the sixth mark of a person who is a beginner.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod @14b chags chung ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni rang bzhin gyis 'dod @14b chags chung ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, a person who is a beginner is naturally one who has little desire.

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa chung du chung ngu ngag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa chung du chung ngu ngag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: He does not allow the minor and lesser fetters of the mental afflictions to arise.

original: rgyun gnas par mi byed la /
analyzed: rgyun gnas par mi byed la /
translated: He does not allow them to remain.

original: g-yon med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ngar 'dzin pa nges par bcom pa dang / yon tan la mngon par zhugs pa dang ; skyon la sdang ba yin te /
analyzed: g-yon med pa dang / sgyu med pa dang / rgyags pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ngar 'dzin pa nges par bcom pa dang / yon tan la mngon par zhugs pa dang ; skyon la sdang ba yin te /
translated: He is without deceit, without pretense, without arrogance, without pride, and without a sense of “me.” He is devoted to good qualities and is averse to faults.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh mark of a person who is dedicated.

original: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni rtogs par bya ba'i gnas rgya chen po dag la sems kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs pa'i gang zag ni rtogs par bya ba'i gnas rgya chen po dag la sems kun tu zhum par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: “Moreover, a person who is dedicated does not allow his or her mind to become timid about the extensive topics that need to be understood.

original: bdag nyid dpa' 'gong bar mi byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid dpa' 'gong bar mi byed la /
translated: He or she does not become discouraged.

original: mthu med pa la gnas par mi byed cing mos pa mang ba yin te /
analyzed: mthu med pa la gnas par mi byed cing mos pa mang ba yin te /
translated: He or she does not remain in a state of weakness. He or she has great devotion.

original: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams brgyad pa yin no //
translated: This is the eighth mark of a person who is dedicated.

original: zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rtags ni de lta bu dang mthun pa mang du yod par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams kyi rtags ni de lta bu dang mthun pa mang du yod par rig par bya ste //
translated: “There are many other marks that are similar to these that should be understood as being the marks of a person who is dedicated.

original: de dag las 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las 'di ni phyogs tsam zhig brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is just a brief description of these signs.

original: rtags de dag kyang zhugs pa'i gang zag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du la gnas pa dag gis ni bar du 'chad pa dang / rgyun chags pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa ste chung ba yin no //
analyzed: rtags de dag kyang zhugs pa'i gang zag dge ba'i rtsa ba chung du la gnas pa dag gis ni bar du 'chad pa dang / rgyun chags pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par ma dag pa ste chung ba yin no //
translated: These signs are weak for persons who have entered the Great Vehicle and who are established in the lesser roots of virtue. They are weak because they are interrupted, not continuous, and not purified.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'bring la gnas pa dag ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i 'bring la gnas pa dag ni 'bring yin no //
translated: They are middling for those who are established in middling roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po la gnas pa dag gi ni bar du chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang / che ba yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po la gnas pa dag gi ni bar du chad pa med pa dang / rgyun chags pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang / che ba yin no //
translated: They are great for those who are established in great roots of virtue. They are great because they are uninterrupted, continuous, and purified.

original: de dag ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags rnams yin no //
translated: These are the signs of persons who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: zhugs pa'i rtags de dag dang ldan na zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i rtags de dag dang ldan na zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Those who possess these signs of having entered the Great Vehicle are counted as having entered the Great Vehicle.

original: rigs la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams kyis rtags de dag ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa dang zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams kyis rtags de dag ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yin par rigs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that these signs of having entered the Great Vehicle are to be inferred in those who are established in the lineage and in those who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: skyob pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyon thos dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa rnams kyis ni de dag la ye shes gzigs pa rnam par dag pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skyob pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / nyon thos dam pa'i pha rol tu son pa rnams kyis ni de dag la ye shes gzigs pa rnam par dag pas 'di lta ste /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas, the Protectors, and the Holy Ones who have reached the other shore, by means of their pure knowledge, see the following:

original: rigs dang zhugs pa dag / mngon sum du gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang zhugs pa dag / mngon sum du gzigs pa'o //
translated: the families and the persons who are engaged.

original: zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i gang zag rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the persons who are engaged?

original: zhugs pa'i gang zag zhugs pa kho na yin la /🔽yongs su smin par byed pa yang ma yin /🔽yongs su smin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: zhugs pa'i gang zag zhugs pa kho na yin la / yongs su smin par byed pa yang ma yin / yongs su smin pa yang ma yin /
translated: There are persons who are engaged and only engaged.

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽yongs su smin par byed pa yin la /🔽yongs @15a * //🔽su smin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yang yod do // yongs su smin par byed pa yin la / yongs @15a * // su smin pa yang ma yin /
translated: There are persons who are engaged and only engaged, who are not ripening, who are not ripe, and who are not liberated.

original: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽yongs su smin pa yin la /🔽nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yang yod do // yongs su smin pa yin la / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There are persons who are engaged and only engaged, who are ripening, who are not ripe, and who are not liberated.🔽There are persons who are engaged and only engaged, who are ripening, who are ripe, and who are not liberated.🔽There are persons who are engaged and only engaged, who are ripening, who are not ripe, and who are liberated.

original: nges par byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: nges par byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There are persons who are engaged and only engaged, who are ripening, who are ripe, and who are liberated.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin du rigs par bya'o //
translated: The distinctions between these should be understood as above.

original: gang dag de dag las gzhan pa gang zag dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye ba rigs kyi sa'i skabs su bstan pa de dag kyang 'dir ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag de dag las gzhan pa gang zag dbang po rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye ba rigs kyi sa'i skabs su bstan pa de dag kyang 'dir ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The other types of persons, such as those of dull faculties, should be understood as appropriate in this context, as they were explained in the chapter on the stages of the spiritual lineages.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dang / rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de dang / zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags gang dag yin pa de dag dang / zhugs pa'i gang zag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni 'jug pa'i zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de dang / rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de dang / zhugs pa'i gang zag gi rtags gang dag yin pa de dag dang / zhugs pa'i gang zag gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni 'jug pa'i zhes bya'o /
translated: The nature of engagement, the principles of engagement, the signs of the person who is engaged, and the persons who are engaged—all of these are included in what is called the stage of engagement.

original: bar gyi sdom ni //
analyzed: bar gyi sdom ni //
translated: The intermediate summary:

original: rang bzhin dag ni de dag gzhag / rtags rnams dang ni gang zag dag / de dag thams cad mdor bsdus te //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni de dag gzhag / rtags rnams dang ni gang zag dag / de dag thams cad mdor bsdus te //
translated: The natures, the principles, the signs, and the persons—all of these are included in what is called the stage of engagement.

original: 'jug pa'i sar ni shes par bya //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sar ni shes par bya //
translated: The stage of engagement should be understood.

original: nyan thos kyis las 'jug pa'i sa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'jug pa'i sa rdzogs so /
translated: The stage of engagement for the śrāvaka is complete.

original: // / de la nges par 'byung ba'i sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / de la nges par 'byung ba'i sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage of departure?

original: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / de dag nyid kyi tshogs gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / de dag nyid kyi tshogs gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni nges par 'byung ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: He said: The stage of liberation is the sum total of the path of detachment from passion by the mundane path, the path of detachment from passion by the supramundane path, and the path of preparation for the supramundane path.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar sbrel 'gyur ba gang zhe na /🔽'di ltar di na la la 'dod pa'i khams la rags par lta zhing snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba yod pa /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar sbrel 'gyur ba gang zhe na / 'di ltar di na la la 'dod pa'i khams la rags par lta zhing snyoms par 'jug pa dang skye ba yod pa /
translated: What is the path of detachment from passion by the mundane path?🔽It is the path of cultivation of the adept.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can gyi bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi bar lta'o //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba can gyi bsam gtan dang po la ni zhi bar lta'o //
translated: There is someone who sees the realm of desire as coarse and who sees the first meditation, which is born of detachment, as tranquil.

original: de de ltar zhing de la lan mang du gnas pan 'dod pa la chags dang bral ba thob cing /
analyzed: de de ltar zhing de la lan mang du gnas pan 'dod pa la chags dang bral ba thob cing /
translated: He frequently abides in this thought and obtains detachment from the realm of desire.

original: bsam gtan dang po la yang snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yang snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: He also enters into the first meditation.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i gong ma dag nas kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po'i gong ma dag nas kyang /
translated: So too, the higher realms above the first absorption are also like this.

original: sa 'og ma thams cad la rags par lta zhing sa gong ma thams cad la ni zhi bar lta'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma thams cad la rags par lta zhing sa gong ma thams cad la ni zhi bar lta'o //
translated: In the same way, one sees all the lower stages as coarse and all the higher stages as peaceful.

original: de de ltar lta zhing de dag la lan mang du gnas pa na ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob @15b cing ;
analyzed: de de ltar lta zhing de dag la lan mang du gnas pa na ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba thob @15b cing ;
translated: When one sees in this way and frequently abides in this, one attains freedom from attachment up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la yang snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la yang snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: One also enters into the meditative absorption of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called freedom from attachment through the mundane path.

original: de las gong na yang med la de las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las gong na yang med la de las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this, nothing superior to this.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is freedom from attachment through the supramundane path?

original: 'di lta 'di na skyes bu dam pa rnams mthong ba /🔽'phags pa'i chos rnams la mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'di lta 'di na skyes bu dam pa rnams mthong ba / 'phags pa'i chos rnams la mkhas pa /
translated: Here, a person sees the noble ones,🔽is skilled in the noble teachings,

original: 'phyags pa'i chos rnams la bzo ba la la /
analyzed: 'phyags pa'i chos rnams la bzo ba la la /
translated: and is skilled in the noble teachings.

original: sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la 'gog pa dang / lam la lam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing slob pa'i ye shes dang mthong ba dang ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la 'gog pa dang / lam la lam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes shing slob pa'i ye shes dang mthong ba dang ldan par gyur na /
translated: He knows suffering as suffering, the origin as the origin, cessation as cessation, and the path as the path, and he possesses the wisdom and vision of one in training.

original: de'i gong du lam sgom par byed pa na /🔽khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams la bdag nyid 'bral ba byed /
analyzed: de'i gong du lam sgom par byed pa na / khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams la bdag nyid 'bral ba byed /
translated: When he cultivates the path beyond that,

original: rnam par grol bar byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar byed cing /
translated: he becomes separated from and liberated from the phenomena of the three realms that are to be abandoned by seeing and by cultivation.

original: de ltar de khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar de khams gsum pa las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur pa ste /
translated: In this way, he transcends the three realms.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the transformation of being free from attachment through the supramundane path.”

original: de dag nyid kyi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the collection of those?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bdag gi 'byor pa dang / gzhan gyi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdoms pa dang / dbang po sdoms pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang /
analyzed: bdag gi 'byor pa dang / gzhan gyi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / tshul khrims kyi sdoms pa dang / dbang po sdoms pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang /
translated: one’s own wealth, the wealth of others, the aspiration for virtuous qualities, the restraint of moral discipline, the restraint of the sense faculties, moderation in eating, being devoted to wakefulness during the first and last parts of the night,

original: shes bzhin du sbyor ba nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin du sbyor ba nyid dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang bar chad med pa dang / gtong ba spel ba dang / dge sbyong gi rgyan gang yin pa ste /
translated: being devoted to introspection, virtuous spiritual friends, listening to the sublime teaching, the absence of mental afflictions, the increase of generosity, and the ornaments of a spiritual practitioner.

original: chos de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the accumulations that lead to freedom from attachment through the supramundane path.”

original: de la bdag gi 'byor ba dang / gzhan gyi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa gang yin pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni sngar sa bon yang dag par 'grub pa'i rkyen sman pa bshad pa'i skabs kyi bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi 'byor ba dang / gzhan gyi 'byor ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa gang yin pa de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni sngar sa bon yang dag par 'grub pa'i rkyen sman pa bshad pa'i skabs kyi bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of these should be understood as explained in the chapter on the conditions for the correct establishment of the seed.

original: de la tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang @16a * //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gang @16a * //
translated: What is the restraint of morality?

original: zhe na ; 'di ltar 'di na la la tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / khan ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang ;
analyzed: zhe na ; 'di ltar 'di na la la tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / khan ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang ;
translated: Here, someone lives morally, restrained by the restraint of the prātimokṣa, with complete acceptance of the rules, with complete purity of body and speech.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag pas blangs shing slob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag pas blangs shing slob par byed pa yin no //
translated: He sees danger in the slightest faults, and trains in the precepts.

original: de la ji ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one live morally?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi ji ltar yang dag par blangs pa dag la /🔽lus kyi las kyi mtha' ma log pa dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' ma log par gyur cing /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi ji ltar yang dag par blangs pa dag la / lus kyi las kyi mtha' ma log pa dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' ma log par gyur cing /
translated: He does not violate the bases of training that he has undertaken.🔽He does not violate the limits of what is morally good with regard to his physical and verbal actions.

original: ma nyams par byed par dang / skyon med par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ma nyams par byed par dang / skyon med par byed pa yin te /
translated: He does not violate the limits of what is morally good with regard to his mind.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he is one who abides in morality.

original: ji ltar na so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he one who is restrained by the prātimokṣa vows?

original: sde tshan bdun po dag gi tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sde tshan bdun po dag gi tshul khrims ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The morality of the seven groups is called the prātimokṣa vows.

original: sde tshan de dag gi bye brag las sdom pa yang mang por gyur pa yin no //🔽skabs 'dir ni dge slong gi sdom pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sde tshan de dag gi bye brag las sdom pa yang mang por gyur pa yin no // skabs 'dir ni dge slong gi sdom pa la brten nas /
translated: The vows are manifold because of the distinctions within those groups.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In this context, the prātimokṣa vows are the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: ji ltar na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /🔽'di lta ste spyod lam mam /
analyzed: ji ltar na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na / 'di lta ste spyod lam mam /
translated: How is he one who is perfect in his conduct?🔽He is perfect in his conduct with regard to his physical behavior,

original: 'phral gyi bya ba 'am ;
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba 'am ;
translated: his immediate actions,🔽and his mind.

original: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten nas /
translated: and on the basis of engaging in virtue,🔽

original: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun zhing 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i cho ga dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang rjes su mthun zhing 'jig rten dang mi 'gal ba dang / 'dul ba dang rjes su mthun zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba'i cho ga dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the rite that is in accordance with the world and not in conflict with the world, and in accordance with the Vinaya and not in conflict with the Vinaya, on the basis of engaging in virtue.

original: de la ji ltar na spyod lam la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na spyod lam la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the rite based on deportment is in accordance with the world and not in conflict with the Vinaya?

original: 'di lta ste gang du bcag par bya ba dang / ji ltar bcag par bya ba der /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gang du bcag par bya ba dang / ji ltar bcag par bya ba der /
translated: It is like this: He walks in a place where he should walk and in a way that he should walk.

original: gang gis 'jig rten gyi dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad par mi 'gyur ba dang / chos mthun pa rnams dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang 'dul ba la slob pa rnams kyis smad cing bshung bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'chag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'jig rten gyi dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis smad par mi 'gyur ba dang / chos mthun pa rnams dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang 'dul ba la slob pa rnams kyis smad cing bshung bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar 'chag par byed pa ste /
translated: He walks in such a way that he is not criticized by the best people in the world, the ones who have gone correctly, the holy people, and he is not criticized or despised by those who are in accord with the Dharma, those who uphold the Vinaya, and those who are training in the Vinaya.

original: 'chag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba rnams kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with walking, so it is with standing, sitting, and lying down.

original: de la ji ltar @16b na 'phral gyi bya ba la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dam mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba yin zhe na /🔽'phral gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos gos bgo ba dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba dang / chu 'thung ba dang / so shing za ba dang / grong du 'jug pa dang / bsod snyoms bsgrub pa dang / bza' ba dang /
analyzed: de la ji ltar @16b na 'phral gyi bya ba la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dam mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba yin zhe na / 'phral gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ni chos gos bgo ba dang / bshang ba dang / gci ba dang / chu 'thung ba dang / so shing za ba dang / grong du 'jug pa dang / bsod snyoms bsgrub pa dang / bza' ba dang /
translated: How is it that the rules of proper conduct do not conflict with the world and do not conflict with the monastic code?

original: lhung bzed bkru zhing gzhag pa dang / rkang pa bkru ba dang / mal dang / stan bshams pa dang / de dag nyid bsdu ba dang / lhung bzed kyi las dang / chos gos kyi las dang / chung zad de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa rnams ni 'phral gyi bya ba zhes bya ba ste /

original: de dag kyang ji ltar rigs ba dang / gang du bya ba dang / ji ltar bya ba der /

original: gang gis 'jig rten pa rnams dang rtsod par mi 'gyur zhing smad par mi 'gyur ba dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang 'dul ba la bslab pa rnams kyis smad par mi 'gyur ba dang / dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang /

original: chos mthun pa rnams kyis smad par mi 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos mthun pa rnams kyis smad par mi 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa ste /

analyzed: de ltar nas 'phral gyi bya ba la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba yin no //

original: gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i phyogs yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / chos bstan pa dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa dang / 'jug pa dang skyil mo krung bca' ba dang / 'dug pa dang gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos @17a * //🔽gang yin pa de ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ste /

translated: encouraging others to take up virtue, teaching the Dharma, and for those who are skilled in the practice of pure conduct, for those who are skilled and not lazy, doing physical service,🔽encouraging others to take up virtue, teaching the Dharma,

original: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba ji skad smos pa de dag ci rigs par gang du bya ba dang / ji ltar bya ba der gang gis 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang / 'dul ba la bslab pa rnams dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba ji skad smos pa de dag ci rigs par gang du bya ba dang / ji ltar bya ba der gang gis 'jig rten pa rnams dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa rnams dang / 'dul ba la bslab pa rnams dang /
translated: Whatever is to be done and however it is to be done in the practice of virtue as described, that is done in such a way that it is not contrary to the world, to the Vinaya, to the training in the Vinaya,

original: dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams dang chos mthun pa rnams dang / mi rtsod cing smad par mi 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa rnams dang / yang dag par song ba rnams dang / skyes bu dam pa rnams dang chos mthun pa rnams dang / mi rtsod cing smad par mi 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa ste /
translated: to the holy ones, to the noble ones, to the good people, to those who are in accord with the Dharma, and to those who are free from dispute and blame.

original: de ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten pa'i cho ga 'jig rten dang mi 'gal zhing 'dul ba dang mi 'gal ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ritual that is based on the practice of virtue and that is not contrary to the world and not contrary to the Vinaya.

original: cho ga'i rnam pa de lta bu dag dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cho ga'i rnam pa de lta bu dag dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One who possesses such forms of ritual is called “one who is perfect in ritual.”

original: de ltar na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na cho ga phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is the perfection of ritual.

original: ji ltar na spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are perfect in conduct?

original: dge sbyong gi spyod yul ma yin pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi spyod yul ma yin pa ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five things that are not the domain of a spiritual practitioner.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: shan pa'i gnas dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gnas dang / chang tshong gi gnas dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lnga pa gdol pa'i khyim kho na ste /
analyzed: shan pa'i gnas dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gnas dang / chang tshong gi gnas dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / lnga pa gdol pa'i khyim kho na ste /
translated: the domain of butchers, the domain of prostitutes, the domain of liquor sellers, the domain of the king’s palace, and the domain of outcastes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa spyod yul ma yin pa de dag spangs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa spyod yul ma yin pa de dag spangs nas /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has abandoned those domains that are censured and not to be practiced.

original: spyod yul kha na ma tho ba med pa gzhan dag tu spyod par byed cing /
analyzed: spyod yul kha na ma tho ba med pa gzhan dag tu spyod par byed cing /
translated: He practices in other domains that are free of wrongdoing.

original: de yang dus su spyod par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dus su spyod par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: He practices at the right time.

original: de ltar spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: This is how his domain is perfect.

original: ji ltar na kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin zhe na /
translated: “How does he regard even the slightest wrongdoing with fear?”

original: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: The slightest wrongdoing

original: bslab pa'i gzhi phra ba dang shin tu phra ba gang dag la ltung ba byung ba dang / bslang bar bya ba yod pa de dag gi ltung ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni kha na tho ba phra rab tsam dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi phra ba dang shin tu phra ba gang dag la ltung ba byung ba dang / bslang bar bya ba yod pa de dag gi ltung ba 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni kha na tho ba phra rab tsam dag ces bya'o //
translated: The downfall that occurs in relation to them is called “the slightest bit of a downfall.”

original: yang 'di ltar ltung ba 'byung ba de las tshogs chung ngus ldang bar 'gyur bas ;
analyzed: yang 'di ltar ltung ba 'byung ba de las tshogs chung ngus ldang bar 'gyur bas ;
translated: Moreover, the downfall that occurs in relation to them is restored by a small amount of effort.

original: de'i phyir yang de ni kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de ni kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam zhes bya'o //
translated: For that reason, it is also called “the slightest bit of a downfall.”

original: de la ji ltar na 'jigs par lta ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na 'jigs par lta ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the view of fear?

original: bdag ltung ba 'byung ba 'di'i rgyus ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba med @17b par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bdag ltung ba 'byung ba 'di'i rgyus ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba med @17b par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: “Because of this downfall that I have incurred, I will not be fortunate enough to attain what I have not attained, to realize what I have not realized, and to actualize what I have not actualized.

original: ngan song du nye bar 'gro bar bya ba'i ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ngan song du nye bar 'gro bar bya ba'i ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: I will go to the lower realms, and I will go to a miserable state.”

original: bdag la bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag la bdag nyid dam /
translated: “I will be despised by myself,

original: ston pa'am / lha rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ston pa'am / lha rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It would be shameful before the teacher or the gods.

original: tshangs ba mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas ba rnams kyis chos nyid kyis smad par 'gyur ba'am ;
analyzed: tshangs ba mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas ba rnams kyis chos nyid kyis smad par 'gyur ba'am ;
translated: It would be shameful before the learned practitioners of pure conduct by the nature of things.🔽It would be shameful before the whole world, in all directions, if the collection of sounds of my infamy and evil deeds were to spread.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su bdag gi sdig pa can gyi snyan pa bsngags ba ma yin pa'i sgra'i tshogs grags par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas de de'i rgyur gyur pa tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag la
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su bdag gi sdig pa can gyi snyan pa bsngags ba ma yin pa'i sgra'i tshogs grags par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas de de'i rgyur gyur pa tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag la
translated: Thus, fearing those things that are undesirable in this life and the next,

original: 'jigs par lta zhing des na srog gi phyir yang bslab pa'i gzhi phra ba dang shin tu phra ba de dag la bsams bzhin du ltung ba 'byin par yang mi byed do //🔽brgyal brgya la ma na /
analyzed: 'jigs par lta zhing des na srog gi phyir yang bslab pa'i gzhi phra ba dang shin tu phra ba de dag la bsams bzhin du ltung ba 'byin par yang mi byed do // brgyal brgya la ma na /
translated: he does not intentionally commit downfalls, even for the sake of his life, with regard to the subtle and extremely subtle bases of training.

original: brjod ngas pas ltung ba 'byung bar gyur na yang /
analyzed: brjod ngas pas ltung ba 'byung bar gyur na yang /
translated: Even if he does commit a downfall due to forgetfulness or carelessness,

original: myur ba myur ba kho nar chos bzhin du phyir byed cing slong bar byed de /
analyzed: myur ba myur ba kho nar chos bzhin du phyir byed cing slong bar byed de /
translated: he quickly and immediately restores it in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ltar na kha na ma thob phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na kha na ma thob phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
translated: Thus they view even the slightest negative action with fear.

original: ji ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How do they take up and train in the bases of the precepts?

original: smras dang / des sngon so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i tshe gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa na /
analyzed: smras dang / des sngon so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i tshe gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa na /
translated: When they previously took up the pratimoksha vows, they were fully ordained through the rite of requesting full ordination and the four requests.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi kha cig gi rang bzhin thos shing /🔽de las gzhan pa bslab pa'i gzhi lhag ma so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po dag kyang /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi kha cig gi rang bzhin thos shing / de las gzhan pa bslab pa'i gzhi lhag ma so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa nyis brgya lnga bcu po dag kyang /
translated: They heard the nature of some of the precepts.

original: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe /🔽mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam /🔽gtam 'dres pa 'am /
analyzed: zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa'i tshe / mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam / gtam 'dres pa 'am /
translated: They also heard the other remaining precepts, the two hundred and fifty precepts taught in the Sutra on the Bases of Training for Novices.🔽They heard these from their abbot, their master,

original: phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin nam /
analyzed: phebs par smra ba dang / smos 'drin nam /
translated: or from those with whom they associate,🔽those with whom they converse, those with whom they are familiar,

original: grogs bshes po dag las thos nas /
analyzed: grogs bshes po dag las thos nas /
translated: or from their friends.

original: thams cad la bslab par bya'o zhes dam bca' ba kho nar khas blangs pas de'i phyir //
analyzed: thams cad la bslab par bya'o zhes dam bca' ba kho nar khas blangs pas de'i phyir //
translated: He undertakes the vow to train in all of them.

original: des bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus so sor thar pa'i sdom pa thob po //
analyzed: des bslab pa'i gzhi thams cad yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus so sor thar pa'i sdom pa thob po //
translated: Therefore, he obtains the prātimokṣa vow by the cause of taking up all the bases of training.

original: dus de phyin chad ni bslab pa'i gzhi gang dag la mkhas par gyur pa /
analyzed: dus de phyin chad ni bslab pa'i gzhi gang dag la mkhas par gyur pa /
translated: From that time on, he becomes skilled in whatever bases of training he has not previously been skilled in.

original: de dag la ni re zhig lhung ba mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: de dag la ni re zhig lhung ba mi 'byung ste //
translated: He does not fall from those.

original: ltung ba na chos bzhin du phyir byed do //
analyzed: ltung ba na chos bzhin du phyir byed do //
translated: If he does fall, he restores it according to the Dharma.

original: sdom dam bcas pa yang dag par blangs pas yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gang dag la mi mkhas shing blo byang bar ma gyur pa de dag @18a * //🔽ni ; da ltar mkhan po'am /
analyzed: sdom dam bcas pa yang dag par blangs pas yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gang dag la mi mkhas shing blo byang bar ma gyur pa de dag @18a * // ni ; da ltar mkhan po'am /
translated: He also takes up the bases of training that he has not previously taken up, those that he has not been skilled in, and those that he has not mastered.

original: slob dpon nam /
analyzed: slob dpon nam /
translated: He does this from a preceptor or a master🔽or from a text, as previously explained.

original: snga ma bzhin du sngar ji skad bstan pa'i gnas de las byed brag tu bshad pa la mkhas pas yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sngar ji skad bstan pa'i gnas de las byed brag tu bshad pa la mkhas pas yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: He takes them up correctly through skill in the Abhidharma.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa la mkhas bas yang dag par blangs nas kyang /
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa la mkhas bas yang dag par blangs nas kyang /
translated: Having taken up the training in the precepts in detail through expertise in the Abhidharma,

original: ji ltar rjes su bstan pa bzhin du lhag chad med par slob par byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su bstan pa bzhin du lhag chad med par slob par byed cing /
translated: one trains in the precepts just as they have been taught, without excess or omission.

original: bla ma dang bla ma lta bu dag gis bstan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la don dam tshig 'bru phyin ci ma log par yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: bla ma dang bla ma lta bu dag gis bstan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la don dam tshig 'bru phyin ci ma log par yongs su 'dzin par byed do //
translated: And one holds the meaning and the words of the precepts taught by the guru and those like the guru without error.

original: de ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one takes up the precepts and trains in them.

original: de ni re zhig tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i rnam par dbye ba rgyas cher byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i rnam par dbye ba rgyas cher byas pa yin no //
translated: This is the extensive classification of the vows of ethical discipline.

original: de la don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concise meaning of that?

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid gsum yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni don mdor bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid gsum yongs su bstan pa gang yin pa de ni don mdor bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The three characteristics of the aggregate of ethical discipline that were taught by the Bhagavān are the concise meaning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid dang // rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid dang // rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin gyi yon tan gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of non-wastage, the characteristic of intrinsic nature, and the characteristic of the intrinsic nature of the qualities.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes gang gsungs pa de ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes gang gsungs pa de ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase, “he abides endowed with morality” indicates the characteristic of non-wastage of the vow of morality.

analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase, “he is restrained by the restraint of the pratimoksa” indicates the characteristic of intrinsic nature.

original: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /
analyzed: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /
translated: The phrase, “he is perfect in his conduct and sphere of activity” indicates

analyzed: pha rol la brten nas de ltar yang dag par blangs pa'i so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid bstan te /

original: gzhan du na tshul khrims dang ldan du zin kyang /
analyzed: gzhan du na tshul khrims dang ldan du zin kyang /

analyzed: de la de las bzlog pa'i skyon @18b 'ba' zhig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: khan ma thob ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /

analyzed: bdag gi dbang gis byung ba kho na'i yon tan dang / rjes su bsngags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: indicates the good qualities and praise that arise from one's own power alone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs shing gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba'i yon tan dang / rjes su bsngags pa thob tu zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs shing gzhan gyi dbang gis byung ba'i yon tan dang / rjes su bsngags pa thob tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though one may have attained qualities and praise that arise from being in the company of others and having perfect ritual and conduct,

original: tshul khrims nyams par byas nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par byas nas /
translated: if one’s moral discipline degenerates,

analyzed: rgyu de dang rkyen des ngan songs rnams su yang skye bar 'gyur na ;

analyzed: gang kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi chen po dag yang dag par blangs shing /

original: slob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: slob par byed pa ni /

analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu de dang rkyen des ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur zhing bde 'gro lha dang mi rnams skye bar 'gyur ba dang / snga ma bzhin du ma thob pa thob par bya ba'i skal pa yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, due to that cause and condition, one will not be born in the lower realms, but will be born as a god or human in the upper realms, and will have the fortune to attain what has not been attained, as before.

original: rgyu des na bdag gi dbang gis byung ba 'di ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i yon tan dang / rjes su bsngags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu des na bdag gi dbang gis byung ba 'di ni tshul khrims kyi sdom pa'i yon tan dang / rjes su bsngags pa zhes bya'o //

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang mdor bsdu na /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa dang / des par 'byin pa'i tshul khrims dang tshul khrims bsgoms pa zhes gsungs pa yin te /

translated: In brief, the Blessed One has taught morality as the taking of vows, the morality of definite deliverance, and the morality of cultivating virtue.

original: de la re zhig tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /🔽tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la re zhig tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /🔽tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa bstan to //
translated: Among them, the statement abiding with morality teaches the taking of vows.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /
translated: The phrase restrained by the prātimokṣa vow indicates

analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i tshul khrims bstan te /

analyzed: 'di ltar so sor thar pa'i sdom pas yang dag par bsdus pa'i tshul khrims ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the morality that is included in the prātimokṣa vow is called the training in superior morality.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la brten nas /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la brten nas /

analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa sgom par byed do //
translated: one cultivates the training in superior mind and the training in superior wisdom.

original: de ltar na de ni 'dir lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni 'dir lta ste /
translated: Thus, here,

analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa'i sngon du btang nas nges par 'byung bar @19a * // 'gyur ba'i phyir te /

analyzed: de'i phyir so sor thar pa'i sdom pas ni nges bar 'byin pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the prātimokṣa vow is called the morality that leads to liberation.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang / bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs shing slob par byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa des ni /
translated: The phrase one who is endowed with the perfection of ritual and proper conduct, who regards even the slightest misdeed as a terrifying thing, and who undertakes and trains in the precepts indicates

original: tshul khrims bsgoms pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgoms pa bstan te /
translated: the cultivation of morality.

original: rnam pa de dag gis so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims de bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gis so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims de bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate the morality of the prātimokṣa vows by means of these aspects.

original: de ltar bsgoms na legs par bsgoms pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms na legs par bsgoms pa'i phyir te /
translated: If one cultivates them in this way, it is called the cultivation of morality.

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa gcig pu la yang bshad pa so sor gnas pa rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi sdom pa de yang rgyu rnam pa bcus nyams pa yin la /

analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnam pa bcus ni phun tshogs pa yin par rigs par bya'o //

original: nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyur rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyur rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /

original: dang po nyid nas nyes par blangs pa dang / ha cang zhum pa dang / thal ches pa dang / bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa dang / log par smon pa dang / cho ga nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: dang po nyid nas nyes par blangs pa dang / ha cang zhum pa dang / thal ches pa dang / bag med pa dang / le los yongs su zin pa dang / log par smon pa dang / cho ga nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: The first is to take it up wrongly, to be excessively timid, to be excessively bold, to be careless, to be seized by laziness, to have wrong aspirations, to be seized by a decline in ritual,🔽

analyzed: 'tsho ba nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang / mtha' gnyis su lhung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa dang / yang dag par blangs pa yongs su nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: 1. Taking up the precepts poorly from the beginning, 2. being excessively timid, 3. being excessively bold, 4. being careless, 5. being lazy, 6. having wrong aspirations, 7. having a livelihood that is defective, 8. having a livelihood that is corrupt, 9. falling into the two extremes, 10. not being liberated, and 11. letting go of what has been properly undertaken.

analyzed: de la ji ltar na dang po nyid nas tshul khrims nyes par blangs pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'dzin la la rgyal pos gtses pa'am /

analyzed: chom rkun las gtses sam //

original: bu lon gyis nyam thag pa 'am ;
analyzed: bu lon gyis nyam thag pa 'am ;

analyzed: kun nas mnar sems kyi sems skyed par byed pa dang / go bar byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de ltar na thal ches pa yin no //

translated: In dependence on the past, just as it is, in dependence on the future and the present, whatever transgressions occur, because of their forgetfulness,🔽they do not make amends for any of them in accordance with the Dharma.

translated: And, before the transgression has occurred, in order that the transgression not occur later,🔽“Whatever I do and

analyzed: de sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa dang / dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa dang / sngon gyi dus su bya ba dang / rjes su 'jug pa des bag med pa dang ldan pa yin zhing /

analyzed: gzhan dag las rnyed pa dang bskur sti sgrub par byed cing /

analyzed: de ltar na log par smon pa yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar na cho ga nyams bas yongs su zin pa yin zhe na / 'di ltar 'di na la la spyod lam mam / 'phral gyi bya ba'am /
translated: How are they seized by the degeneration of ritual?🔽In this case, some people, in their observance of morality,

analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor ba la brten nas /
translated: ascetic practices, austerities, or celibacy,🔽are attached to their ritual,
