original: rnam dbye rnam gsum shes par bya //
analyzed: rnam dbye rnam gsum shes par bya //
translated: The three types of classification should be known.

original: phun sum tshogs pa rnams bcur 'gyur //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa rnams bcur 'gyur //
translated: The perfections are ten.

original: rnam grangs rnam pa drug yin te //
analyzed: rnam grangs rnam pa drug yin te //
translated: The enumerations are of six types.

original: rnam dag rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: rnam dag rnam pa gsum du 'dod //
translated: The purities are considered to be of three types.

original: phan yon rnam pa bcu yin te //
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa bcu yin te //
translated: The benefits are ten.

original: de ni tshul khrims sdom pa yin //
analyzed: de ni tshul khrims sdom pa yin //
translated: This is the restraint of morality.

original: dbang po'i sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po'i sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the restraint of the sense faculties?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa dang / dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa dang / dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang / dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed cing gnas pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, someone guards the sense-doors, protects mindfulness, is vigilant with mindfulness, guards the mind with mindfulness, and is established in evenness in regard to the faculties.

original: de la ji ltar na dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa yin zhe na /🔽dran pa kun tu bsrungs ba dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa nas yid kyi dbang po yang srung bar byed la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa yin zhe na / dran pa kun tu bsrungs ba dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa nas yid kyi dbang po yang srung bar byed la /
translated: How does one guard the sense-doors?🔽One protects mindfulness, is vigilant with mindfulness, and guards the faculty of the mind.

original: yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub bar byed pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub bar byed pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya ste /
translated: One establishes the restraint of the mind.

original: de ltar na dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te gnas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one guards the sense-doors.

original: de la ji ltar na dran pa kun tu bsrung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na dran pa kun tu bsrung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does one guard mindfulness?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la /
translated: Here, someone

original: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams pa nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: in terms of the restraint of the sense doors

original: thos pa bzung ba dang / bsams pa dang / yang dang yang du bsgoms par gyur nas /
analyzed: thos pa bzung ba dang / bsams pa dang / yang dang yang du bsgoms par gyur nas /
translated: has heard, retained, and repeatedly contemplated the teachings,🔽and through hearing, contemplating, and meditating,

original: de thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i dbang gis dran pa thob bar gyur cing /
analyzed: de thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa'i dbang gis dran pa thob bar gyur cing /
translated: he has attained mindfulness.

original: dran pa thob pa de nyid mi brjed par bya ba dang / mi nyams par bya ba dang / chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa thob pa de nyid mi brjed par bya ba dang / mi nyams par bya ba dang / chud mi za bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to not forget, not lose, and not waste that attained mindfulness,

original: thos pa de nyid la dus dus su sbyor ba byed de /
analyzed: thos pa de nyid la dus dus su sbyor ba byed de /
translated: he applies himself to that hearing again and again.

original: goms par byed cing /
analyzed: goms par byed cing /
translated: He becomes familiar with it.

original: @26a * // bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la yang sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: @26a * // bsams pa dang bsgoms pa la yang sbyor bar byed de /
translated: He also applies himself to contemplation and meditation.

original: goms par byed /
analyzed: goms par byed /
translated: He becomes familiar with them.

original: sbyor ba lhod pa dang sbyor ba gtong bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba lhod pa dang sbyor ba gtong bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He does not relax his application nor does he give up his application.

original: de ltar des thos pas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar des thos pas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dran pa ste /
translated: Thus, he attains mindfulness that is accomplished through hearing.

original: thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sbyor ba'i bya bas ;
analyzed: thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa la sbyor ba'i bya bas ;
translated: By means of the activities of listening, reflection, and meditation,

original: dus dus su kun tu bsrungs pa yin te /
analyzed: dus dus su kun tu bsrungs pa yin te /
translated: he protects mindfulness from time to time.

original: de ltar na dran pa dang kun tu bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dran pa dang kun tu bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he protects mindfulness.

original: ji ltar na dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he make effort to be mindful?

original: de dran pa de nyid la rtag tu byed pa dang 'grus par byed pa yin te /🔽de la rtag tu byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun du byed pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de dran pa de nyid la rtag tu byed pa dang 'grus par byed pa yin te / de la rtag tu byed pa gang yin pa de ni rgyun du byed pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: He is always and constantly mindful of that mindfulness.🔽That which is always is called “constant.”

original: / de la 'grus par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'grus par byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: / de la 'grus par byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'grus par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is constantly is called “effort.”

original: de ltar rgyun du byed pa dang gus par byed pa de ni dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du byed pa dang gus par byed pa de ni dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, that which is constant and that which is effort is called “making effort to be mindful.”

original: des ji tsam du dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa de tsam du dran pa de brjod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des ji tsam du dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa de tsam du dran pa de brjod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: To the extent that he protects mindfulness, to that extent that mindfulness is not expressed.

original: de ji tsam du dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa de tsam du dran pa ma brjod pa de nyid la stobs skyed pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ji tsam du dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa de tsam du dran pa ma brjod pa de nyid la stobs skyed pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: As much as one is diligent in mindfulness, to that extent one attains the power of non-forgetfulness.

original: des gzugs rnams zil gyis gnon pa dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg bya rnams dang / chos rnams zil gyis gnon par nus shing mthu yod par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des gzugs rnams zil gyis gnon pa dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg bya rnams dang / chos rnams zil gyis gnon par nus shing mthu yod par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: One is able to overpower forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and mental objects, and one has the ability to do so.

original: ji ltar na dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the mind protected by mindfulness?

original: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on eyes and forms,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye la /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa skye la /
translated: eye consciousness arises.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par rtog par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes par 'byung ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i mjug thogs su rnam par rtog par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes par 'byung ste /
translated: Immediately after eye consciousness, the mental consciousness that conceptualizes arises.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yod de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yod de /
translated: In that mental consciousness, there is the mental consciousness that is associated with incorrect conception and that gives rise to affliction.

original: rnam par rtog par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa des gzugs kyi rang bzhin sdug gu dag la ni kun tu chags par byed /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par byed pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa des gzugs kyi rang bzhin sdug gu dag la ni kun tu chags par byed /
translated: The mental consciousness that conceptualizes becomes attached to pleasant forms and🔽aversion arises toward unpleasant forms.

original: gzugs kyi rang bzhin mi sdug pa dag la ni khong khro bar byed pas na des dran pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /🔽ci nas kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa las /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rang bzhin mi sdug pa dag la ni khong khro bar byed pas na des dran pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te / ci nas kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa las /
translated: Therefore, in relation to that memory,

original: yid de kun tu srung bar byed do //
analyzed: yid de kun tu srung bar byed do //
translated: the mind is guarded against the arising of that affliction.

original: de @26b bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang chos rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: de @26b bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang chos rnams la brten nas /
translated: In the same way, the mental consciousness arises in dependence on the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mental faculty and mental objects.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ste yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ste yid kyi rnam par shes pa de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa /
translated: The mental consciousness is associated with incorrect conception and

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yod de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa yod de /
translated: the arising of affliction.

original: des chos kyi rang bzhin sdug gu dag la ni kun tu chags par byed /
analyzed: des chos kyi rang bzhin sdug gu dag la ni kun tu chags par byed /
translated: It is attached to the beautiful nature of phenomena.🔽

original: chos kyi rang bzhin mi sdug pa dag la ni khong khro bar byed pas na /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin mi sdug pa dag la ni khong khro bar byed pas na /
translated: It is attachment to the pleasant natures of phenomena and aversion to the unpleasant natures of phenomena.

original: des dran pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: des dran pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Thus, on the basis of that mindfulness,

original: ji nas kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las yid de kun tu srung bar byed de /
analyzed: ji nas kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur bar tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las yid de kun tu srung bar byed de /
translated: it guards the mind from improper conceptualization, which is the cause of the arising of afflictions.

original: de ltar dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is mindfulness that guards the mind.

original: ji ltar na gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jig par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jig par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does it destroy equanimity?

original: gnas skabs mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la bya ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs mnyam pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la bya ste /
translated: Equanimity is a virtuous or neutral state of indifference.

original: de sa tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las yid kun tu bsrungs nas dge ba'am /
analyzed: de sa tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las yid kun tu bsrungs nas dge ba'am /
translated: It is the mind that, not properly guarded from that, is the motivating factor of the thoroughly afflicted, false imagination.🔽

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la 'jig par byed pas na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la 'jig par byed pas na /
translated: It is the mind that, having guarded itself from the arising of afflicted thoughts, is directed toward virtue or neutral equanimity.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, it is called “the establishment of sameness in a state of sameness.”

original: de ltar na gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, there is the establishment of sameness in a state of sameness.

original: ji ltar na tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las yid kun tu srung bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las yid kun tu srung bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does the mind guard itself from the arising of afflicted thoughts?

original: bzhi gang kho na las sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa zag par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: bzhi gang kho na las sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa zag par 'gyur ba'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: The mind does not grasp the characteristics of forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures that are related to the arising of negative and nonvirtuous thoughts.

original: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / gal te mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa rnam par spangs su zin kyang brjed ngas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa mang bas /🔽sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zag par 'gyur ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur na de dag bsdams pa'i phyir yang sgrub par byad de /
analyzed: mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / gal te mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa rnam par spangs su zin kyang brjed ngas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa mang bas / sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zag par 'gyur ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur na de dag bsdams pa'i phyir yang sgrub par byad de /
translated: He also practices in order to maintain those that he has already realized, not to mention those that he has not yet realized.🔽He also practices in order to get rid of evil, unwholesome states that have already arisen.🔽He also practices in order to get rid of evil, unwholesome states that have already arisen.🔽He also practices in order to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome states that have not yet arisen.

original: rnam pa de gnyis kyis tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las @27a * //🔽yid de kun tu srung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de gnyis kyis tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa de las @27a * // yid de kun tu srung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He also practices in order to prevent the arising of evil, unwholesome states that have not yet arisen.🔽He also practices in order to produce wholesome states that have not yet arisen.🔽He also practices in order to produce wholesome states that have not yet arisen.🔽He also practices in order to increase wholesome states that have already arisen.🔽He also practices in order to increase wholesome states that have already arisen.🔽He also practices in order to realize with his body those wholesome states that he has not yet realized.

original: ji ltar na yid de rnam pa gnyis kyis kun tu bsrungs nas dge ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar na yid de rnam pa gnyis kyis kun tu bsrungs nas dge ba'am /
translated: He also practices in order to realize with his body those wholesome states that he has not yet realized.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la 'jog par byed pa yin te /🔽rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /🔽gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la 'jog par byed pa yin te / rnam pa gnyis kho na ste / gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: He also practices in order to maintain those that he has already realized, not to mention those that he has not yet realized.

original: mig gi dbang po yang srung bar byed la ;
analyzed: mig gi dbang po yang srung bar byed la ;
translated: He also practices in order to maintain those that he has already realized, not to mention those that he has not yet realized.

original: mig gi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa dang / mig gi dbang pos ji lta ba de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po yang srung bar byed la /
analyzed: mig gi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa dang / mig gi dbang pos ji lta ba de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po yang srung bar byed la /
translated: Just as with the eye faculty, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties also guard the vows.

original: yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa ste /🔽rnam pa de gnyis kyis yid de dge ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa ste / rnam pa de gnyis kyis yid de dge ba'am /
translated: The mind faculty also accomplishes the vows.🔽In these two ways, the mind is placed in virtue or

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la 'jog par byed pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa yin zhe na /🔽mtshan mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa'i spyod yul de la ;
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i btang snyoms la 'jog par byed pa yin no // ji ltar na mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa yin zhe na / mtshan mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs gang yin pa'i spyod yul de la ;
translated: neutral equanimity.🔽How does one not grasp the forms that are objects of eye consciousness as signs?🔽Grasping signs means that whatever forms are the domain of eye consciousness,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: that domain is grasped by eye consciousness.

original: de lta bu'i mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is the apprehension of the signs of those forms that are objects of eye-consciousness.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul de /🔽yongs su spong bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa'i spyod yul de / yongs su spong bar byed na /
translated: If one abandons the domain of the eye-consciousness,

original: de ni mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i spyod yul la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i spyod yul la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: then one does not apprehend the signs of the domain of the eye-consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the forms that are objects of eye-consciousness,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la /
translated: so it is with the dharmas that are objects of ear-, nose-, tongue-, body-, and mind-consciousness.

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: One does not apprehend the signs of those dharmas.

original: ji ltar na mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar la mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa zhes bya /
analyzed: ji ltar na mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar la mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa zhes bya /
translated: How is it that one does not apprehend the signs of forms that are objects of eye-consciousness up to the dharmas that are objects of mind-consciousness?

original: mngon rtags su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs de dag nyid la /
analyzed: mngon rtags su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs de dag nyid la /
translated: The phrase “grasping signs” refers to the objects of the eye consciousness.🔽After the eye consciousness has arisen in relation to those forms that are objects of the eye consciousness, the mental consciousness that occurs subsequently and that is the one that conceives of those objects is the one that grasps signs.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa kho na'i rjes la mjug thogs su byung ba rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes par kun tu chags par 'gyur ba dang / kun tu zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba dang / kun tu gti mug par 'gyur ba'i spyod yul gang yin pa de la yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa kho na'i rjes la mjug thogs su byung ba rnam par rtog par byed pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes par kun tu chags par 'gyur ba dang / kun tu zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba dang / kun tu gti mug par 'gyur ba'i spyod yul gang yin pa de la yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness is the one that grasps signs in relation to those objects that are the objects of the eye consciousness and that are the basis for the mental consciousness to become attached, to become angry, or to become ignorant.

original: spyod @27b yul de yongs su spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: spyod @27b yul de yongs su spong bar byed cing /
translated: It is the mental consciousness that rejects those objects.

original: dmigs pa de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa de skyed par mi byed na /🔽de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa de skyed par mi byed na / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the mental consciousness that does not generate the eye consciousness in relation to those objects.

original: mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: This is the way that the bodhisattva does not grasp signs in relation to the forms that are objects of the eye consciousness.🔽The phrase “does not grasp the signs of the realm of phenomena” refers to the objects of the ear consciousness.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the phenomena that are cognized by the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang yod do //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'i rnam grangs gzhan yang yod do //
translated: There are other synonyms for apprehending signs and apprehending a sign.

original: de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni mig gis gzugs snang bar gyur pa rnam pa de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa mngon sum du byas nas mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni mig gis gzugs snang bar gyur pa rnam pa de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa mngon sum du byas nas mthong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: In this regard, apprehending signs is when the eye sees visible forms that appear in a certain way, having made the mental activity that arises from them manifest.

original: de la mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ni mig gis gzugs de dag nyid snang bar ma gyur cing /
analyzed: de la mngon rtags su 'dzin pa ni mig gis gzugs de dag nyid snang bar ma gyur cing /
translated: In this regard, apprehending a sign is when the eye does not see visible forms that appear in those very ways,

original: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa mngon sum du byas nas /🔽mthong ba ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan las rjes su mnyam pa sngon du btang nas /
analyzed: de dang 'byung ba yid la byed pa mngon sum du byas nas / mthong ba ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan las rjes su mnyam pa sngon du btang nas /
translated: having made the mental activity that arises from them manifest.

original: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'di lta bu dang / 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes thos shing /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs 'di lta bu dang / 'di lta bu dag yod do zhes thos shing /
translated: However, having previously heard from others that such and such forms are cognized by the eye,🔽and having made the mental activity that arises from them manifest,

original: de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i ming dang tshig dang mngon rtags gang dang gang dag yin pa de dang de dag gi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de dang rjes su 'brel pa'i ming dang tshig dang mngon rtags gang dang gang dag yin pa de dang de dag gi dbang du byas te /
translated: The name, phrase, and symbol that are related to that are the basis for that.

original: de dag la brten cing de dag la gnas nas /
analyzed: de dag la brten cing de dag la gnas nas /
translated: Relying on them and depending on them,

original: skyes bu gang zag de mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs ji lta ba thos pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag de mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs ji lta ba thos pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed pa ste /
translated: that person or individual imagines the forms that are objects of eye consciousness in accordance with what he has heard.

original: de ni mngon rtags su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mngon rtags su 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “grasping at signs.”

original: mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the forms that are objects of eye consciousness,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: you should understand it in the same way with regard to sounds that are objects of ear consciousness, smells that are objects of nose consciousness, tastes that are objects of tongue consciousness, tangible objects that are objects of body consciousness, and mental phenomena that are objects of mind consciousness.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa de yang /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa de yang /
translated: This grasping at signs and grasping at a substantial reality

original: rgyu de dang / gzhi de dang / dbang des de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba yang yod do //🔽rgyu de med pa dang / gzhi de med pa dang / dbang de med pas /
analyzed: rgyu de dang / gzhi de dang / dbang des de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba yang yod do // rgyu de med pa dang / gzhi de med pa dang / dbang de med pas /
translated: There are causes, bases, and powers by which unwholesome states flow into the mind.

original: de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par mi 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par mi 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: There are causes, bases, and powers by which unwholesome states do not flow into the mind.

original: de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste /🔽rgyu de dang / gzhi de dang / dbang @28a * //
analyzed: de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste / rgyu de dang / gzhi de dang / dbang @28a * //
translated: In this regard, the apprehension of signs and the apprehension of secondary marks are incorrect.

original: des de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: des de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur bas na /
translated: There are causes, bases, and powers by which unwholesome states flow into the mind.

original: des mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin de yongs su spong bar byed de /
analyzed: des mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin de yongs su spong bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, one should abandon the nature of apprehending signs and apprehending secondary marks.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are unwholesome states?

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags kyi kun nas bslang ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags kyi kun nas bslang ba /
translated: They are desire and that which is motivated by desire.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / zhe sdang ba dang / gti mug pa dang / gti mig gis kun nas bslang ba /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / zhe sdang ba dang / gti mug pa dang / gti mig gis kun nas bslang ba /
translated: It is physical misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct,🔽and it is that which is motivated by desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa rnams te /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa rnams te /
translated: It is physical misconduct, verbal misconduct, and mental misconduct.

original: de dag ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called “evil, nonvirtuous qualities.”

original: ji ltar na de dag sems kyi rjes su zag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag sems kyi rjes su zag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do they become mental defilements?

original: dmigs pa gang dang gang dag la /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang dang gang dag la /
translated: Whatever the object,🔽the mind, thought, and consciousness arise, go, and follow.

original: sems dang yid rnam par shes pa skye zhing 'gro la 'brang bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa de dang de dag la sems dang yid rnam par shes pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
analyzed: sems dang yid rnam par shes pa skye zhing 'gro la 'brang bar 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa de dang de dag la sems dang yid rnam par shes pa de dang mtshungs par ldan pa /
translated: With regard to those objects, the mind, thought, and consciousness are associated with

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa kun nas slong bar byed la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis nyes par spyad pa kun nas slong bar byed la /
translated: the motivation of physical, verbal, and mental misconduct.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de dag kyang skye zhing 'gro la 'brang bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de dag kyang skye zhing 'gro la 'brang bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: And because desire, hatred, and ignorance arise, go, and follow,

original: de'i phyir sems kyi rjes su zag par 'gyur bar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi rjes su zag par 'gyur bar zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called “defilements that follow the mind.”

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa yongs su spong bar byed pa de la ni /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa yongs su spong bar byed pa de la ni /
translated: “Abandoning the apprehension of signs and the apprehension of secondary marks” means that

original: de ltar mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar la /
analyzed: de ltar mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar la /
translated: in regard to forms cognizable by the eye, up to and including mental qualities cognizable by the mind,

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de dag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the afflictions that arise from the apprehension of signs and the apprehension of secondary marks do not occur.

original: gal te brjed ngas pa'am /
analyzed: gal te brjed ngas pa'am /
translated: If, due to forgetfulness

original: nyon mongs pa mang bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang bas /
translated: or because of the many afflictions,

original: gcig pur gnas pa na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams sngon mthong ba rnams kyi dbang du byas shing /
analyzed: gcig pur gnas pa na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams sngon mthong ba rnams kyi dbang du byas shing /
translated: when dwelling alone one brings to mind forms cognizable by the eye that were previously seen,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos sngon nyams su myong ba rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos sngon nyams su myong ba rnams kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: “The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses of phenomena that have been experienced in the past,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: if they are the arising of sinful, nonvirtuous phenomena,🔽he does not consent to them, does not agree to them,🔽does not approve of them,

original: de dag byung yad dang du mi len cing @28b sdong bar byed /🔽sel bar byed /🔽byang bar byed pas na de'i phyir de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir de sgrub par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag byung yad dang du mi len cing @28b sdong bar byed / sel bar byed / byang bar byed pas na de'i phyir de dag bsdam par bya ba'i phyir de sgrub par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and does not acquiesce in them.

original: de mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs gang dag la mig gtad par bya ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos gang dag la yid gtad par bya ba de dag la yang gtod par byed cing /
analyzed: de mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs gang dag la mig gtad par bya ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos gang dag la yid gtad par bya ba de dag la yang gtod par byed cing /
translated: “The eye consciousness of forms that are to be focused on by the eye, and the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses of phenomena that are to be focused on by the mind, he focuses on them

original: ci nas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gtod par byed de /
analyzed: ci nas kyang kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gtod par byed de /
translated: and focuses on them in such a way that they do not become afflicted.

original: de ltar na des nyon mongs pa de dag las dbang po kun tu bsrungs pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar na des nyon mongs pa de dag las dbang po kun tu bsrungs pa yin pas na /
translated: Thus, since he protects the faculties from those afflictions,

original: de'i phyir mig gi dbang po yang srung bar byed la yid kyi dbang po'i bar du srung bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi dbang po yang srung bar byed la yid kyi dbang po'i bar du srung bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is said to “guard the eye faculty” and so on up to “guard the mind faculty.”

original: de mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs gang dag la mig gi dbang po gtad par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos gang dag la /
analyzed: de mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs gang dag la mig gi dbang po gtad par bya ba ma yin pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos gang dag la /
translated: He does not direct the eye faculty to forms that should not be seen by the eye,🔽and he does not direct the mind faculty to mental objects that should not be cognized by the mind.

original: yid kyi dbang po gtad par bya ba ma yin pa de dag la ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du gtod par mi byed pas na /
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po gtad par bya ba ma yin pa de dag la ni rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du gtod par mi byed pas na /
translated: Since he does not direct the mind to those objects in any way,

original: de'i phyir / mig gi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa dang / yid kyi dbang po'i bar gyis kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / mig gi dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa dang / yid kyi dbang po'i bar gyis kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: he is said to “practice restraint with the eye faculty” and so on up to “practice restraint with the mind faculty.”

original: de ni re zhig dbang po sdom pa'i rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni re zhig dbang po sdom pa'i rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the extensive classification of the restraint of the faculties.

original: don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: don mdor bsdu ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the summary of the meaning?

original: de la don mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don mdor bsdu ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summary of the meaning is as follows:

original: gang gis sdom par byed pa dang / gang zhig sdom par byed pa dang / gang las sdom par byed pa dang / ji ltar sdom par byed pa dang / sdom pa de gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni dbang po sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sdom par byed pa dang / gang zhig sdom par byed pa dang / gang las sdom par byed pa dang / ji ltar sdom par byed pa dang / sdom pa de gang yin pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni dbang po sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The restraint of the faculties is the collection of all those things by which one is restrained, that by which one is restrained, that from which one is restrained, the manner in which one is restrained, and that restraint itself.

original: de la gang gis sdom par byed ce na /
analyzed: de la gang gis sdom par byed ce na /
translated: By what is one restrained?

original: dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa bsgoms pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa bsgoms pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: One is restrained by the cultivation of the protection of mindfulness and the practice of mindfulness.

original: des sdom par byed do //
analyzed: des sdom par byed do //
translated: That is the restraint.

original: gang zhig sdom par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig sdom par byed ce na /
translated: By what is one restrained?

original: mig gi dbang po sdom par byed pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po sdom pa ste de sdom par byed do //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po sdom par byed pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po sdom pa ste de sdom par byed do //
translated: One is restrained by the restraint of the eye faculty, the restraint of the ear, nose, tongue, body and mind faculties.

original: gang las sdom par byed ce na /🔽gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi rang bzhin sdug pa dang mi sdug @29a * //
analyzed: gang las sdom par byed ce na / gzugs dang / sgra dang / chos kyi rang bzhin sdug pa dang mi sdug @29a * //
translated: From what is it restrained?

original: pa'i bar dag las te /
analyzed: pa'i bar dag las te /
translated: From forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects that are attractive and unattractive.

original: de las sdom par byed do //
analyzed: de las sdom par byed do //
translated: It is restrained from those.

original: ji ltar sdom par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdom par byed ce na /
translated: How is it restrained?

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa dang / dbang po yang srung bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa dang / dbang po yang srung bar byed pa dang /
translated: It is restrained by not apprehending signs, by not apprehending indications, by practicing to restrain those things that would cause that mind to be defiled by evil and nonvirtuous dharmas, by guarding the sense doors,

original: dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: and by practicing restraint with the sense faculties.

original: de ltar sdom par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar sdom par byed do //
translated: It is restrained in that way.

original: sdom pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdom pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that restraint?

original: dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa las 'jog par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa las 'jog par byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the protection of the mind by mindfulness and the placement of the mind in an even state.

original: de ni sdom pa zhas bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdom pa zhas bya'o //
translated: That is called “restraint.”

original: don mdor bsdus pa gzhan yang sdom pa'i thabs gang yin pa dang / bsdam par bya ba'i gzhi gang yin pa dang / sdom pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: don mdor bsdus pa gzhan yang sdom pa'i thabs gang yin pa dang / bsdam par bya ba'i gzhi gang yin pa dang / sdom pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni /
translated: Another brief explanation of the meaning: the means of restraint, the basis of restraint and the restraint itself are all included in one.

original: dbang po sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, the means of restraint, the basis of restraint, and the restraint itself are all included in the term “restraint of the faculties.”

original: de la sdom pa'i thabs gang zhe na ;🔽dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba na /
analyzed: de la sdom pa'i thabs gang zhe na ; dran pa kun tu bsrungs pa dang / dran pa la rtag 'grus byed pa dang mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ba na /
translated: What is the means of restraint?🔽It is the protection of mindfulness, the cultivation of mindfulness, and the non-apprehension of signs and the non-apprehension of secondary characteristics.

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa na /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa dang / yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes pa na /
translated: When the eye sees forms,🔽up to when the mind is conscious of mental phenomena,

original: mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa'i bar dang / gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pa'i bar dang / gzhi gang kho na las de'i sems kyi rjes su sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zag par 'gyur ba de dag bsdam pa'i phyir /
translated: it is the practice of restraint in order to restrain those unwholesome states that would flow into the mind from that basis.

original: sgrub par byed pa dang / dbang po yang srung bar byed la /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dang / dbang po yang srung bar byed la /
translated: It is the protection of the faculties.

original: dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed do zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang pos kyang sdom pa sgrub par byed do zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: and the faculties are the means of accomplishing the vow.

original: de ni sdom pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdom pa'i thabs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the means of the vow.

original: bsdam par bya ba'i gzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba'i gzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of the vow?

original: mig dang gzugs rnams dang / de bzhin du yid dang / chos rnams kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs rnams dang / de bzhin du yid dang / chos rnams kyi bar dag ste /
translated: It is the eye and visible form, and likewise the mind and all dharmas.

original: de ni bsdam par bya ba'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bsdam par bya ba'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the basis of the vow.

original: de la sdom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the vow?

original: dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dran pas yid kun tu bsrungs pa dang / gnas skabs mnyam pa la 'jog par byed pa zhes gang gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is the guarding of the mind by mindfulness and the establishment of the mind in its natural state.

original: de ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the vow.

original: dbang po sdom pa 'di yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa 'di yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: This vow of the faculties, in brief,

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: is twofold:

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'o //
translated: that which is supported by the power of discernment and that which is supported by the power of meditation.

original: de la so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis @29b zin pa ni /
analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis @29b zin pa ni /
translated: Among them, that which is supported by the power of discernment

original: gang gis yul rnams la nyes dmigs su mthong ba nyes dmigs de yang sel ba dang / spong bar ni mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams la nyes dmigs su mthong ba nyes dmigs de yang sel ba dang / spong bar ni mi byed pa'o //
translated: It is the one who does not see the faults of objects and does not eliminate or abandon those faults.

original: de la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa ni /
analyzed: de la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa ni /
translated: The faculty restrained by the power of cultivation

original: gang gi yul rnams la nyes dmigs su mthong ba la nyes dmigs de yang sel ba dang / spang bar bya ba ni ;
analyzed: gang gi yul rnams la nyes dmigs su mthong ba la nyes dmigs de yang sel ba dang / spang bar bya ba ni ;
translated: is the one who sees the faults of objects and eliminates and abandons those faults.

original: de la so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pas ni /🔽yul la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa skyed par mi byed cing /
analyzed: de la so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pas ni / yul la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa skyed par mi byed cing /
translated: The faculty restrained by the power of discernment🔽is the one who, by restraining the faculties, does not generate or manifest the afflictions that are fixated on objects.

original: mngon sum du mi byed par zad kyi lus la zhen pa'i bag la nyal spong ba dang / 'joms par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: mngon sum du mi byed par zad kyi lus la zhen pa'i bag la nyal spong ba dang / 'joms par ni mi byed do //
translated: It is the one who abandons and conquers the latent tendencies of attachment to the body.

original: de la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pas ni /
analyzed: de la bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pas ni /
translated: The faculty restrained by the power of cultivation

original: yul la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa yang skyed par mi byed cing /
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa yang skyed par mi byed cing /
translated: is the one who, by restraining the faculties, does not generate or manifest the afflictions that are fixated on objects.

original: mngon sum du mi byed la lus la zhen pa'i bag la nyal yang dus thams cad kyi thams cad du spong zhing 'joms par byed de /
analyzed: mngon sum du mi byed la lus la zhen pa'i bag la nyal yang dus thams cad kyi thams cad du spong zhing 'joms par byed de /
translated: He does not manifest them, but he always abandons and destroys the latent impressions of attachment to the body.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pa'i bye brag ni de yin /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pa'i bye brag ni de yin /
translated: This is the difference in the restraint of the faculties that is supported by the power of discernment and that is supported by the power of cultivation.

original: bsam pa ni de yin /
analyzed: bsam pa ni de yin /
translated: This is the difference in their intentions.

original: tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no //
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference in their functions.

original: de las so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pa gang yin pa dang / lam gyi tshogs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pa gang yin pa dang / lam gyi tshogs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The restraint of the faculties that is supported by the power of discernment is included in the path of preparation.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sar gtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis zin pa'i dbang po sdom pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sar gtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The restraint of the faculties that is supported by the power of cultivation should be understood as included in the stage of detachment.

original: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is moderation in eating?

original: 'di ltar 'di la las so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la /🔽bsgom par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la las so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la / bsgom par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Here a monk eats his food after consideration,🔽not for fun,🔽not for intoxication,

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for plumpness,

original: sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the sake of beauty,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: it is not for the sake of adornment,

original: 'di lta ste lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar ba rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar ba rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: but rather for the sake of this body’s endurance, for the sake of living, for the sake of nourishing, for the sake of serving spiritual practice, for the sake of warding off old feelings and not creating new ones,

original: bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin no //
translated: and for the sake of living happily, with strength, pleasure, and without reproach.

original: de la ji ltar so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one eat mindfully?

original: @30a * // so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: @30a * // so sor rtog pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab ste /
translated: Discernment is wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis kham gyi zas kyi nyes dmigs yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyis kham gyi zas kyi nyes dmigs yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing /
translated: With wisdom one sees the disadvantages of material food.

original: nyes dmigs su mthong bas sun phyung ste zas za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes dmigs su mthong bas sun phyung ste zas za bar byed pa'o //
translated: Seeing the disadvantages, one is disgusted and eats.

original: nyes dmigs su mthong ba de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes dmigs su mthong ba de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fault?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: kham gyi zas de nyid la yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / yongs su 'ju ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: kham gyi zas de nyid la yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / yongs su 'ju ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: The fault of the enjoyment of the food, the fault of the digestion of the food, and the fault of the search for food.

original: de la yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fault of the enjoyment of the food?

original: 'di ltar na la la gang gi tshe zas kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa dang / shin tu bsad pa dag za bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar na la la gang gi tshe zas kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / dri phun sum tshogs pa dang / ro phun sum tshogs pa dang / shin tu bsad pa dag za bar byed cing /
translated: When one eats food that is of good color, good smell, and good taste, and is well cooked,

original: gang gi tshe kham gyi zas de de'i khar bcug ma thag kho nar so'i 'khrul 'khor gyis bldad cing /🔽mchil ma'i tshogs kyis brlan la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kham gyi zas de de'i khar bcug ma thag kho nar so'i 'khrul 'khor gyis bldad cing / mchil ma'i tshogs kyis brlan la /
translated: as soon as that food enters the mouth, it is crushed by the teeth🔽and moistened by the saliva.

original: bad kan gyis yongs su dkris shing /
analyzed: bad kan gyis yongs su dkris shing /
translated: It is wrapped in phlegm

original: de mid pa'i sbubs su zhugs par gyur la /
analyzed: de mid pa'i sbubs su zhugs par gyur la /
translated: and enters the throat.

original: de sngon gyi yid du 'ong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de sngon gyi yid du 'ong ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the former pleasant state?

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams shing lhag par mi sdug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams shing lhag par mi sdug par 'gyur la /
translated: It is the state of being attractive in every way.

original: de mi sdug par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de mi sdug par gyur pa na /
translated: When that is no longer attractive,

original: skyugs pa lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: skyugs pa lta bur gyur pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: it is the state of being like vomit.

original: za ba po'i skyes bu gang zag des gal te de'i rnam pa'i sgo nas yid la byas shing rjes su dran par byas nas /
analyzed: za ba po'i skyes bu gang zag des gal te de'i rnam pa'i sgo nas yid la byas shing rjes su dran par byas nas /
translated: When that is the case, if the person who is the consumer brings that to mind and recalls it,

original: de re zhig zas yongs su ma gyur ba bzang po gzhan dag la yang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du za bar mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: de re zhig zas yongs su ma gyur ba bzang po gzhan dag la yang rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du za bar mi 'dod cing /
translated: then for a while he will not want to eat anything else that is good and not yet spoiled.

original: 'dug par gyur na de lta bu'i gnas skabs su gyur pa de la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: 'dug par gyur na de lta bu'i gnas skabs su gyur pa de la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: If he is able to remain in that state, then what need is there to mention the other states?

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa du ma'i rim pa des /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa du ma'i rim pa des /
translated: In this way,

original: zas la yongs su longs spyod ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: zas la yongs su longs spyod ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: with regard to the consumption of food,

original: kha dog bzang po'i mdog gang yin pa de nub cing mig gtsang bas zin pa'i nyes dmigs 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: kha dog bzang po'i mdog gang yin pa de nub cing mig gtsang bas zin pa'i nyes dmigs 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The good color of the skin fades and the eyes become sunken.🔽

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The bad effects of the eyes being filled with impurities and the good color of the skin disappearing are as follows.

original: zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zas la yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the bad effects that arise from the cause of enjoying food.

original: de la zas yongs su 'ju ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zas yongs su 'ju ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bad effects that arise from the cause of food being digested?

original: des zas de zos shing mid par gyur nas /🔽gang gi tshe mtshan mo thun par ma'am /
analyzed: des zas de zos shing mid par gyur nas / gang gi tshe mtshan mo thun par ma'am /
translated: When that food is eaten and swallowed,🔽in the first part of the night,

original: thun tha ma la yongs su 'ju bar 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: thun tha ma la yongs su 'ju bar 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: or in the last part of the night,🔽it is digested.

original: des de'i lus de @30b la sha dang khrag dang / chu rgyus dang / rus pa dang / pags pa la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa dum rnam pa mang po sna tshogs du ma dag rnam par 'phel zhing skye la brta bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: des de'i lus de @30b la sha dang khrag dang / chu rgyus dang / rus pa dang / pags pa la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa dum rnam pa mang po sna tshogs du ma dag rnam par 'phel zhing skye la brta bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Then, in that body, the many different kinds of impure substances—flesh, blood, sinew, bone, skin, and so on—increase, grow, and develop.

original: de dag las la la ni bshad pa dang / gci ba'i dngos por yongs su 'ju bar 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: de dag las la la ni bshad pa dang / gci ba'i dngos por yongs su 'ju bar 'gyur zhing ;
translated: Some of them are digested into feces and urine,

original: yongs su zhu nas kyang smad kyi cha logs su gnas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su zhu nas kyang smad kyi cha logs su gnas par 'gyur la /
translated: and after being digested, they remain in the lower part of the body.

original: de yang des nyin gcig mi chad par bsal bar bya dgos par 'gyur ba dang / des lag pa'am /
analyzed: de yang des nyin gcig mi chad par bsal bar bya dgos par 'gyur ba dang / des lag pa'am /
translated: They must be expelled by the body every day without fail.🔽Whatever part of the body they touch, whether the hands,🔽the feet, or any other limb or appendage, that part becomes very contemptible to oneself and others.

original: rkang pa'am / yan lag dang / nying lag gang yang rung ba la reg par gyur pa gang yin pa de yang bdag dang gzhan dag gis shin tu smad par 'os par 'gyur ba dang / gzhi de las de'i lus la lus kyi nad rnam pa mang po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rkang pa'am / yan lag dang / nying lag gang yang rung ba la reg par gyur pa gang yin pa de yang bdag dang gzhan dag gis shin tu smad par 'os par 'gyur ba dang / gzhi de las de'i lus la lus kyi nad rnam pa mang po 'di lta ste /
translated: On the basis of that, many kinds of physical illnesses arise in the body, such as

original: 'bras dang / phol mig dang / shu ba dang / rkong shu dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / 'brum bu phra mo dang / sha bkra dang / rims dang / lud pa dang / skrang ba dang / skem pa dang / slong ba dang /
analyzed: 'bras dang / phol mig dang / shu ba dang / rkong shu dang / g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / 'brum bu phra mo dang / sha bkra dang / rims dang / lud pa dang / skrang ba dang / skem pa dang / slong ba dang /
translated: boils, abscesses, leprosy, scabies, smallpox, measles, fevers, coughs, swellings, emaciation, and diarrhea.

original: bkres nga ba dang / skya rbab dang / khrag nad dang / mkhris nad dang / mtshan par rdol ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bkres nga ba dang / skya rbab dang / khrag nad dang / mkhris nad dang / mtshan par rdol ba dag 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: skin diseases, blood diseases, bile diseases, and anal fistula.🔽These and other similar many physical diseases arise in the body.

original: de dag dang gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i lus kyi nad mang po dag lus la 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / des zos nas mi 'ju zhing /
analyzed: de dag dang gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i lus kyi nad mang po dag lus la 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / des zos nas mi 'ju zhing /
translated: After eating, it is not digested,

original: des de'i lus la gsud par 'gyur ba ste /🔽de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des de'i lus la gsud par 'gyur ba ste / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and it causes vomiting in the body.

original: zas yongs su 'ju ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zas yongs su 'ju ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the disadvantage that arises from the complete digestion of food.

original: de la zas yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la zas yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the disadvantage that arises from the pursuit of food?

original: yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs ni rnam pa mang ste /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs ni rnam pa mang ste /
translated: The disadvantage that arises from the pursuit is manifold.

original: bsgrubs pa las byung ba dang / kun tu bsrungs pa las byung ba dang / mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba dang / ngoms mi shes pa las byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa las byung ba dang / nyes par spyad pa las byung//
analyzed: bsgrubs pa las byung ba dang / kun tu bsrungs pa las byung ba dang / mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba dang / ngoms mi shes pa las byung ba dang / rang dbang med pa las byung ba dang / nyes par spyad pa las byung//
translated: The disadvantages of food that is obtained through striving, that is obtained through protection, that is obtained through loss of friends, that is obtained through insatiability, that is obtained through lack of independence, and that is obtained through bad conduct.

original: ba'o ; ; de la zas bsgrubs pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: ba'o ; ; de la zas bsgrubs pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the disadvantage of food that is obtained through striving?

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la zas kyi rgyu dang / zas kyi gzhi'i phyir grang ba'i tshe yang grang bas nyen bzhin /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la zas kyi rgyu dang / zas kyi gzhi'i phyir grang ba'i tshe yang grang bas nyen bzhin /
translated: In this case, a person, for the sake of food and the basis of food, in cold weather, being afflicted by cold,🔽in hot weather, being afflicted by heat,

original: tsha ba'i tshe yang tsha bas gdungs bzhin du zhing las sam /🔽phyugs btsal ba'am /
analyzed: tsha ba'i tshe yang tsha bas gdungs bzhin du zhing las sam / phyugs btsal ba'am /
translated: works in the fields,

original: tshong bya ba'am /
analyzed: tshong bya ba'am /
translated: or engages in commerce,

original: @31a * // yi ge dang ; bgrang ba dang / shod dgod pa dang / brtsi ba dang / lag rtsis bya ba dang / gzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dang de dang de dag gi phyir ram /
analyzed: @31a * // yi ge dang ; bgrang ba dang / shod dgod pa dang / brtsi ba dang / lag rtsis bya ba dang / gzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs dang de dang de dag gi phyir ram /
translated: or engages in writing, counting, reckoning, calculating, arithmetical computations, or in the various arts and crafts, or for the sake of this or that,

original: zas ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / bsags par bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed /
analyzed: zas ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / bsags par bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed /
translated: They strive to obtain food that they have not obtained and to accumulate it.

original: 'bad par byed /
analyzed: 'bad par byed /
translated: He strives, exerts himself, and makes an effort to obtain food that he has not obtained and to accumulate it.

original: rtsol bar byed cing zas kyi phyir ji lta ba bzhin du zas kyi rgyu'i phyir yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rtsol bar byed cing zas kyi phyir ji lta ba bzhin du zas kyi rgyu'i phyir yang de bzhin te /
translated: He strives, exerts himself, and makes an effort for the sake of food and for the sake of the cause of food.

original: de de ltar brtson pa dang / 'bad pa dang / rtsol bar byed na /
analyzed: de de ltar brtson pa dang / 'bad pa dang / rtsol bar byed na /
translated: If, while he is striving, exerting himself, and making an effort in this way,

original: gal te las kyi mtha' de dag rgud par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te las kyi mtha' de dag rgud par gyur na /
translated: those activities do not succeed,

original: de gzhi de las kye ma bdag gi 'bad pa ni don med cing 'bras bu med do//🔽zhes mya ngan byed /
analyzed: de gzhi de las kye ma bdag gi 'bad pa ni don med cing 'bras bu med do// zhes mya ngan byed /
translated: he thinks, “Alas! My striving is pointless and fruitless.”🔽He grieves,🔽suffers,

original: gdung bar byed /🔽smre sngags 'don par byed /
analyzed: gdung bar byed / smre sngags 'don par byed /
translated: and laments.

original: brang rdung bar byed /
analyzed: brang rdung bar byed /
translated: He beats his chest.

original: cho nges 'debs par byed cing /
analyzed: cho nges 'debs par byed cing /
translated: He cries out.

original: kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba yin te /🔽de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs par 'gyur ba yin te / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He becomes confused.🔽This is the danger that arises from acquiring food,

original: zas sgrub pa'i mdo las skyes pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //🔽gal te 'byor na yang de 'di snyam du ma la bdag gi longs spyod rgyal po'am /
analyzed: zas sgrub pa'i mdo las skyes pa'i nyes dmigs yin no // gal te 'byor na yang de 'di snyam du ma la bdag gi longs spyod rgyal po'am /
translated: as it is taught in the Sūtra on Acquiring Food.

original: chom rkun gyis phrogs pa'am /
analyzed: chom rkun gyis phrogs pa'am /
translated: If he is successful, he thinks, “My wealth will not be taken away by the king or by thieves.

original: mes tshig pa'am /
analyzed: mes tshig pa'am /
translated: They are burned by fire,

original: chus khyer ba'am /
analyzed: chus khyer ba'am /
translated: swept away by water,

original: gter ngan pa dag tu sbas pa chud za ba'am /
analyzed: gter ngan pa dag tu sbas pa chud za ba'am /
translated: or lost by being buried in a bad place.

original: las kyi mtha' legs par ma byas pas nyams pa'am /🔽rigs brgyud sdang ba dag gis dbang du byas pa'am /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' legs par ma byas pas nyams pa'am / rigs brgyud sdang ba dag gis dbang du byas pa'am /
translated: They are lost by not being used properly.🔽They are lost by being taken over by hostile relatives.

original: rigs kyi nang na pha tshan gyi dkrugs ma byed pa gang yin pa dag gis longs spyod 'di dag tshul bzhin ma yin pas phung par byed pa'am gcig tu mi 'gyur grangs snyam na /
analyzed: rigs kyi nang na pha tshan gyi dkrugs ma byed pa gang yin pa dag gis longs spyod 'di dag tshul bzhin ma yin pas phung par byed pa'am gcig tu mi 'gyur grangs snyam na /
translated: Or they are lost by being squandered by the family members who are in charge of them.

original: de kun bsrung ba'i gzhi las rtsol ba drag po 'byung bar 'gyur te /🔽de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de kun bsrung ba'i gzhi las rtsol ba drag po 'byung bar 'gyur te / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: If you think that this is the case, you will be very diligent in the basis of guarding them.🔽This is as it is said in the Sūtra on Guarding Food:

original: zas kun tu bsrung ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: zas kun tu bsrung ba'i mdo las skyes pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: “This is the danger that comes from food.”

original: mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the danger that comes from the loss of affection?

original: 'di lta ste zas kyi rgyu dang / zas kyi gzhi las /🔽ma ni bu la bu yang ma la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste zas kyi rgyu dang / zas kyi gzhi las / ma ni bu la bu yang ma la /
translated: It is like this: because of food and the basis of food,

original: pha yang bu la bu yang pha la /
analyzed: pha yang bu la bu yang pha la /
translated: a mother is not affectionate toward her son and a son is not affectionate toward his mother.🔽A father is not affectionate toward his son and a son is not affectionate toward his father.

original: ming po yang sring mo la sring mo yang ming po la /
analyzed: ming po yang sring mo la sring mo yang ming po la /
translated: brothers will speak unpleasantly to sisters, and sisters to brothers.

original: grogs kyang grogs la mi snyan par rjod par byed na /
analyzed: grogs kyang grogs la mi snyan par rjod par byed na /
translated: Friends will speak unpleasantly to friends.

original: skye bo skye bo la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: skye bo skye bo la lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention ordinary people?

original: de dag phan tshun 'thab cing rtsod par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / khyim bdag rgya che ba shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag kyang zas kyi gzhi'i phyir kho nar /
analyzed: de dag phan tshun 'thab cing rtsod par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du bram ze dang / rgyal rigs dang / khyim bdag rgya che ba shing s'a la chen po lta bu dag kyang zas kyi gzhi'i phyir kho nar /
translated: In the same way, brahmins, kṣatriyas, and householders of great means, who are like great śāla trees, will fight and quarrel with one another just for the sake of food.

original: phan tshun 'thab cing rtsod @31b par byed /
analyzed: phan tshun 'thab cing rtsod @31b par byed /
translated: They will fight and quarrel with one another.

original: lag pas kyang rdeg par byed /
analyzed: lag pas kyang rdeg par byed /
translated: They will strike one another with their hands.

original: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis kyang 'debs par byed pa lta bu ste /🔽de ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bong ba dang / dbyug pa dang / mtshon gyis kyang 'debs par byed pa lta bu ste / de ni 'di lta ste /
translated: They will strike one another with clods of dirt, sticks, and weapons.

original: zas la mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zas la mdza' ba yongs su nyams pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the disadvantage that should be understood to come from the degeneration of affection for food.

original: de la ngoms mi shes pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngoms mi shes pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the disadvantage that comes from insatiability?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dag rang rang gi grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang yul 'khor dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag la /🔽chog mi shes par gnas pa na phan tshun nas g-yul gyi bkod pa dag bshams te /
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dag rang rang gi grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang yul 'khor dang rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dag la / chog mi shes par gnas pa na phan tshun nas g-yul gyi bkod pa dag bshams te /
translated: When the kings and royal families who are anointed on the crown of the head are not satisfied with their own towns, cities, market towns, countries, and capitals,🔽they make military preparations against each other.

original: dung dag 'bud /
analyzed: dung dag 'bud /
translated: They set out, blowing their conches,

original: rda pa ta ha dag brdung /
analyzed: rda pa ta ha dag brdung /
translated: beating their drums,🔽and shooting various arrows.

original: mda' sna tshogs dag 'phen bzhin du chas shing de dag dang rta rgyags pa dang lhan cig tu 'du bar byed /
analyzed: mda' sna tshogs dag 'phen bzhin du chas shing de dag dang rta rgyags pa dang lhan cig tu 'du bar byed /
translated: When they gather together with their powerful horses,

original: glang po che dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung rgyags pa dag dang lhan cig 'du bar byed pa'i tshe mda' dag dang / mdung thung rnams kyis lus dag gtsags shing 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: glang po che dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chung rgyags pa dag dang lhan cig 'du bar byed pa'i tshe mda' dag dang / mdung thung rnams kyis lus dag gtsags shing 'chi ba'am /
translated: their powerful elephants, chariots, and infantry, they die or are wounded by arrows and spears.

original: 'chi ba la thug pa tsam gyi sdug bsngal 'thob par 'gyur ba lta bu dang / gzhan yang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni ngoms mi shes pa'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //🔽de la rang dbang med pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste ;🔽rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba'i mi dag grong khyer bsrungs pa dag tu 'jug pa na /🔽'bru mar bskol ba'am /🔽zhag bskol ba dang / ba lang gi lci ba'i thug ba bskol ba dang / zangs khu bskol ba dang / khro chu bskol ba dag gis gtor cing /🔽mda' dag dang mdung thung dag gis lus gtsags te 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug pa tsam gyi sdug bsngal 'thob par 'gyur ba lta bu dang / gzhan yang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni ngoms mi shes pa'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o // de la rang dbang med pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na / 'di lta ste ; rgyal po la zho shas 'tsho ba'i mi dag grong khyer bsrungs pa dag tu 'jug pa na / 'bru mar bskol ba'am / zhag bskol ba dang / ba lang gi lci ba'i thug ba bskol ba dang / zangs khu bskol ba dang / khro chu bskol ba dag gis gtor cing / mda' dag dang mdung thung dag gis lus gtsags te 'chi ba'am /
translated: It is like the suffering of being killed.🔽Moreover, this is called the disadvantage of insatiability.🔽🔽What is the disadvantage of being powerless?🔽🔽It is like this.🔽When people who are employed by the king enter a city to protect it,🔽they pour boiling oil,🔽boiling water, boiling cow dung water, boiling copper, and boiling lead.🔽They pierce the body with arrows and spears.🔽

original: 'chi ba la thug pa'i sdug bsngal 'thob par 'gyur ba lta bu dang / gzhan yang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa ni rang dbang med pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug pa'i sdug bsngal 'thob par 'gyur ba lta bu dang / gzhan yang gang de lta bu dang mthun pa ni rang dbang med pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
