original: de la nyes par spyad pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyes par spyad pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the danger that arises from misdeeds?

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: What is the disadvantage that comes from misconduct?🔽Some, for the sake of food and drink, accumulate much physical misconduct,

original: la las zas kyi rgyu dang zas kyi phyir lus kyis nyes par spyad pa mang po byas shing bstsags pa dang / lus kyis ji lta ba bzhin du ngag dang yid kyis kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: la las zas kyi rgyu dang zas kyi phyir lus kyis nyes par spyad pa mang po byas shing bstsags pa dang / lus kyis ji lta ba bzhin du ngag dang yid kyis kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and likewise, verbal and mental misconduct.🔽When they are afflicted by illness and suffering,

original: de gang gi tshe nad kyis btab cing sdug bsngal bar gyur cing nad tshabs che ba'i tshe na /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe nad kyis btab cing sdug bsngal bar gyur cing nad tshabs che ba'i tshe na /
translated: and their illness is severe,

original: sngon lus kyis nyes par @32a * //
analyzed: sngon lus kyis nyes par @32a * //
translated: then the physical misconduct,🔽and the verbal and mental misconduct that they did in the past,

original: spyod pa dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa de dag de la phye ma red kyi ri'i rtse mo'i grib ma bzhin du gzhol ba dang / rab tu gzhol ba dang / mngon par rab tu gzhol bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: spyod pa dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa de dag de la phye ma red kyi ri'i rtse mo'i grib ma bzhin du gzhol ba dang / rab tu gzhol ba dang / mngon par rab tu gzhol bar gyur pa na /
translated: will descend upon them like the shadow of a mountain peak at sunset,

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and they will think:

original: kye ma bdag gis lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis sdig pa ni byas la /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gis lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis sdig pa ni byas la /
translated: “Alas! I have done evil with my body,

original: kye ma bdag gis bsod nams ni ma byas pas /
analyzed: kye ma bdag gis bsod nams ni ma byas pas /
translated: and I have not done good.

original: bdag shi 'phos nas kyang /
analyzed: bdag shi 'phos nas kyang /
translated: After I die,

original: sdig pa byas pa rnams kyi 'gro ba gang yin pa der 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: sdig pa byas pa rnams kyi 'gro ba gang yin pa der 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: I will go to the realm that is the destination of those who have committed negative actions.🔽’

original: 'gyod bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyod bzhin du 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur te /
translated: With such regret, they will die.

original: shi ba'i dus byas nas kyang /🔽ngan song 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shi ba'i dus byas nas kyang / ngan song 'di lta ste /
translated: After they die,🔽they will be born in the lower realms,

original: sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro rnams dang / yi dags rnams su skye bar 'gyur ba lta bu ste /
translated: such as the hells, as animals, or as pretas.

original: de ni nyes par spyad pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nyes par spyad pa las byung ba'i nyes dmigs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the problem that arises from engaging in negative actions.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: They will think,

original: de ltar zas 'di ni yongs su tshol ba na yang nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yin te ;🔽yongs su spyod pa na yang nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar zas 'di ni yongs su tshol ba na yang nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yin te ; yongs su spyod pa na yang nyes dmigs dang bcas pa yin /
translated: ‘In this way, even when I seek out food, it is problematic.🔽Even when I enjoy it, it is problematic.

original: yongs su longs spyad pa dang / yongs su 'ju ba na yang nyes dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na yin mod kyi /
analyzed: yongs su longs spyad pa dang / yongs su 'ju ba na yang nyes dmigs pa dang bcas pa kho na yin mod kyi /
translated: Even when I have consumed it and digested it, it is still problematic.

original: 'on kyang zas 'di la phan yon 'ga' tsam yang yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang zas 'di la phan yon 'ga' tsam yang yod de /
translated: However, there is some benefit to this food.

original: de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that benefit?

original: lus 'di ni zas kyis gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lus 'di ni zas kyis gnas pa yin te /
translated: This body is sustained by food.

original: zas la brten nas gnas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zas la brten nas gnas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is sustained in dependence on food.

original: zas med na ni ma yin te de ni phan yon yin no //
analyzed: zas med na ni ma yin te de ni phan yon yin no //
translated: Without food, it is not. This is the benefit.

original: de ltar zas kyis gnas pa'i lus 'di yang /
analyzed: de ltar zas kyis gnas pa'i lus 'di yang /
translated: This body, which is sustained by food,

original: shin tu yun ring bar gnas pa yang /🔽lo brgya'am / legs par yongs su srung na /
analyzed: shin tu yun ring bar gnas pa yang / lo brgya'am / legs par yongs su srung na /
translated: even if it is sustained for a very long time,🔽at most for a hundred years,

original: de bas cung zad ring du gnas par zad de ;
analyzed: de bas cung zad ring du gnas par zad de ;
translated: if it is well protected, it lasts a little longer.

original: 'di la sngar 'chi ba yang yod do //🔽de la gang dag lus gnas pa tsam la zhugs pa de dag ni legs par zhugs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la sngar 'chi ba yang yod do // de la gang dag lus gnas pa tsam la zhugs pa de dag ni legs par zhugs pa ma yin la /
translated: But it will die before then.🔽Those who are intent on merely sustaining the body are not well intent.

original: gang dag lus gnas pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dag kyang legs par chog shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag lus gnas pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa dag kyang legs par chog shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who are satisfied with merely sustaining the body are not well satisfied.

original: de dag gi ni zas las byung ba'i phan yon kha na ma tho ba med pa dag yongs su rdzogs par nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ni zas las byung ba'i phan yon kha na ma tho ba med pa dag yongs su rdzogs par nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not experience the benefits that arise from food, which are complete and free from misfortune.

original: gang dag lus gnas pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin cing lus gnas pa tsam la zhugs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gang dag lus gnas pa tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin cing lus gnas pa tsam la zhugs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Those who do not consider mere physical survival to be sufficient and who do not engage in mere physical survival,

original: lhag par yang lus gnas par gyur pa de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: lhag par yang lus gnas par gyur pa de nyid la brten nas /
translated: but who, on the basis of that very physical survival,

original: tshangs par spyod pa yang dag @32b par sgrub pa'i phyir zhugs pa de dag ni legs par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa yang dag @32b par sgrub pa'i phyir zhugs pa de dag ni legs par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: engage in the practice of pure conduct, they are the ones who engage properly.

original: de dag nyid kyi zas las byung ba'i phan yon kha na ma tho ba med pa dag yongs su rdzogs par nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi zas las byung ba'i phan yon kha na ma tho ba med pa dag yongs su rdzogs par nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since they experience the benefits of food that are free of any objectionable elements,

original: de'i phyir bdag zas kyi phan yon ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing gnas pa de ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag zas kyi phan yon ngan ngon tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing gnas pa de ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin zhing /
translated: it is not proper for me to be satisfied with just the bare necessities of food and to remain that way.

original: bdag byis pa dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams kyi byis pa'i chos dang mthun par byed pa de yang bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: bdag byis pa dang skal ba mnyam pa rnams kyi byis pa'i chos dang mthun par byed pa de yang bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no snyam du sems shing /
translated: It is also not proper for me to act like a fool and to be on the same level as fools.

original: de ltar zas kyi nyes dmigs rnam pa thams cad du rdzogs par shes nas /
analyzed: de ltar zas kyi nyes dmigs rnam pa thams cad du rdzogs par shes nas /
translated: Having understood in all ways the faults of food,

original: de de las so sor brtags te /🔽nyes dmigs su lta zhing /
analyzed: de de las so sor brtags te / nyes dmigs su lta zhing /
translated: he should examine them individually.🔽He should see the faults of food

original: nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol la /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol la /
translated: and seek liberation.

original: zas las nges par 'byung bar bya ba kho na'i don du //
analyzed: zas las nges par 'byung bar bya ba kho na'i don du //
translated: He should eat food only for the sake of liberation.

original: bu'i sha lta bu'i zas dag za bar byed do //
analyzed: bu'i sha lta bu'i zas dag za bar byed do //
translated: He should eat food as if it were the flesh of his own son.

original: de 'di snyam du yang sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du yang sems te /
translated: He should think as follows:

original: de ltar sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag de dag gis longs spyod dag dka' bas yang dag par bsgrubs shing yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i nyes dmigs mang po dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa po dang sbyin bdag de dag gis longs spyod dag dka' bas yang dag par bsgrubs shing yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i nyes dmigs mang po dag nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Those benefactors and donors who have obtained these enjoyments through great hardship and have experienced many faults arising from the pursuit of wealth

original: pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag rab tu btsir zhing /
analyzed: pags pa dang / sha dang / khrag rab tu btsir zhing /
translated: have drained their skin, flesh, and blood.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'bras bu khyad par can 'dod pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par can 'dod pas /
translated: Those who desire special fruits

original: rjes su snying brtse ba'i phyir sbyin par byed pas na /
analyzed: rjes su snying brtse ba'i phyir sbyin par byed pas na /
translated: give out of compassion.

original: bdag gis kyang de ltar thob pa'i bsod nams de las ci nas kyang de dag gi bya ba byas pa de dag shin tu 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / snang ba che ba dang / rgya che bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang de ltar thob pa'i bsod nams de las ci nas kyang de dag gi bya ba byas pa de dag shin tu 'bras bu che ba dang / phan yon che ba dang / snang ba che ba dang / rgya che bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: In whatever way I can, I will perform the actions of those who have attained such a state. I will make sure that their actions are of great fruit, of great benefit, of great radiance, and of great extent.

original: zla ba ltar khyim rnams su rgyu zhing lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa dang / ngo tsha dang ldan pa dang ; spyi brtol med pa dang / bdag la mi stod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / ji ltar rang gi sa thob na dga' zhing yid bde bar gyur pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis thob na yang dga' zhing yid bde bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: zla ba ltar khyim rnams su rgyu zhing lus dben pa dang / sems dben pa dang / ngo tsha dang ldan pa dang ; spyi brtol med pa dang / bdag la mi stod pa dang / gzhan la mi smod pa dang / ji ltar rang gi sa thob na dga' zhing yid bde bar gyur pa de bzhin du gzhan gyis thob na yang dga' zhing yid bde bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Like the moon, I will move through the houses, my body secluded, my mind secluded, with a sense of shame, without arrogance, not praising myself, not disparaging others, and just as I am delighted and happy when I attain my own stage, so too I will be delighted and happy when others attain it.

original: rab tu byung nas gzhan gyi khyim dag tu bdag la gzhan gyis ster bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rab tu byung nas gzhan gyi khyim dag tu bdag la gzhan gyis ster bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Having gone forth, I will not be given to others by others in other households.

original: mi ster bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi ster bar mi 'gyur ba dang / bsnyen bkur byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: I will be honored,

original: bsnyen bkur mi byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / mang po ster gyi nyung du ma yin pa dang / bzang po ster gyi ngan pa ma yin pa dang / myur bar ster gyi 'gyangs te ma yin pa de lta bu lta ga la rnyed snyam pa @33a * //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur mi byed par mi 'gyur ba dang / mang po ster gyi nyung du ma yin pa dang / bzang po ster gyi ngan pa ma yin pa dang / myur bar ster gyi 'gyangs te ma yin pa de lta bu lta ga la rnyed snyam pa @33a * //
translated: How could I find such a thing?

original: de lta bu'i sems kyis kyang /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems kyis kyang /
translated: With such a mind,

original: khyim rnams su rgyu bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: khyim rnams su rgyu bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: he goes to the houses.

original: bdag de lta bu'i sems kyis khyim rnams su rgyu ba na /
analyzed: bdag de lta bu'i sems kyis khyim rnams su rgyu ba na /
translated: When I go to the houses with such a mind,

original: gal te gzhan dag gis ma byin na yang /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dag gis ma byin na yang /
translated: if others do not give,

translated: living without hardship.

original: de la dka' bas 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dka' bas 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is living through hardship?

original: zas ci lta bu zos na bkres pa'am /
analyzed: zas ci lta bu zos na bkres pa'am /
translated: Whatever kind of food he eats, he is hungry,🔽weak,

original: nyam chung ba'am /
analyzed: nyam chung ba'am /
translated: and

original: gnod par 'gyur ba'am /🔽sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: gnod par 'gyur ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: or if it is harmful,🔽or if it is painful,

original: nad tshabs che bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: nad tshabs che bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or if it is a serious illness,

original: chos ma yin pas bsod snyoms yongs su slong zhing /
analyzed: chos ma yin pas bsod snyoms yongs su slong zhing /
translated: or if he is begging for alms through non-Dharma,

original: chos kyis ma yin pa'am /🔽chags pa'am / zhen pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyis ma yin pa'am / chags pa'am / zhen pa'am /
translated: not through Dharma,🔽or if he is enjoying himself with attachment,🔽with clinging,

original: chums pa dang / mdud pa por ba dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chums pa dang / mdud pa por ba dang / brgyal ba dang / lhag par chags pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'am /
translated: with greed, with grasping, with excessive attachment, with excessive grasping,

original: de'i lus lci zhing las su mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: de'i lus lci zhing las su mi rung ba'am /
translated: or if his body is heavy and unfit for work,

original: spong @35a * //
analyzed: spong @35a * //
translated: or if he is unable to give up,

original: mi bzod par 'gyur zhing des de'i sems bul bar mnyam par 'jog pa'am /
analyzed: mi bzod par 'gyur zhing des de'i sems bul bar mnyam par 'jog pa'am /
translated: or if his mind is slow to enter into meditative concentration,

original: tshegs chen pas dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: tshegs chen pas dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or if he breathes in and out with great difficulty,

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sems kun nas dkris par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sems kun nas dkris par 'gyur te /
translated: or if his mind is completely bound up with lethargy and sleepiness,

original: de ni dka' bas 'tsho ba zhes /
analyzed: de ni dka' bas 'tsho ba zhes /
translated: then that is called “living a life of difficulty.”

original: bya'o ; ; dka' ba ma yin pas 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o ; ; dka' ba ma yin pas 'tsho ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is “living a life without difficulty”?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: zas ci lta bu zos na bkres pa'am /
analyzed: zas ci lta bu zos na bkres pa'am /
translated: If he eats food that is not harmful,

original: nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: He does not become weak,

original: gnod pa'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /🔽nad tshabs che bar mi 'gyur ba dang / chos kyis bsod snyoms yongs su tshol zhing /
analyzed: gnod pa'am / sdug bsngal ba'am / nad tshabs che bar mi 'gyur ba dang / chos kyis bsod snyoms yongs su tshol zhing /
translated: or harmed, or miserable,🔽or sick, or afflicted with a serious illness.🔽He enjoys the alms of the Dharma,

original: chos ma yin bsam yin pa'am /
analyzed: chos ma yin bsam yin pa'am /
translated: not the alms of non-Dharma.

original: chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / chums pa med pa dang / mdud pa por ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / chums pa med pa dang / mdud pa por ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa'am /
translated: He enjoys them without attachment, without clinging, without greed, without bondage, without fainting, without excess, and without becoming excessive.

original: de'i lus mi lci zhing las su rung ba'am /
analyzed: de'i lus mi lci zhing las su rung ba'am /
translated: His body is not heavy, but is fit for work.

original: spong bzod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: spong bzod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: He is able to endure the practice of abandonment.

original: des de'i sems myur du mnyam par 'jog pa'am /🔽tshegs chung dus dbugs rngub pa'am /
analyzed: des de'i sems myur du mnyam par 'jog pa'am / tshegs chung dus dbugs rngub pa'am /
translated: His mind quickly becomes concentrated.

original: dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: He breathes in and out with little difficulty.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sems kun nas dkris par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis sems kun nas dkris par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: His mind is not bound up with drowsiness and torpor.

original: de ni dka' ba ma yin pas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dka' ba ma yin pas 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “living without difficulty.”

original: de la dka' bas 'tsho ba gang yin pa des ni lus kyi srog gnas par byed la /
analyzed: de la dka' bas 'tsho ba gang yin pa des ni lus kyi srog gnas par byed la /
translated: The life of one who lives by difficulty is maintained by the body,

original: de yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: de yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin no //
translated: but it is accompanied by wrongdoing and is defiled.

original: de la dka' ba ma yin pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa des ni /
analyzed: de la dka' ba ma yin pas 'tsho ba gang yin pa des ni /
translated: The life of one who lives without difficulty

original: lus kyi srog kyang gnas par byed la /
analyzed: lus kyi srog kyang gnas par byed la /
translated: is maintained by the body,

original: de yang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa yin no //
translated: but it is not accompanied by wrongdoing and is undefiled.

original: de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni /🔽kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyis 'tsho ba yongs su spong zhing /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyis 'tsho ba yongs su spong zhing /
translated: The noble disciple who is learned🔽abandons the life accompanied by wrongdoing and defilement,

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'tsho ba len cing so sor sten par byed pas na /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'tsho ba len cing so sor sten par byed pas na /
translated: and takes up and follows the life not accompanied by wrongdoing and defilement.

original: de'i phyir 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the life of the noble disciple is for the sake of living.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'tsho bar sngar smos pa de yang ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i 'tsho bar sngar smos pa de yang ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: How does one maintain a livelihood that is irreproachable and free of afflictions?

original: smras pa / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa @35b la phan par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang /
analyzed: smras pa / bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa @35b la phan par bya ba dang / tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba dang / gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag 'tsho zhing stobs dang /
translated: It is said that one should think, “I will eat in order to eliminate hunger, to maintain and benefit my celibacy, to eliminate old feelings and to prevent new ones from arising, and so that I may live, be free from illness, be strong,

original: bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa yin zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: happy, irreproachable, and experience contact with pleasure.”

original: de ltar so sor sten par byed pa na /
analyzed: de ltar so sor sten par byed pa na /
translated: When one practices in this way,

original: 'tsho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med par byed pa yin no //
translated: one maintains a livelihood that is irreproachable and free of afflictions.

original: de la ji ltar na bkres pa bsal ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bkres pa bsal ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one eat in order to eliminate hunger?

original: gang gi tshe zas kyi dus la bab cing bkres par gyur pa'i tshe /🔽bkres pa'i kun nas dkris pa bru ba tsha zhing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zas kyi dus la bab cing bkres par gyur pa'i tshe / bkres pa'i kun nas dkris pa bru ba tsha zhing /
translated: When the time comes to eat and you are hungry,🔽you should eat in order to eliminate the affliction of hunger, the burning sensation of hunger, and weakness.

original: nyam chung ba de nyid bsal ba'i phyir za bar byed pa dang / de yang ji ltar zos na 'di lta ste /🔽phye ma red kyi dus sam /🔽nam sros par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: nyam chung ba de nyid bsal ba'i phyir za bar byed pa dang / de yang ji ltar zos na 'di lta ste / phye ma red kyi dus sam / nam sros par gyur pa'am /
translated: And how should you eat?🔽In the morning,🔽in the evening,

original: sang gi zas kyi dus la ma bab pa'i bar du /
analyzed: sang gi zas kyi dus la ma bab pa'i bar du /
translated: or at any time when the time for the next meal has not yet arrived,

original: dus ma yin par bkres shing nyam chung bas de la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i tshod tsam du za bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dus ma yin par bkres shing nyam chung bas de la gnod par mi 'gyur ba'i tshod tsam du za bar byed pa yin te /
translated: you should eat in moderation so as not to harm yourself with untimely hunger and weakness.

original: de ltar na bkres pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bkres pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, you should eat food in order to eliminate hunger.

original: ji ltar na tshangs par spyad pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshangs par spyad pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How should you eat food in order to benefit pure conduct?

original: zas de lta bu za zhing tshod ran par za ba ste /
analyzed: zas de lta bu za zhing tshod ran par za ba ste /
translated: You should eat that kind of food in moderation.

original: des dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ste /
analyzed: des dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ste /
translated: You should be diligent in the practice of virtue.

original: zos ma thag pa de kho na'i tshe'am /
analyzed: zos ma thag pa de kho na'i tshe'am /
translated: Immediately after eating,

original: de nyid kyi nyin mo lus mi lci zhing /
analyzed: de nyid kyi nyin mo lus mi lci zhing /
translated: On that very day, the body is not heavy.

original: las su rung ba dang spong bzod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las su rung ba dang spong bzod par 'gyur te /
translated: It becomes serviceable and able to endure the practice of giving up.

original: des na de'i sems myur du mnyam par 'jog pa dang / tshegs chung dus dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung bar 'gyur ba dang / gnyid dang rmugs pas sems kun nas dkris par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des na de'i sems myur du mnyam par 'jog pa dang / tshegs chung dus dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung bar 'gyur ba dang / gnyid dang rmugs pas sems kun nas dkris par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, the mind quickly becomes concentrated, and it is easy to inhale and exhale. Sleepiness and drowsiness do not completely enwrap the mind.

original: des na de myur ba kho nar ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba yod cing mthu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de myur ba kho nar ma thob pa thob par bya ba dang / ma rtogs pa rtogs par bya ba dang / mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i skal ba yod cing mthu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is possible and powerful to quickly attain what has not been attained, to realize what has not been realized, and to actualize what has not been actualized.

original: de ltar na tshangs par spyad pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir zas za par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshangs par spyad pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir zas za par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, one eats food in order to benefit pure conduct.

original: ji ltar na tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one eat food in order to abandon old feelings?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: des 'das pa'i dus su zas kyi tshod ma ran pa'am /
analyzed: des 'das pa'i dus su zas kyi tshod ma ran pa'am /
translated: In the past, one ate food that was not the right amount.

original: mi 'phrod pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'phrod pa'am /
translated: or that it is not suitable,🔽🔽

original: ma zhu bar zos pas /
analyzed: ma zhu bar zos pas /
translated: he eats what is unwholesome or indigestible.

original: des de'i lus la lus kyi nad rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des de'i lus la lus kyi nad rnam pa sna tshogs 'di lta ste /
translated: As a result, various kinds of physical illnesses arise in his body, such as🔽itching, leprosy, abscesses, and so on, as previously described in detail.

original: @36a * // g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / sha bkra la sogs pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa lta bu dag dang / nad de'i rgyu las byung ba'i lus kyi tshor ba sdug bsngal mi bzad pa /
analyzed: @36a * // g-ya' ba dang / mdze dang / phol mig dang / sha bkra la sogs pa rgyas par sngar bstan pa lta bu dag dang / nad de'i rgyu las byung ba'i lus kyi tshor ba sdug bsngal mi bzad pa /
translated: And he experiences unbearable,

original: rtsub pa / tsha ba /🔽yid du mi 'ong ba dag byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: rtsub pa / tsha ba / yid du mi 'ong ba dag byung bar gyur na /
translated: rough, hot,🔽and unpleasant physical sensations that arise from the causes of those illnesses.🔽In order to pacify those illnesses

original: des nad de dag zhi bar bya ba dang / de dag gi rgyu las byung ba sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des nad de dag zhi bar bya ba dang / de dag gi rgyu las byung ba sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and the unpleasant physical sensations that arise from their causes,

original: sman pas bstan pa'i sman phan pa mthun pa 'phrod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa sna tshogs dag la so sor bsten cing /
analyzed: sman pas bstan pa'i sman phan pa mthun pa 'phrod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa sna tshogs dag la so sor bsten cing /
translated: he relies on various kinds of beneficial, suitable, and appropriate medicines that are prescribed by physicians.

original: zas 'phrod pa dag kyang za bar byed do //
analyzed: zas 'phrod pa dag kyang za bar byed do //
translated: And he eats suitable foods.

original: des na de'i nad dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyes pa de dag spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de'i nad dang / de'i rgyu las byung ba sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba skyes pa de dag spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the disease and the feeling of suffering that arises from its cause will be eliminated.

original: de ltar na tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba rnying rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one eats food in order to eliminate old feelings.

original: ji ltar na tshor ba gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshor ba gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one eat food in order to not produce new feelings?

original: de da ltar byung ba'i dus na bde zhing nad med la stobs dang ldan pa'i tshe /🔽zas kyi tshod ma rig pa dang / mi 'phrod pa dang / ma zhu bar mi zabs des de la ma 'ongs pa'i dus sang ngam /
analyzed: de da ltar byung ba'i dus na bde zhing nad med la stobs dang ldan pa'i tshe / zas kyi tshod ma rig pa dang / mi 'phrod pa dang / ma zhu bar mi zabs des de la ma 'ongs pa'i dus sang ngam /
translated: When one is happy, healthy, and strong in the present,🔽one should not eat food in excess, or eat what is unwholesome or indigestible.

original: gnangs dag tu de'i lus la gsud pa'am /
analyzed: gnangs dag tu de'i lus la gsud pa'am /
translated: This will prevent one’s body from becoming afflicted in the future,🔽whether tomorrow or the next day.

original: lus kyi nang gang yang rung ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lus kyi nang gang yang rung ba 'di lta ste /
translated: One’s body may become afflicted in any of the following ways:

original: g-ya' ba dang / phol mig dang / mdze dang / sha bkra la sogs te /
analyzed: g-ya' ba dang / phol mig dang / mdze dang / sha bkra la sogs te /
translated: itching, blisters, leprosy, vitiligo, and so on.

original: rgyas par sngar bstan pa lta bu dag dang / nad de'i rgyu las byung ba lus kyi tshor ba snga ma lta bu dag lus la 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyas par sngar bstan pa lta bu dag dang / nad de'i rgyu las byung ba lus kyi tshor ba snga ma lta bu dag lus la 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: the former bodily feelings that arise from the cause of that disease do not arise in the body.

original: de ltar na tshor ba gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir zas zab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba gsar rnams mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir zas zab par byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in order to prevent the arising of new feelings, one should eat food in moderation.

original: ji ltar na bdag 'tsho zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag 'tsho zhing /
translated: How does one eat food thinking,🔽“I will live happily,

original: stobs dang / bde ba dang ; gzhan kha na ma thob med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam nas zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: stobs dang / bde ba dang ; gzhan kha na ma thob med pa dang / bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur ro snyam nas zas za bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: with strength, well-being, and without blame, and will dwell in contact with pleasant feelings”?

original: re zhig zos na 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de 'tsho ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig zos na 'tsho bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de 'tsho ba yin no //
translated: First, that by which one lives when one has eaten is living.

original: bkres pa dang nyam chung ba sel par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: bkres pa dang nyam chung ba sel par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i stobs yin no //
translated: That which removes hunger and weakness is strength.

original: tshor ba rnying rnams spong ba dang / gsar rnams mi skye bar phyed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bde ba yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba rnying rnams spong ba dang / gsar rnams mi skye bar phyed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bde ba yin no //
translated: That which removes old feelings and prevents new ones from arising is well-being.

original: chos kyis bsod snyoms yongs su blangs nas /
analyzed: chos kyis bsod snyoms yongs su blangs nas /
translated: Having accepted alms in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i kha na ma tho ba @36b med pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pas yongs su longs spyod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni de'i kha na ma tho ba @36b med pa yin no //
translated: This is his absence of reproach.

original: zos nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin du lus lce bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zos nas rgyas par snga ma bzhin du lus lce bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: After eating, as before, his body is not heavy and unfit for work.🔽He is fit for work and able to endure it.

original: las su rung ba dang / sbong bzod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i bde ba la reg par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: las su rung ba dang / sbong bzod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de'i bde ba la reg par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is his pleasant abiding.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la /🔽rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin ;🔽rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la / rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin ; rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: Therefore, he eats food after careful consideration.

original: sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: sgeg pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: He does not eat for the sake of sport,🔽for the sake of intoxication,🔽for the sake of physical attractiveness,

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par snga ma bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: and for the sake of adornment.

original: de ni re zhig zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa yin no //
translated: This is the extensive explanation of the discernment of the right amount of food.

original: don mdor ba sdu ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: don mdor ba sdu ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the brief explanation of its meaning?

original: smras pa / gang la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / ji ltar yongs su longs spyod pa de ni don mdor bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gang la yongs su longs spyod pa dang / ji ltar yongs su longs spyod pa de ni don mdor bsdu ba yin no //
translated: He said: The meaning in brief is: what is enjoyed and how it is enjoyed.

original: de la gang la yongs su longs spyod par byed pa yin zhe na /

translated: By not relishing food, the mind will not be drawn to, and will not engage in, those very sinful, unwholesome thoughts.

original: des de rnams par rtog pas kun nas dkrugs pa las byung ba'i @38b bde ba la reg par gnas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des de rnams par rtog pas kun nas dkrugs pa las byung ba'i @38b bde ba la reg par gnas pa ma yin par mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He does not remain in contact with the pleasure that arises from the disturbance of conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na tshig de dag thams cad kyis ni zas la ran par byed pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na tshig de dag thams cad kyis ni zas la ran par byed pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, all of these passages teach moderation in eating.

original: de ni zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid kyi rgyas pa dang mdor bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zas kyi tshod rig pa nyid kyi rgyas pa dang mdor bsdus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation and the brief presentation of moderation in eating.

original: nam gyi cha stong dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽de la nam gyi cha stod ni gang /
analyzed: nam gyi cha stong dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid gang zhe na / de la nam gyi cha stod ni gang /
translated: What is the practice of not lying down during the first or last part of the night?🔽What is the first part of the night?

original: nam gyi cha smad ni gang /
analyzed: nam gyi cha smad ni gang /
translated: What is the last part of the night?

original: mi nyal bar sbyor ba ni gang /
analyzed: mi nyal bar sbyor ba ni gang /
translated: What is the practice of not lying down?

original: mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid ni gang zhe na /🔽de la nam gyi cha stong ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid ni gang zhe na / de la nam gyi cha stong ni 'di yin te /
translated: What is the practice of not lying down during the first or last part of the night?

original: phye ma red nyid ma nub pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: phye ma red nyid ma nub pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: The first part of the night is the time from sunset until the watch of the night has elapsed.🔽The last part of the night is the time from the watch of the night until dawn.

original: nam gyi srod kyi cha me la tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gyi bar gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nam gyi srod kyi cha me la tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gyi bar gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the last watch of the night, and the rest of the night is the last part of the night.

original: de la nam gyi cha smad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la nam gyi cha smad ni 'di yin te /
translated: The last part of the night is

original: nam gyi tho rangs kyi cha la mel tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nam gyi tho rangs kyi cha la mel tshe thun gcig lhag tsam gang yin pa'o //
translated: the last watch of the night, and the rest of the night is the last part of the night.

original: de la mi nyal bar sbyor ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi nyal bar sbyor ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The practice of not lying down is

original: nyin mo 'chags pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: nyin mo 'chags pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: during the day, he practices walking and sitting, and he purifies his mind of obstructive phenomena.

original: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed la /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i thun dang po la yang 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed la /
translated: In the first watch of the night, he also practices walking and sitting, and he purifies his mind of obstructive phenomena.

original: yongs su sbyangs nas de'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang nas phyir phyung ste /
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs nas de'i 'og tu gtsug lag khang nas phyir phyung ste /
translated: After purifying, he then leaves the monastery,

original: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol du rkang pa bkrus nas /
translated: washes his feet outside the monastery,

original: gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te /🔽glo g-yas pa phab nas /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nang du zhugs te / glo g-yas pa phab nas /
translated: and enters the monastery.🔽He lies down on his right side,

original: rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag ste /
analyzed: rkang pa rkang pa'i steng du bzhag ste /
translated: placing one foot on top of the other,🔽and falls asleep.

original: snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan ba kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal par byed pa dang / de mtshan mo'i thun tham la yang myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur pa'i chos rnams las sems yongs su spyod par byed pa yin te zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i 'du shes dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan ba kho na'i 'du shes yid la byed bzhin du nyal par byed pa dang / de mtshan mo'i thun tham la yang myur ba myur ba kho nar sad par byas nas 'chag pa dang 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur pa'i chos rnams las sems yongs su spyod par byed pa yin te zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: And in the last part of the night he should get up quickly and, by walking and sitting, he should purify his mind of any obscurations.

original: de la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is how he should strive in practice, not sleeping.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He should think:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi mi nyal bar sbyor ba thos nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi mi nyal bar sbyor ba thos nas /
translated: “The Blessed Buddhas, the Tathagatas, have taught that the practice of the disciples is to not sleep.

original: de la slob bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: de la slob bar 'dod cing /
translated: I want to train in that.

original: de de ltar gyur nas /🔽ma nyal ba de nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de de ltar gyur nas / ma nyal ba de nyid las brtsams te /
translated: I will do it.

original: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i mi nyal bar sbyor ba bsgrub par bya'o @39a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis rjes su gnang ba'i mi nyal bar sbyor ba bsgrub par bya'o @39a * //
translated: I will practice the practice of not sleeping that was taught by the Buddha.

original: zhes de'i rjes su 'dun pa dang / brtson pa dang / 'bad pa dang / rtsol ba dang / sgrim pa dang / mthu skyed pa dang / rtsom pa dang / dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang sems rab tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: zhes de'i rjes su 'dun pa dang / brtson pa dang / 'bad pa dang / rtsol ba dang / sgrim pa dang / mthu skyed pa dang / rtsom pa dang / dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang sems rab tu 'dzin cing /
translated: It is the will, the effort, the exertion, the perseverance, the non-slackening, the non-flinching, the vigor, the resoluteness, the non-discouragement, the mindfulness, the awareness, and the mental activity that is directed towards this.

original: rgyun du chud par byed pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: rgyun du chud par byed pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: It is the constant application of the mind to this.

original: ; de la ji ltar na nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su spyod par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ; de la ji ltar na nyin mo 'chag pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su spyod par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one purify one’s mind during the day through walking and sitting?

original: nyin mo zhes bya ba ni nyi ma 'char ka'i dus nas bzung ste /🔽nyi ma nub ka'i bar gyi dus gang yin pa'o //🔽'chag ba zhes bya ba ni 'chags dkyus ring zhing /
analyzed: nyin mo zhes bya ba ni nyi ma 'char ka'i dus nas bzung ste / nyi ma nub ka'i bar gyi dus gang yin pa'o // 'chag ba zhes bya ba ni 'chags dkyus ring zhing /
translated: The day is the period of time from sunrise to sunset.

original: zheng ha cang mi che bar byas pa'i sa phyogs su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zheng ha cang mi che bar byas pa'i sa phyogs su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las gang yin pa'o //
translated: Walking is the physical action of going and returning on a path that is neither too far nor too near, that is even, and that has been cleared of obstacles.

original: 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di nal la khri'am khri'u'am /
analyzed: 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di nal la khri'am khri'u'am /
translated: Sitting means sitting on a mat, a bench, or a cushion.

original: rtsab bting ba'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te /
analyzed: rtsab bting ba'i steng du skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: Sitting means that one sits down on a seat, a low or high couch, or on a spread of grass, etc., and then sits cross-legged.

original: lus drang por bsrangs nas /
analyzed: lus drang por bsrangs nas /
translated: Having straightened one's body,

original: dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dran pa phyogs par gzhag ste /
translated: one should sit with attention focused in front.

original: 'dug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is called sitting.

original: sgribs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga po dag go //🔽sgrib par 'gyur pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgribs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa lnga po dag go // sgrib par 'gyur pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Obstructions are the five obstructions.🔽Dharmas that lead to obstructions

original: sgrib pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: sgrib pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: are dharmas that are conducive to the obstructions,

original: sgrib pa 'dren par byed pa gang yin pa'o//
analyzed: sgrib pa 'dren par byed pa gang yin pa'o//
translated: which are the causes that bring about the obstructions.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang / the tshom dang / sdug pa nyid dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu dang / mun pa dang / nye du dang / ljongs dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang / the tshom dang / sdug pa nyid dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu dang / mun pa dang / nye du dang / ljongs dang /
translated: They are desire for sense-pleasures, malice, torpor and sleep, excitation and regret, and doubt.

original: mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' mgur spyad pa rjes su dran pa dang / dus gsum dang / dus gsum du gtogs pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i chos rnams la sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dang / dga' ba dang / dga' mgur spyad pa rjes su dran pa dang / dus gsum dang / dus gsum du gtogs pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i chos rnams la sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the thought of not dying, the recollection of former laughter, play, joy, and love, and the thought of the three times and the dharmas belonging to the three times which are not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na 'chags pas de dag la sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'chags pas de dag la sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: How does one purify the mind through expansion?

original: ji snyed cig las yongs su sbyor bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji snyed cig las yongs su sbyor bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How many [of the purities] are purified?

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid 'dren par byed pa'i sgrib pa las yongs su spyong par byed do //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid 'dren par byed pa'i sgrib pa las yongs su spyong par byed do //
translated: One purifies the mind from the obscurations which lead to torpor, sleep, and drowsiness.

original: des snang ba'i mtshan ma legs par shin tu rab tu bzung zhing /
analyzed: des snang ba'i mtshan ma legs par shin tu rab tu bzung zhing /
translated: One takes up the sign of light,

original: legs par @39b yid la byas /🔽legs par bsten /
analyzed: legs par @39b yid la byas / legs par bsten /
translated: one thinks about it well,🔽one relies on it,

original: legs par so sor brtags te /
analyzed: legs par so sor brtags te /
translated: one examines it well,

original: de snang ba dang ldan pa dang / de 'od dang ldan pa'i sems kyis g-yogs pa'am /
analyzed: de snang ba dang ldan pa dang / de 'od dang ldan pa'i sems kyis g-yogs pa'am /
translated: and one covers the mind with light and illumination.

original: bla gab med pa'i 'chags na 'chags pa'i tshe 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bla gab med pa'i 'chags na 'chags pa'i tshe 'di lta ste /
translated: When they are staying in the open air, they should do this:

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'am /
translated: They should recollect the Buddha,

original: chos sam / dge 'dun nam /
analyzed: chos sam / dge 'dun nam /
translated: the Dharma, the Saṅgha,

original: tshul khrims sam /
analyzed: tshul khrims sam /
translated: morality,

original: gtong ba'am / lha rjes su dran par gyur nas /🔽dang bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa gang yang rung bas sems yang dag par ston /
analyzed: gtong ba'am / lha rjes su dran par gyur nas / dang bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa gang yang rung bas sems yang dag par ston /
translated: generosity, or the gods.🔽They should correctly teach,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug / yang dag par gzengs pa stod /🔽yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug / yang dag par gzengs pa stod / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'am /
translated: encourage, inspire, and delight others with any suitable object of meditation that inspires faith.

original: nges gnyid dang rmugs par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs ston pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nges gnyid dang rmugs par 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs ston pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: They should teach the Dharma that reveals the disadvantages of sleep and drowsiness, such as

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad ba'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang ; de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad ba'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i sde dang / ched du brjod pa'i sde dang / gleng gzhi'i sde dang / rtogs pa brjod pa'i sde dang ; de lta bu byung ba'i sde dang /
translated: the sutra section, the melodious praises, the prophecies, the verses, the summaries, the declarations, the stories of past events, the stories of great men, the extensive teachings, the teachings on the nature of reality, and the instructions and discussions.

original: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde gang dag thos shing bzung la bstan par byas pa la de dag las rnam grangs du mar rmugs pa dang /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs kyi sde dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde dang / rmad du byung ba'i chos kyi sde dang / gtan la dbab par bstan pa'i sde gang dag thos shing bzung la bstan par byas pa la de dag las rnam grangs du mar rmugs pa dang /
translated: They are the Jātaka collection, the Vaipulya collection, the Adbhutadharma collection, and the Upadeśa collection.

original: gnyid rnam par smad cing /
analyzed: gnyid rnam par smad cing /
translated: They disparage sluggishness and sleep🔽and praise and extol the avoidance of sluggishness and sleep.

original: rnam par skyon du bgrang ba dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid spong ba bstod cing bsngags pa de dag rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha ton byed pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par skyon du bgrang ba dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid spong ba bstod cing bsngags pa de dag rgya cher dbyangs kyis kha ton byed pa'am /
translated: They recite them aloud in great detail,

original: gzhan dag la yang dag par ston tam /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang dag par ston tam /
translated: or they teach them correctly to others,

original: don sems shing 'jal la rnam par rtog par byed pa'am /
analyzed: don sems shing 'jal la rnam par rtog par byed pa'am /
translated: or they contemplate, evaluate, and investigate their meaning,

original: phyogs su rnam par lta ba'am /
analyzed: phyogs su rnam par lta ba'am /
translated: or they look in the directions,

original: zla ba dang / rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma dag la lta ba gtod par byed pa'am /
analyzed: zla ba dang / rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar ma dag la lta ba gtod par byed pa'am /
translated: or they focus on looking at the moon, stars, planets, and constellations,

original: chus gdong 'khru bar byed na /
analyzed: chus gdong 'khru bar byed na /
translated: or they wash their faces with water.

original: des de'i rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa de ni mi skyed la /
analyzed: des de'i rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa de ni mi skyed la /
translated: The non-arising of the fetters of lethargy and sleep that have not yet arisen is not produced.

original: skyes pa ni sangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes pa ni sangs par 'gyur te /
translated: And those that have arisen are eliminated.

original: de ltar na des sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos de las yongs su spyod par byed pa yin no //🔽de la sdug pas sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos gang dag la sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar na des sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos de las yongs su spyod par byed pa yin no // de la sdug pas sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos gang dag la sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing /
translated: In this way, he is purified of those dharmas that are obscurations.

original: ji ltar yongs su sbyong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su sbyong bar byed ce na /
translated: What are the dharmas that are obscurations due to desire, and how does he purify his mind from them?

original: smras pa sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / @40a * //
analyzed: smras pa sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / @40a * //
translated: It is said: He is purified from the four dharmas that are obscurations, namely, desire for sense objects,

original: gnod sems dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dag dang de dag 'dren par byed pa'i chos rnams las yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom dag dang de dag 'dren par byed pa'i chos rnams las yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: malice, lethargy-sleep, and excited speech-grief, and from the dharmas that lead to them.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris ba skyes pa gsal bar bya ba dang / ma skyes pa thag ring du byas pa'i phyir skyil mo krung bcas te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris ba skyes pa gsal bar bya ba dang / ma skyes pa thag ring du byas pa'i phyir skyil mo krung bcas te /
translated: In order to eliminate the fetter of desire for sense objects that has arisen and to distance himself from that which has not yet arisen, he sits cross-legged.

original: lus drang por bsrangs nas dran pa phyogs par ba zhag ste /
analyzed: lus drang por bsrangs nas dran pa phyogs par ba zhag ste /
translated: Having straightened the body, he sits down, having directed his mindfulness to the front.🔽Having sat down, he attends to a bloated corpse,

original: 'dug nas rnam par bsngos pa'am /
analyzed: 'dug nas rnam par bsngos pa'am /
translated: or to a festering corpse,🔽or to a corpse eaten by worms,🔽or to a corpse that is a skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that is a scattered skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that is a red skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that is a white skeleton,🔽or to a skeleton without flesh but with ligaments,

original: rnam par rnags pa'am /🔽rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rnags pa'am / rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa'am /
translated: or to a skeleton without flesh or ligaments,🔽or to a skeleton without flesh or ligaments but with joints.🔽Or he attends to any of the excellent signs of concentration.🔽Or, in order to abandon desire for sense objects,

original: rnam par bam pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par bam pa'am /
translated: in order to abandon longing for sense objects,🔽he attends to a corpse that is being devoured by crows,🔽or by vultures,🔽or by dogs,

original: rnam par zos pa'am /🔽rnam par dmar pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par zos pa'am / rnam par dmar pa'am /
translated: or by jackals,🔽or by various other kinds of animals.🔽Or he attends to a corpse that has become a skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that has become a scattered skeleton,

original: rnam par 'thor ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ba'am /
translated: or to a corpse that has become a red skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that has become a white skeleton,🔽or to a skeleton without flesh but with ligaments,

original: rus god dam /
analyzed: rus god dam /
translated: or to a skeleton without flesh or ligaments but with joints.🔽Or he attends to any of the excellent signs of concentration.🔽Or, in order to abandon desire for sense objects,🔽in order to abandon longing for sense objects,🔽he attends to a corpse that is being devoured by crows,🔽or by vultures,🔽or by dogs,

original: keng rus sam /
analyzed: keng rus sam /
translated: or by jackals,🔽or by various other kinds of animals.🔽Or he attends to a corpse that has become a skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that has become a scattered skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that has become a red skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that has become a white skeleton,🔽or to a skeleton without flesh but with ligaments,

original: rus pa'i keng rus sam /
analyzed: rus pa'i keng rus sam /
translated: or to a skeleton without flesh or ligaments but with joints.

original: ting de 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba dag yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: ting de 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma gang yang rung ba dag yid la byed pa'am /
translated: Or he attends to any of the excellent signs of concentration.

original: des 'dod pa la 'dod chags spang ba'am /
analyzed: des 'dod pa la 'dod chags spang ba'am /
translated: Or, in order to abandon desire for sense objects,

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /🔽'di lta ste /🔽mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / rgyas par snga ma bzhin du chos gang dag thos shing bzung la bstan par byas pa'am //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir / 'di lta ste / mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde dang / lung du bstan pa'i sde dang / rgyas par snga ma bzhin du chos gang dag thos shing bzung la bstan par byas pa'am //
translated: in order to abandon longing for sense objects,🔽he attends to a corpse that is being devoured by crows,🔽or by vultures,🔽or by dogs,

original: kha ton bya ba'am /
analyzed: kha ton bya ba'am /
translated: or by jackals,🔽or by various other kinds of animals.🔽Or he attends to a corpse that has become a skeleton,🔽or to a corpse that has become a scattered skeleton

original: yid kyis brtags pa dang / mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byed pa de dag las rnam grangs du mar 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa la zhen pa dang / 'dod pa la 'chums pa dang /
analyzed: yid kyis brtags pa dang / mthong bas shin tu rtogs par byed pa de dag las rnam grangs du mar 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa la zhen pa dang / 'dod pa la 'chums pa dang /
translated: They are to be examined by the mind and to be fully understood by seeing.

original: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa la rnam par smad pa dang / rnam par mi snyan par brjod pa dang / rnam par skyon du bgrang ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa spong ba rnam grangs du mar bstod pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa la rnam par smad pa dang / rnam par mi snyan par brjod pa dang / rnam par skyon du bgrang ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa spong ba rnam grangs du mar bstod pa dang /
translated: They are to be censured, disparaged, and criticized in many ways, and the abandoning of desire and longing for sensual pleasures is to be praised, extolled, and highly praised in many ways.

original: bsngags pa dang rab tu bsngags pa'i chos de dag de ltar 'du gnas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bsngags pa dang rab tu bsngags pa'i chos de dag de ltar 'du gnas tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa yin te /
translated: They should be attended to in the correct manner.

original: de ltar na de 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa mi skyed cing /
analyzed: de ltar na de 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris pa ma skyes pa mi skyed cing /
translated: In this way, the fetter of sensual desire that has not yet arisen will not arise,

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i kun nas dkris pa skyes pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the fetter of sensual desire that has arisen will be abandoned.”

original: de la gnod sems la khyad par 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la gnod sems la khyad par 'di yod de /
translated: Malice is distinguished as follows:

original: de ltar 'dug nas byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med la /
analyzed: de ltar 'dug nas byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems kho na med la /
translated: Having sat down in this way, he remains with a mind that is loving,

original: 'gran zla med pa /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pa /
translated: without rival,

original: gnod pa med pa /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa /
translated: without harm,🔽vast,

original: yangs pa / rgya chen por gyur pa /
analyzed: yangs pa / rgya chen por gyur pa /
translated: extensive,

original: mi gnyis pa /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa /
translated: non-dual,

original: tshad @40b med pa /
analyzed: tshad @40b med pa /
translated: immeasurable,

original: shin tu bsgoms pas phyogs su mos te /
analyzed: shin tu bsgoms pas phyogs su mos te /
translated: and well cultivated, and he remains having pervaded one direction with a mind full of loving kindness.

original: khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa dang / bla dang / 'og dang / thad kar mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa dang / de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa dang / de bzhin du bzhi pa dang / bla dang / 'og dang / thad kar mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten thams cad khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas pa yin te /
translated: And likewise the second, and likewise the third, and likewise the fourth, above, below, and across, he remains having pervaded the entire infinite world with a mind full of loving kindness.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la rgod pa dang 'gyod pa la ni khyad par 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la rgod pa dang 'gyod pa la ni khyad par 'di yod de /
translated: Excitement and regret are distinguished as follows:

original: de ltar 'dug nas sems nang kho nar yang dag par 'jog par byed cing /
analyzed: de ltar 'dug nas sems nang kho nar yang dag par 'jog par byed cing /
translated: Having sat down in this way, he makes the mind fully focused on the inside,

original: sgrub par byed la rgyud gcig tu byed cing ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed la rgyud gcig tu byed cing ting nge 'dzin du byed pa yin te /
translated: he accomplishes it, makes it one-pointed, and makes it concentrated.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la the tshom gyi sgrib pa la ni khyab par 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la the tshom gyi sgrib pa la ni khyab par 'di yod de /
translated: Doubt obscures this.

original: de ltar 'dug nas ci bdag 'das pa'i dus su byung bar gyur tam /
analyzed: de ltar 'dug nas ci bdag 'das pa'i dus su byung bar gyur tam /
translated: Having settled down in this way, one wonders, “Did I exist in the past?

original: 'on te bdag 'das pa'i dus su ma byung bar gyur pa zhig yin //🔽bdag 'das pa'i dus su ci 'dra bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te bdag 'das pa'i dus su ma byung bar gyur pa zhig yin // bdag 'das pa'i dus su ci 'dra bar 'gyur /
translated: Or did I not exist in the past?🔽What was I in the past?🔽How was I in the past?

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig yin /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig yin /
translated: Will I exist in the future?

original: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /🔽ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na / ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: Or will I not exist in the future?🔽What will I be in the future?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur /🔽ci zhig yod /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ji lta bu zhig tu 'gyur / ci zhig yod /
translated: How will I be in the future?

original: cir 'gyur / sems can 'di ga las 'ongs /
analyzed: cir 'gyur / sems can 'di ga las 'ongs /
translated: Where did this sentient being come from at first?

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas ni gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes /🔽'das pa'i dus la tshul bzhin nam yin pa yid la byed cing /
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas ni gang du 'gro bar 'gyur zhes / 'das pa'i dus la tshul bzhin nam yin pa yid la byed cing /
translated: Where will this one go after dying here?🔽One brings to mind the past in a way that is not in accordance with reality.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la mi byed de /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dus la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la mi byed de /
translated: One brings to mind the future and the present in a way that is not in accordance with reality.

original: de de ltar 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa spangs shing tshul bzhin yid la byed do //🔽des chos tsam dang / dngos po tsam dang / rgyu tsam dang / 'bras bu tsam dang / yod pa'ang yod par /
analyzed: de de ltar 'das pa'i dus dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa spangs shing tshul bzhin yid la byed do // des chos tsam dang / dngos po tsam dang / rgyu tsam dang / 'bras bu tsam dang / yod pa'ang yod par /
translated: In this way, he abandons incorrect mental activity with regard to the past, future, and present, and engages in correct mental activity.

original: med pa yang med par mthong zhing /🔽dngos po med pa la yang sgro 'dogs par mi byed la /
analyzed: med pa yang med par mthong zhing / dngos po med pa la yang sgro 'dogs par mi byed la /
translated: He sees only phenomena, only things, only causes, only effects, only existence, and only nonexistence.🔽He does not superimpose nonexistence on what does not exist.

original: dngos po yod pa la yang skur pa 'debs par mi byed cing /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la yang skur pa 'debs par mi byed cing /
translated: He does not deny existence to what does exist.

original: 'jigs par mi byed de /🔽'di lta ste /🔽mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i chos yang dag bdag kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa yang dag pa'i sgo nas rab tu shes so //🔽de de ltar tshul @41a * //
analyzed: 'jigs par mi byed de / 'di lta ste / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i chos yang dag bdag kyang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa yang dag pa'i sgo nas rab tu shes so // de de ltar tshul @41a * //
translated: He does not fear.🔽He knows impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness correctly.🔽He knows impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness correctly.

original: bzhin yid la byed pa na /
analyzed: bzhin yid la byed pa na /
translated: He knows impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness correctly.

original: sangs rgyas la yang ne ma nur med cing the tshom med la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la yang ne ma nur med cing the tshom med la /
translated: He has no doubt or uncertainty about the Buddha,

original: chos dang / dge 'dun dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / rgyu dang / rgyus bskyed pa'i chos rnams la yang ne ma nur med cing /
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / rgyu dang / rgyus bskyed pa'i chos rnams la yang ne ma nur med cing /
translated: the Dharma, the Saṅgha, suffering, origination, cessation, the path, causes, or phenomena produced by causes.

original: the tshom med pa yin te /
analyzed: the tshom med pa yin te /
translated: He has no doubt or uncertainty about these.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la gnod sems la yang des khong khro ba dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la gnod sems la yang des khong khro ba dang / khong khro ba'i rgyu las brtsams te /
translated: Regarding malice, he begins with anger and the causes of anger.

original: de dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon them,

original: chos gang dag thos shing bzung la zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag thos shing bzung la zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: he listens to and upholds the teachings, as explained in detail above.

original: rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa la yang des rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa la yang des rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa las brtsams te /
translated: Regarding restlessness and remorse, he begins with restlessness and remorse.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos gang dag thos shing bzung la zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos gang dag thos shing bzung la zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: In order to abandon them, he listens to and upholds the teachings, as explained in detail above.

original: the tshom la yang des the tshom las brtsams te /
analyzed: the tshom la yang des the tshom las brtsams te /
translated: Doubt is also like that.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos gang dag thos shing bzung la zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos gang dag thos shing bzung la zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to abandon that, he listens to and upholds the Dharma that is taught in order to abandon doubt.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽de ltar na nges 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa rnams dang / de dag 'dren par byed pa'i sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las /
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no // de ltar na nges 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa rnams dang / de dag 'dren par byed pa'i sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las /
translated: The rest is as before.

original: sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin te /🔽de'i phyir chags pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las /
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yin te / de'i phyir chags pa dang / 'dug pa dag gis sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las /
translated: Thus, he purifies his mind from the obscurations of desire for sense objects, malice, torpor, sleep, excitation, regret, and doubt, and from the phenomena that lead to those obscurations.

original: sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sems yongs su sbyong bar byed cing zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he purifies his mind from the phenomena that are obscurations due to attachment and dwelling.

original: de yang chos kyi dbang du byas te sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa de bstan pa yin no //🔽bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de yang chos kyi dbang du byas te sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa de bstan pa yin no // bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: This is the teaching on purifying the mind from the phenomena that lead to obscuration, in terms of the Dharma.

original: sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos rnams las sems yongs su sbyong bar byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also the purification of the mind from the phenomena that lead to obscuration, in terms of the self and the world.

original: de la bdag gi dbang du byas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag gi dbang du byas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purification of the mind from the phenomena that lead to obscuration, in terms of the self?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sgrib pa gang yang rung ba zhig skyes par gyur na /
analyzed: sgrib pa gang yang rung ba zhig skyes par gyur na /
translated: When any kind of obscuration arises,

original: skyes ma thag tu sgrib pa de skyes pa des /
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu sgrib pa de skyes pa des /
translated: as soon as it arises, that obscuration🔽afflicts the mind, weakens wisdom, and harms the side of virtue.

original: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gnod par byed @41b pas bdag gis tshul dang mthun pa ma yin par rig nas /
analyzed: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa dang / shes rab nyam chung bar byed pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gnod par byed @41b pas bdag gis tshul dang mthun pa ma yin par rig nas /
translated: Having understood that this is not in accordance with the Dharma,

original: ngo tsha bar byed cing sgrib pa skyes pa de dang du mi len par spong bar byed /
analyzed: ngo tsha bar byed cing sgrib pa skyes pa de dang du mi len par spong bar byed /
translated: one is ashamed of the arising of that obscuration, and does not accept it. One abandons it,🔽removes it,

original: sel bar byed /
analyzed: sel bar byed /
translated: and

original: byang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is the one that purifies.
